Reviews.Title: “An unbalanced offer”
Reviews.Author: ceciliaParma_Italy
Reviews.Content: Overall I cannot say it wa a bad experience to be at the Mandarin Orchard, except for the quality/price ratio which was not good. Very busy place. Breakfast and luch presented a numebr of good choices, so the reating there is high, but again, it was not inexpensive !

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the hotel, but the staff are helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Drew I
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have very fond memories of this hotel – from a 10 day stay we had there in 1977. I know this is half a lifetime ago, but at that time The Mandarin (as it was known then) was one of the top three hotels in this city state. Not anymore. Things change, some even for the better over time, but not this hotel, it has lost at least two stars in my estimation. The once magnificent lobby that opened up onto Orchard Road has been replaced by a six-story shopping mall, with the new entrance around a corner on a side street. I say “entrance” because that’s all it is, an entrance. When you walk in you are faced with a bank of elevators, the concierge desk, the bell desk and a passageway through to the new mall. The elevators take you to the new lobby, now strangely located on the 6th floor. The room too had major problems. We had booked (and pre-paid for) a week in a deluxe king-bed room, which is two grades above their basic room, but I swear the room they showed us to was their very basic room. It was very small and dingy, with shower over tub behind a drab curtain, two lights that didn’t work and drab and uninspiring furnishings and décor. I had seen enough! So I had my wife wait for the bags and to instruct the bellman to return them to the lobby as we would not be staying, and I went down to the front desk and politely but firmly told them my tale. Things got better from that moment. Three of the very smart and courteous staff behind the counter got their heads together and seemed to agree that the room we had been shown to was not what we had booked, but as no rooms of that grade was available; would we accept a free upgrade to a suite on an upper floor? They personally took us to look at this suite – we liked it - and accepted it with thanks. The fact remains though that this hotel now caters to a different market than it once did, and I got no inkling of this when I viewed their web site when I was choosing where to stay. The breakfast buffet that we had chosen as part of the room rate was of moderate standard, and on most days was crowded with large groups from Malaysia, we ate there only three times even though we had paid for seven days. It rains sometimes in Singapore, and the hotel taxi policy directs taxis to those who are going to the airport, (separate lines) so if you want a ride just within the city you get bypassed if the airport line is populated! The hotel is still in a great place on fashionable Orchard Road, and we did enjoy Singapore, but the hotel experience dulled the splendid memories we had of its past glories.

Reviews.Title: “So-so Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: moumoulous
Reviews.Content: There was no real wow factor in this hotel, just a typical hotel for suits. Nothing bad, nothing memorable. Staff were polite if a bit rigid. I don't think I would return . There are plenty of other hotels in Singapore. Actually, it is irrelevant what I say, hotels in Singapore operate at pretty much capacity all year round.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Gwynforbrockley
Reviews.Content: Overall we were disappointed with this hotel. On the plus side, the room and the bathroom were a decent size and clean, and the beds very comfortable. But service was poor; the desk staff were friendly and polite, but not very competent or efficient: we were given two rooms with a view of a blank wall, so asked to be moved to ones with some kind of view. Arranging this took an inordinate amount of time and effort, yet it must be a fairly common request. We paid around £220/night for our rooms, yet were expected to pay extra for internet access ($5/hour), which is a rip-off, plain and simple. I've stayed in hotels a fraction of that price where it is free (as it is at cafes and shopping centres around town). Finally, two or our party received bruises from lift doors which close violently and too quickly when stopping at a floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scool_sgm
Reviews.Content: The service we received here was superb, from the time we reached the hotel and stayed for 3 days & efficient billing system. The concierge was even helpful directing me on some tour place I wanted to visit. The housekeeping comes twice so there's no wet towels lying around. The food is good here & the breakfast was heavenly. There's a food court behind the hotel, think the building is called Cathay cinema. Food here is tasty & value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LazyServer
Reviews.Content: The service is good-from checkin to checkout. In room system is excellent, and has to eat the Chicken Rice. Located at the center of shopping district, please bring a lot of money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but need more Value”
Reviews.Author: Johnie666
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel quite a few times already, and the reason is this hotel has a superb location. It is located in the famous Orchard Road. Although the hotel lobby is great but the rooms interior design is quite old and need renovation. One of the great hotel feature is the intrnet connection, it has a very fast connection. I think the hotel should ive free internet to their hotel guests since they pay quite a load of one to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Hotel in a Superb Location.”
Reviews.Author: Nucky24
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mandarin Orchard for 3 nights, we got 3 Premier Rooms for the family. Fortunately, we didn't get to experience the bad stories that I've read about this hotel. As the title suggests, this is just an OKAY hotel (sorry if I have to use that word frequently in this review) with a fantastic location in Orchard Road. Rooms - The Premier room have good size with very simple design. It fits two adults nicely but size only becomes a problem when you are expecting guests just like we did. Beds are just okay and pillows are too soft for my liking. Remote control of the TV and then the cable TV had problems, but it was fixed quickly. Bathrooms are clean, spacious and the shower is great! We got the Orchard Wing room, but we don't have the view of Orchard Road. Service - Slightly above average. We waited for 1 hour to get the rooms that we want. Waiting time for room service takes about 15-20 minutes, we asked for a bucket of ice and we were charged $3 SGD for the delivery (boo!). I mentioned earlier that problems with our TV were addressed quickly (good job!). I forgot to put my laptop in the safe but it remained untouched even after room cleaning. Staff are nice and friendly, especially the Filipinos who are my 'kababayans'. Location - Superb especially if you are shopping. Just imagine all the malls along Orchard Road just a few steps away. 2 MRT stations are near the hotel with Somerset being the nearest (about 5-7 mins of walk). Food - Breakfast buffet is just okay, selection was good but the taste was just ordinary. Very few changes in the food selection for the 3 days that we had our breakfast. Overall: There's really nothing spectacular in this hotel. I can't remember anything that really impressed me, I'm not even sure if this deserves a 5-star rating. It was just okay rooms, okay service, okay food, no seats in their small lobby, no free Wi-Fi, and a small pool. If you are just fine with all of that and staying in Orchard is a huge plus for you, then go for this hotel just do not expect anything grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ken T
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is superb with easy access to many shopping malls in town. Transport is very convenient. Room is good size and cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Those orange gowned ladies whisper the orient and make your stay a dream”
Reviews.Author: Truffie
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the staff. My traveling companion arrived 2days before I did,she was give A room even though her arrival was early. I came later due to a flying problem and when I arrived the desk unlocked the business office so I could reassure my family of my safe arrival(free of charge). Then unpon leaving,we did not know which port to catch our cruise ship,the concierge called til he found out and then escorted us to our waiting taxi with the information. Thanks to all at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: winston a
Reviews.Content: i stayed in mandarin orchard hotel last april 1 to 6. the hotel room we stayed in has pretty good interiors although it is much smaller than pan pacific hotel or swissotel in the marina area and also more expensive. it had free wifi but only on the 2nd to 4th floor shopping area of the hotel. the buffet breakfast was ok but it didn't have smoked salmon which i had come to expect from hotel breakfast buffets. the best part of staying in this hotel is because of it's location which is right at the center of many shopping malls. also, i enjoyed going to the foodcourt at the basement of takashimaya for the ice creams, cakes and different kind of take outs which is just beside this hotel. the shariz shawarma which has a stall right outside takashimaya is also very good. behind the hotel is a cineplex with about 9 cinemas which is very convenient as i enjoy watching movies when i go abroad. lastly, it is also near mt. elizabeth hospital which was the purpose of our visit this time. it's about 5 minutes taxi drive to the hospital or you can walk through paragon shopping mall. it is very likely that i will stay in this hotel when i come back to singapore next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to high end shopping place, clean hotel, friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: AndyBugis
Reviews.Content: If you look for a hotel near Orchard Road shopping then this is a good one The staff was very friendly and speak fluently English The check in was quite slow and we got our room after 30 minutes waiting Very polite room service staff Room condition was good and I love their showers! A tourist can buy "Singapore Tourist Pass" for unlimited train and bus ride for 1,2 or 3 days Good price and you can saving a lot for transportation! Just headed to "Singapore Visitor Centre" which very close to the hotel or the nearest train station "Orchard". I had my breakfast in "Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf" near the hotel as the hotel price I paid was not included for this one. Don't forget to try "Old Chang Kee" which sells Singaporean curry puffs Its located near the hotel. Cheap and delicious :)

Reviews.Title: “Located in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: YennyW76
Reviews.Content: Location: the best for shopping because it is located in the center of many shopping malls in Orchard road. Staff were friendly and nice. Room was clean. We only disappointed with the service from the restaurant. We were booked the room with dinner complimentary. But nobody told us that we have to reserve first. We told the FO that we will have dinner that night, but she didn't tell us that we should reserve. So, we wait almost 1 hour to get our table. But the staff from the restaurant was helpful. So, i think it's no big deal. The swimming pool quite small, but it's okay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best service I've had in my life”
Reviews.Author: carrie_i_NZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Orchard for 4 nights with my partner. Straight away we got upgraded to a suite (I NEVER get upgraded, so this was amazing for me). The room was really great - a HUGE bedroom, 2 bathrooms, and a lounge complete with massage chair! We had drinks in the bar, swam in the pool, and it was all just great, but the best part by far was the service of the staff. There always seemed to be so many staff around, even when you were waiting in line at reception, there would be staff checking to see how you were, assuring you it wouldn't take long etc. The most impressive thing to me though, was that in a hotel that can have thousands of guests, they remember you. As we were waiting at reception, one of the staff asked us what we were doing for the day, and we said shopping etc. On our return to the hotel some 6 hours later, the same staff member made a point of coming up to us, calling us by name and asking how our shopping was. This impressed me more than any hotel I've ever stayed at - for such a huge hotel, it was so personal. Just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, located in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jungl3Boy
Reviews.Content: Despite the varying reviews, this is a very nice "business" style hotel. The rooms are very nice, the service is very good, and the hotel is located right in the middle of Orchard Road (the shopping area of Singapore). The foyer and reception area are a little average (we had to wait awhile to get to the counter) and the foyer feels like an elevator entrance to a highrise building, but then who stays at a hotel for the foyer? I would certainly have no problems staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jason N
Reviews.Content: It was a greatest disappointment from what i expected the five stars hotel of Meritus Hotels and Resorts Group, especially at Mandarin Orchard Singapore. I experienced series of inconveniences upon booking with reservation department when i called up to book 2 rooms for 2 nights stay for my company guests (3 guests). First was on the evening 6th of April. I met the male staff, named John on the phone. He was not professional and knowledgeable about the product knowledge of the hotel at all. When i asked him about the amenities in the room, welcome amenities, assessable facilities for the Deluxe room on corporate - He was just simply saying " I do know know". In addition, He made so much of odd sounds during the conversation on the phone like arhh, uhm, 10th April (repeated continuously). This made me felt so annoying. Second was in the morning 8th April. I met the female staff, named Marry Grace on the phone. I requested to call me back my mobile number in Vietnam, but she did not. So I had to call her up after 15 mins of waiting. Marry was better than John, however she still upset me after receiving my confirmation by email. My guest's name was spelled wrongly even i was asked to repeated the guest names so many times. The price of the room per night was one of the worst. I had been told by John was S $754 NET per room 2nights, inclusive of breakfast and 02 hrs internet, for 2 rooms will be S $1508 NET . Then, Marry Grace told me in the next day was $330 Net per room per night, inclusive of breakfast and 24 hrs internet. However, when she sent back the confirmation by email, it was S $ 330++/room/night, and the other room was S$ 360++/room/night inclusive of breakfast and 24hrs internet. As the same as John, When i asked about the amenities, welcome amenities and assessable facilities, Marry was just simply saying "I do not know". Today, 8 April, Mr. Lay Gin jumped in and took it over from Marry Grace, send back the confirmation by email. Unfortunately, The name of my guests are still spelled wrongly, even i have stated clearly the family name, the middle name, the given name in the email. How great Madarin Orchard Singapore are ! My guests and i have not stayed there yet, but soon. Unfortunately, your staffs have created this impacts, so how can i ensure my guests have a pleasant stay at your hotel in the 10 April ? I have studied and worked in the hotel industry for years in Singapore. I understand about the process of booking, and the product knowledge which the reservation staff supposes to have. In conclusion, it was the ever great disappointment !

Reviews.Title: “Good for shopping.....”
Reviews.Author: Raja S
Reviews.Content: Cant beat the location for shopping. Being from Jakarta I appreciated the convenience to the MRT for getting around town. Fire alarm went off once while I was there which was disconcerting because I stayed at Meritus in Surabaya and checked out when I found out they did not have any kind of a fire alarm system there. But many long time staff members in Spore and it is still one of my top choices when I am there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Orchard location”
Reviews.Author: K_travel_freak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last February. This is my 4th time in Singapore and my 3rd time to stay in a hotel along Orchard Road. We stayed at Grand Central and Four Seasons during the previous two. Location wise, Mandarin Orchard can't be beat because it's right in the center of Orchard unlike the other two which are located at almost the opposite ends of Orchard Road. Check-in We arrived before the 2PM check-in time and were asked to fill out the registration card and come back after 2PM because the room was not yet ready. It was true that there were no chairs in the lobby but I overheard the Front Desk Supervisor tell a guest that guests can sit in the restaurant fronting the check-in counter without any need to order anything. We had a late lunch at the adjoining Mandarin Gallery (convenient) and came back past 3PM. The lines were longer this time and I had to wait in line for maybe 15-20 minutes to get the room key card. It would've been nice if they served welcome drinks to guests checking in. Room Upon arrival in the room, I didn't expect much after reading the reviews here. The room came with a decent view though. True, it was dated but the bed was comfortable and big enough for 2 adults and 1 child. We booked the cheapest room and paid US$505 for 3 nights (via Booking.com) which was not bad for an Orchard Road location in the center of it all. The room was spacious by Singapore standards and even had a work desk and a sofa. The sofa was so old and tattered it needed reupholstering so badly. The bathroom was very clean, had the tub/shower fixture and even had a separate bidet. The blowdryer was this box type built-in device that was screaming 80s. It worked fine, however. Apart from the sofa, my major complaint would be the curtains. When I closed the curtains, I sneezed right away. I'm allergic to dust and I had to take anti-allergy medicine during the time we were there. I can't comment on the food because our rate didn't include breakfast and I didn't order room service nor ate at their outlets. CHECK-OUT Since we were leaving the hotel very early in the morning, I settled my bills the night before. The process was quick although when I went up to the room after settling the bill, the keycard didn't work anymore. I had to go back down and have the keycards reprogrammed. The lobby of the hotel was indeed located at the 5th floor but there are elevators on the ground floor that will take you straight to the rooms. No need to transfer elevators on the 5th level. You need a keycard to gain access to the room floors so security is not a problem for me. Would I stay at this hotel again? Given the right price and if I was in Singapore for shopping, definitely! For me, the advantage of having a great location outweighs the negatives. The other hotel with more or less the same price tag and location as this was Grand Park Orchard but I read in a review that it was noisy. True enough, when I walked to this area at night, there was this unexplained noise that sounded like hundreds of birds chirping all at the same time. It wasn't pleasant at all.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying while in Singapore ...”
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel_585
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore for a 3day/2nite vacation with a friend last month - March 16-18, 2012 to watch the play 'Wicked' at the Marina Bay Sands and to go to Universal Studios. Location : Mandarin Orchard is very accessible to everything. Even if it is not near to the main destinations for this trip, the Somerset station is a 3-minute walk so there is no problem. Universal Studios is right at the Harbourfront station, while Manila Bay Sands has its own station also - Bayfront station. Hotel Room and Access : We requested for a high floor-new wing room and we were granted with a 20th floor Orchard Wing Deluxe Room - Thank you again Mandarin Orchard for accomodating our request. It was a newly built room, that is why it looked good and no complaints whatsoever. There was an elevator that is exclusive for guests that goes to the Mandarin Gallery (shops/restaurants like Jones the Grocer, Marc Jacobs, Armani, etc) and there is also a separate access to the old wing (Main Tower) as well as the concierge. So the elevators are not crowded and they have elevators almost everywhere for every purpose - - you will actually get confused the first time. I have seen comments though on the checkin counters....given that it is a busy hotel, an improvement can be done in accomodating guests for checkin and checkout. There is always a line of about 4-5 guests on both counters....since everything is on the system, processing can still be improved but this didnt turn me off as we were not rushing at any point of our trip. Also, my roommate requested for a face towel and a sewing kit on 2 separate occasions and housekeeping came after 10-15 minutes - this also can be improved in terms of delivery time. Breakfast - Breakfast is very good as the choices are ample. They have a spread of Chinese/Singaporean dishes as well as Continental breakfast choices. I love their tea/coffee machines that give you a choice of tea, espresso, cappuccino, mocha or latte. Overall, I will definitely stay at Mandarin Orchard again whether with family or friends in Singapore. It is worth the amount we paid for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Orchard hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaddoLeicesterUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for just two nights at the Mandarin Orchard and enjoyed every moment. The hotel itself is difficult to fault. It's modern, hi-tech and spotlessly-clean. The staff were attentive, welcoming and always on-hand in the reception area to offer help and assistance should it be required. Our room was situated on the 16th floor. The lifts though are plentiful and swift. The traffic noise from the busy Orchard road below, however, was intrusive and continued well into the early hours before things quietened-down. The self-service selection of food at breakfast time was incredible and more than adequate. Orchard road itself boasts an amazing amount of shopping centre and designer brands. My wife was in her element!

Reviews.Title: “May not recomand”
Reviews.Author: vptsindia
Reviews.Content: This is located on Orchard Road and good for tourist. However, the carpets are stained and staff needs more training. The club rooms have a massage chair which is good. But the total experience is not worth the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisebabes
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as a stop over its on Orchard road the main shopping area so in a great position, reception is on the 5th floor and after a very quick check in we went up to our room. This was very modern clean and even had a massage chair (we both used this after our long flight) large flat screen TV, big bed and it was not to hard large bathroom with plenty of soft towels and lots of bits that my wife likes shampoo body lotion etc. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice all in all a nice city centre hotel would stay again if passing through singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned!”
Reviews.Author: Ali M
Reviews.Content: The location is great but the rooms are terrible! The decor is not even 3 star! Old, stained carpets, no wall decorations, old-fashioned desk and horrible shower. Even the shower handle was damaged! Five star?? Try three with a five star price tag!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Lozza08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Orchard Wing in an art deco type room. Fantastic bed/linen, good water pressure in the shower and enough room to comfortably move around. Was absolutely quiet. Didn't hear a thing at night. Hotel is situated in the middle of the shopping district which was great for shopping and eating. Staff were very helpful. Fitness Centre was equivalent to a small, well equipped gym - had everything you needed for a good workout. Breakfast had something for everyone - was fresh and plentiful. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five stars service!”
Reviews.Author: mela70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in a good position to visit the center of Singapore. The room was clean and quite spacious, people at frontdesk were kind. We reserved a transfer from airport, (we gave to the hotel by email all information about the flight and credit card number) but once we arrived at airport, nobody has come! We phoned the hotel, but nobody knew anything, so we had to take a taxi. Not a five stars service!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location. Not to family-friendly though.”
Reviews.Author: MarkoRamius23
Reviews.Content: We chose this place for our 1-day staycation primarily because of its location in Orchard Road. This is perhaps the trump card behind this hotel: a hotel with a strong heritage and sterling reputation in the heart of the tourist zone. The proximity to the Orchard MRT station helps a lot to all visitors whether on business or leisure. The irony of it is of course the number of foreign staff in the hotel and it would have been pretty bizarre for a visitor who would like to savor the authentic Singapore experience by staying in one of the country's established hotel. We had the opportunity to use the pool which was a 15mx5m affair. Any children would have loved the pool based on the simple fact that it's a swimming pool. The depth of the pool however was about 1.2m deep which means there is limited play here and the lack of a staff monitoring means extreme care has to be taken. Prior to the pool, I had called from the room to room service (the only viable option on the phone) to find out whether there was a changing room there. Twice I had called and nobody had picked up. Nevertheless, took my chances at the pool and viola! There were two fully equipped with showers and toilet facilities. No warm water though. You would want to change at the pool because it would have been simply awkward to walk through the hotel lobby past the hotel's triple three restaurant in your bathrobe and room slippers. More amusing when you walk back dripping wet! Ordered room service for my famished daughter after the swim and i was delighted to see an interactive feature on TV where the menu can be viewed along with full-colored photographs of the dishes. This is a good feature for our foreign visitors especially if they had to wonder what is beef kway teow. Placed the order via the interactive feature and I had a phone call from room service (surprise surprise) to confirm my order some 7 minutes later. I thought that was great common sense to confirm the order just in case the order was placed by some young meddling fingers. Ordered their famous chicken rice from chatterbox and it came about 20 mins later. Food was warm and aesthetically displayed. They were also generous with the condiments. Taste was as good as what would have been served in the restaurant. The bathroom was great and was equipped with a bathtub and a shower stall. The shower equipment (yes equipment) was one of those fancy massage-style shower with 5 shower heads. It took a while to figure out how to work them but it's not that difficult. it am not sure if this was a standard across all rooms though because I was told by the recpeption staff that I was upgraded to a club room in the orchard wing. Water pressure was great though despite being on the 27th floor. Flooring was marble so some care has to be taken when getting out of the shower. The body wash and shampoo was delightful and it had a French-sounding name. I was a bit dismayed when it turned out that it was "Made in China". Well I wouldn't expect to be provided Bvlgari toiletries (like Ritz-Carlton) but surely the hotel could have found a safer source of manufacturing? (Hint: Just remove that sentence on the next batch of bottles). To round it off, room was extremely clean yet not sanitized. I guess the recliner in the corner (not arm chair) gave it a more relaxed feel. Would I stay here again? Most likely not since it does feel like another Singapore deluxe luxury hotel devoid of a certain identity, but the quality of stay means it's a grape at option for any of my foreign friends visiting.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Pointman1955
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great service and very well kept facilitates. To prove the point we got in at 5 AM and when we drove to the drop off area of the hotel is so nice that there was employees there helping us out of the cab and opening doors. The hotel's front desk staff was great, but it was nice that they had a few employees on the guest side on the front desk answering general questions and being helpful. Restaurants are very good. Rooms are very nice. The only detractor for me was the fitness center was not that well equipped. Truly enjoyed my stay for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Fell short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ms_1226
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Orchard gave me a good impression from its website design and friendly telephone operators and I thought it would leave me with a true feeling of Asian hospitality. I stayed there between 9-12 March 2012 and I had wanted to leave my overseas guest with better memories. From check-in, the hotel wasn't very fast and efficient. Many guests came to make complains that their keycard stopped working (in the short span of 3 mins, 2 guests came to make complains) and that got me worried about having to come to the front desk to renew my card on a daily basis. Upon entering the room, I was appalled to find that the furnishings were rather old and needed repair (I stayed at the Orchard Wing on level 23). The lights were not working properly and the floor lamp and desk lamp had to be manually switched on and off. Lighting in the bathroom was also rather poor and I had to call the electrician to check the lights because it was too dim. The mini fridge door was broken so it was leaking water all over the cupboard. Room service took more than 40minutes (and I had to give a miss on picking up my guests at the airport because I was waiting for room service). The towel had obvious stains on them (huge brown patches) and was disgusting to use. Although the hotel is conveniently located in the middle of Orchard Road, I have to say the service standards really fell way short of expectations. This is definitely not an epitome of Asian hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Regency Suite and Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: EugeneChan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mandarin Orchard Hotel for 8 nights (24/02-3/3) and were extremely impressed with the hotel. We booked 3 Premier Rooms. There were several issues during check-in but the subsequent reparations were so satisfactory that we have consequently put the incidents behind us. The reparations included upgrading one of our rooms to the Regency Suite (Room 2526 of the Orchard Wing), which is one below the Presidential Suite, complimentary access to the Meritus Club Lounge on Level 31 for Rooms 2526 and 2521, a bowl of fruit and 2 boxes of chocolate. The Regency Suite was luxurious and extremely spacious. It had 2 marble bathrooms, and a large living area and bedroom. The living area housed a 3-seater couch, a 6-person dining table and easily fitted 2 extra single beds. In the bedroom, there was a King bed, a make-up area, a massage chair and desk. The bed sheets were very comfortable and an exorbitant number of amenities were provided every day including razors, bathrobes, bottled water, English and Chinese newspaper, body lotion and shampoo/conditioner. However, we had to request for more bar soap on several occasions. My room was also served with complimentary Internet access, local telephone calls and 2 pieces of laundry daily. Turn-down service was offered every evening at a time convenient for us. Most of my requests were dealt with promptly and the hotel fulfilled some of my more obscure requests, such as my request for a permanent marker and to replace some flickering lamp lights. All the staff were very professional and courteous but I particularly commend the Duty Manager, Morana Dalimunthe, who helpfully resolved our issues at check-in and ensured that our stay was problem-free. We were treated exceptionally well on the phone by Reception, Concierge and the staff at the Meritus Club Lounge. I think this was in part due to us staying at the Regency Suite. For example, at Reception, I informed an attendant of my room number 2526 and I was immediately directed to the front of the line. The Meritus Club is restricted to guests staying in suites and on floors with access to the Lounge (Levels 26-32 of the Orchard Wing). It was a nice place to wind down: surf the internet, read magazines and newspapers, and eat. The Club serves buffet breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails/dinner every day. The food, which included scallops, prawns, smoked salmon, crab etc., was varied, delicate and presented beautifully. We also had breakfast once on Level 5, which is open to all guests in the hotel. Although there was a greater range of food, it was certainly not as delicate, and the restaurant was crowded. The Meritus Club Lounge was a much better option. The hotel also has a swimming pool and a gym, which is open 24 hours and contains very good facilities. It is centrally located in the heart of Orchard Road, sandwiched in between Ngee Ann City (Takashimaya) and 313@Somerset. Paragon, ION, Tang Plaza and Shaw House are all within 5-10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. Overall, we were very satisfied with the hotel and will certainly consider returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location...location...location”
Reviews.Author: jontowel
Reviews.Content: Well, remember the old saying that what really matters about a piece of property is its location..location and location. Apparently this hotel really took this seriously, so much they forgot that hospitality is (at least supposed to be) also important. The past several years I've tried rooms at both wings. The Orchard wing is better but not by much. Facilities are standard for that price. Breakfast is decent, although on a self-service basis (even for the tea/coffee). Room service/ housekeeping also (just) OK. What i notice as lacking is simply the staff's smiles/the urge to service/pleased customers. Seems that everyone are so focus on doing their job, they forget that making the guest happy is the most important job in the hospitalty business. But then again, they are relatively cheap compared to other bigger names in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start--great ending”
Reviews.Author: maxandrosie
Reviews.Content: Our introduction to Singapore was not good. We had booked a car , via the hotel , to meet us--but they had forgotten! After an hour plus wait and a phone call we were collected. We then hit a horrendous traffic jam and it then started to pour with rain. We thought it could only get better and it did! We were upgraded from concierge level to a suite! Booking concierge was worth it as there is a wonderful buffet of an evening with drinks -- you can just help yourself to as much as you want. Breakfast was also taken in this lounge--the views were great.The staff were very friendly and helpful--altogether we spent 5 nights at this hotel There are plenty of very fast lifts. It is very well placed for every thing as it is half way along Orchard Road ( a shoppers paradise) and near the underground system--which is often quicker than a taxi. The underground is a great way to get about Singapore. It is fast , cheap , clean , safe and air conditioned. I f we got lost every one was so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The work has finished at lasy”
Reviews.Author: Fredex
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Mandarin Orchard after three years as the improvement work was noisy and dirty. Now that it's finished the hotel is once again a haven right in the middle of shopping city! The problem is of course, that it's all the same shops and all at the same prices. I'm sure that this bubble will soon burst.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: senninha888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for 2 nights in March 2012. My room, located on the Club Floor, provided basically all that was to be expected; comfortable bed, working desk, LCD TV, decent bathroom. A few observation however; there is an iron/ ironing board provided but the cable & plug of the iron is far too short and there no plugs, other than the one at the desk, to plug it in. As result, one needs to either iron on the desk or place the ironing board practically over the writing desk. Highly annoying. Also, the hand basin in the bathroom did not drain properly and took several minutes to clear. Irritating. The shower had no water pressure whatsoever, plus the water did not drain here either. As a result, one is ankle-deep in water after 2 minutes... Breakfast is served in the Club Lounge and was OK. They play radio as background music, which I thought is odd, but change back to light classical in the afternoon. I asked the waiting staff to turn down the volume twice. Overall staff is friendly, and the hotel has of course a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel I remember”
Reviews.Author: ElaineFStrathclyde
Reviews.Content: My recollection from 2000 is that this was Mandarin Oriental, but not the case now. Using the Mandarin name, the real ones are down nearer the esplanade. More like a difference between Holiday Inn and Holiday Inn Express and We have had better service in Holiday Inn Express or Premier Inn. Its a large hotel, difficult to navigate. Breakfast was more like a rugby scrum and a school canteen. We tried the restaurant but whilst the food was nice - it was like school dinners. Pricy for the service we got. Really disappponted as its shown as 4 star. Had to bring our own luggage up and down. It was as if we were too much bother. Had to pay £40 for late checkout and the didn't even change the towels. Others 4 * hotels we stayed in - did not. Overheard the European manager bragging in the bar about the way he runs it - explained why we got the service we did! Wont be back and wont recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: JonandVib
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for both business and pleasure and can certainly recommend this hotel. Great location on Orchard Road in the centre of Singapore's shopping district and numerous taxi's available to take you further afield. Helpful and friendly staff but generally a bit of a queue when checking-in.

Reviews.Title: “Just a good location”
Reviews.Author: xingjie
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 hotels for this trip since I have wedding in Singapore then went to Bali for Honeymoon and then back to Singapore. This hotel rate the lowest. why? 1. They charge me 3 dollars when we request for ice. My husband had a injury and had to place ice on his hand. We stay in swissotel Merchant court and they provide the ice FREE OF CHARGE. 2. Like the other reviewer, the shampoo, conditioner is not enough for 2 person. Again, Swissotel provide us with 2 sets the next day and we did not even have to tell them. Also, the swissotel's lotion smell really good. 3. The room is small compare to Swissotel but they charge more. I guess it's the Orchard road. 4. You have to take the elevator to 5th floor to do the check-in and you have to turn right to see the reception desk. 5. I don't even want to mention about the fridge, it's old and had black molding stuff in the far back on the fridge. 6. not kid friendly hotel. I have 10 months old baby and every time I get back to hotel, I have tons of stuff and the person doesn't seem to be helpful. 7. They charge 32 dollars for 24 hrs internet usage. Seriously, I will not return to this hotel again unless it's for shopaholics.

Reviews.Title: “Good location nicely refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Mtyong
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised that the hotel seems new and well maintained despite it being one of the older hotels along Orchard Road. Bathrooms were clean, carpets new lOoking, mostly everything was good. Except for the mattress which was uncomfortable. And also the pillows which make our night's sleep rather difficult. Apart from this, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location, Good Sized Rooms But Not Flawless”
Reviews.Author: jingga18
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I prefer to stay in an older hotel that has been refurbished to the newer ones, simply because of the generosity of space. Mandarin Orchard is a great example of this personal observation of mine. It's obvious that the hotel building is old, but it does not lack of space. I stayed here for four nights in the Main Tower and the location is surely unbeatable. It is at the heart of Orchard Rd with all the major shopping malls within walking distance (Ngee Ann City, Paragon, Ion to name a few). If I'm being very critical, though, there are a few things which stopped me from rating this property 5/5. First is the lobby, which is located on 5th floor. There is not a single seating accommodation provided. It must be a conscious and deliberate decision by the management, one that I don't see the logic of. I had a local friend coming over one day and while waiting he was forced to wander around aimlessly for 10 minutes while waiting for us get ready. I have a suspicion that the management is trying to make guests wait at the bar of Triple 3 Restaurant which is located right across the reception counter. Not long after checking in, our bags got delivered to our room but one of them was not ours. Not a fatal mistake, and certainly one that got solved instantly, however I felt like I should mention this as one of the reasons this hotel is not getting a perfect score in my eyes. Also, the air-con in our room was very warm initially. We reported this to the hotel before going out for dinner. When we came back, the problem had been fixed. I remember staying at this hotel fifteen years ago with my parents and the bathrooms have not changed since then. The rooms at the Main Tower are kept simple and un-fussy. My room was nice and clean although not overly impressive. The bathroom was a different story altogether. It feels like the decor in the room and bathroom is disjointed. The bathroom is what's left from an entirely different era. Gloomy grey tiles, black stone counter top, shower in the bathtub, and the wall-hung hair dryer all look very outdated and tired. On the first night, there was some banging/knocking noise coming from the room right above us. We complained to the Duty Manager and this issue, too, was addressed efficiently and effectively. Wi-fi is chargeable and in this day and age, it is simply unacceptable for a hotel that already charges such a premium to make more money from wi-fi. Since we rely heavily on internet for work, we had no choice but to fork out more money for it. Now I'll move on to the positives of this hotel, apart from the obvious: location. Breakfast menu is one of the most diverse I've ever seen and very delicious. This is a busy hotel with high traffic, which can either be good or bad. In this case, it's definitey good because it's easy to get a taxi (we never had to wait for more than 5 minutes) but it's very quiet in the rooms. Not once did we hear any kids running up and down the hallway or people talking loudly. Last year I stayed for one night at this hotel at the Orchard Wing (which I suspect to be the newer wing). The room was much more nicely decorated and so was the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “great location esp. for shopaholics”
Reviews.Author: lovelylban
Reviews.Content: stayed here november 2009, for a week..'twas my first time in singapore and I really enjoyed it..very accomodating staff..huge room..delicious foods being served..best of all it's walking distance from high end shopping malls..

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: SumeetValrani
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay at this hotel is it's location. It is well located right on orchard road next to the best malls and cinemas.You will find everything else faultless but yet not overly impressive. The rooms a re clean and well sized as is the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the rest were disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HKVisitor8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a good location with lots of shops/malls within walking distance but old, always very crowded at the entrance and front desk area. For the rate I paid, S$450+tax, I expected breakfast to be included and free wi-fi, but of course not. The front desk lady said because I booked at the very last minute, she was not very courteous as if I didn't have a choice. My room was terrible facing the side of the next building, a big tall blank cement wall right in front of my window. All furniture and bathroom are old like back in the 60's!! A place that I will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location no soul”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mandarin Orchard for four nights during a combination business/pleasure trip. The hotel is perfectly located for shopping and business travelers on the best section of Orchard Road. It would not be appropriate for a family with young children. The layout of the hotel is rather odd as the lower floors are a shopping mall and, although the taxi drop off area enters into a lobby, the check in area is on the 5th floor. There are two wings, the Main Wing and the newer Orchard Wing and it is a bit confusing. We stayed in the Orchard Wing. The room was quite nice, large and attractively furnished and looked out over Orchard Road. It had obviously been recently renovated. The bathroom was very big and had a separate shower stall and toilet area as well as a big bathtub. Extremely clean and modern. There is no booklet describing hotel services but if you turn on the TV all the hotel info is available. The amenities were basic no high end brand names but adequate. I had read from other reviews about the lack of hair conditioner, the meager towel supply, and the single bar of soap. Yes, there was only one very small bar of soap and we had to move it from sink to shower to tub as needed. This was easily corrected as I merely asked the maid for soap and was presented with two addition bars. Towel supply varied, sometimes face towels, some days none, some days two bath towels others four towels. Almost comic. Amazingly, there was no clock in the room. These shortcomings, although minor, should not occur in a five star hotel. Wifi was free with our room package, but breakfast was not included so I can't comment on that. We did eat in the Chatter Box restaurant which has been famous for its Hainan chicken rice dish for decades. The restaurant is located downstairs attached to the shopping mall. It was simple coffee shop type decor but the food was good as was the service. This hotel has no atmosphere or charm but it is functional , clean and superbly located. The service was prompt and courteous. Paragon Mall is directly across the street. There is a seafood restaurant in Paragon called Fish & Co. which is a simple mall type restaurant but the fish was wonderful. Try the fish combo cooked and served on a metal plate. There are other branches around the city. The high end ION mall is a short walk west on Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you don't need to sit while waiting”
Reviews.Author: Vuvie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Location is wonderful. I love shopping at Mandarin Gallery! But... was it just me or did anyone notice, the taxi waiting lobby and the actual lobby (for check in etc) does not have a single chair to sit on?

Reviews.Title: “Mind the "misleader"”
Reviews.Author: Nikwil
Reviews.Content: I reserved the room for 2 nights and paid online. When I checked in, I was informed that there are breakfasts provided. The staff of front desk called "Paul Lxx" told me that I could have breakfast in their restaurant opposite to the check-in counter without mentioning the price or charge. Naturally I went to breakfast for sure... I went to have breakfast in the the first morning while my friend had it also with me in the secord morning. In the day of leaving, I was charged SGD135 for three breakfast. It's impossible to refuse the payment since I really had the breakfast. However, I was really angry that I was misled by the staff, Paul, who had not told me the charge of breakfast. By the way, to be honest on commenting the hotel... The location is excellent. The staff overall are polite and helpful. The room is clean but a bit old. The bed is comfy... Overall, it is good except I was faked.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: Ajtua
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right in the heart of Orchard Rd, shopping is only a footstep away! Very modern and clean hotel. Beautiful interior. Clean pool. Personalised welcome upon arrival. Staff helped us out of the taxi and immediately took our luggage and sent it to our rooms. Check-in was easy. Staff were friendly and helpful. Also gave us a travel adapter to use free of charge. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “4 DECADES AND STILL LOOKING GREAT”
Reviews.Author: leon777SG
Reviews.Content: After spending most of my younger days often patronizing this hotel in the mid 70 , for their than leading disco , bar lounge and their ever famous Chatter Box coffee house offering the best Hainanese Chicken Rice which made it so popular to be known as one of the few local delicacy the island has to offer, yet until today to me, is still one of the best in town, the only problem I found was that the present location of the coffee shop is tugged far away in the corner of the hotel instead of a more frontal ideal location similar as during their hay days It is was certainly a fine renaissance for me to stay for the 1st time in this Hotel after been out from Singapore for 2 decades on job assignment and a surprise to find that the hotel is very well maintained after all these years Upon arrival at the hotel lower ground floor, PR personnel and bell hops are very attentive to usher you to the lift for checking in, as the main lobby is situated on the 5th floor, Checking in was a breeze, receptionists are very well trained and ground staffs are all one would expect from a 5star hotel. The room I had was room 2435 on main tower which are ideal in size in line with the room rates, rooms I think has been recently upgraded with nice natural wood decor and bathroom is quite modern same as seen on their website Beds and pillows are comfortable, aircon is quiet and coolness is adjustable all creating a good night sleep after a hectic day of shopping But some small matters such as the sofa although comfy, the cover has seen better days, also housekeeping should take note of the tiles lining in the shower area which is black with mould. (As per picture attached) these minor overlook may sometimes put off some guests at times. The Mandarin Orchard is situated right on famous Orchard Road well known for shoppers and location is one of the best with huge shopping mall such as Takashimiya ( Ngee Ann City ) directly on the left, 313 Somerset on the right, Paragon directly opposite, and with other all major shopping centers, also MRT underground station within 5 minutes walk away. After 3 nights of wonderful stay, on checking out had minor problem of concierge services, as had to call 2 times and waited 20 minutes for luggage pickup which in the end decided to carry bags myself but staffs on main lobby were very apologetic as quite understandable for time taken been a 1000 room hotel and assisted to fast track my checkout. Overall stay was one of the best I had in years maybe largely due to the frontline staffs’ warmness with genuine service to please towards hotel quests and will definitely return to stay in future when I am back in Singapore not only for shopping and food but to bring back fond memories of yester years of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “No seating in the lobby area!”
Reviews.Author: Saifurrbd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in 6 rooms (Family booking through Tradewinds). Unfortunately, upon check-in (a) we had to wait upto 5 hours till the last room was sorted out, (b) we had rooms scattered over 3 floors (b) one of the rooms had a broken toilet and faulty hot water plumbing - this room was however changed on day two. The layout of the Hotel is not user-friendly; though the staff are! There should be better Signage, given that it is a very big hotel with 2 separate wings. The Orchard wing is newer. The hotel is great for a Shopping trip; not so for a Family Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in middle of Orchard Shopping District”
Reviews.Author: MargaretsForest
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel with a 1 year old baby. Reception is 24 hours, which was convenient as we arrived early morning. Check-in staff were accommodating in trying to get us in our room as soon as possible. The general (communal) area is very nice and modern, no expenses spared. We had breakfast in the restaurant every morning, which was buffet style and what you would expect for this standard of accommodation. Personnel were generally helpful, but could be friendlier. Sometimes english was a bit of a problem, which I didnt suspect from Singapore. The room was a bit dusty and tired looking. Our bar fridge broke down and took 2 complaints and more than a day to get replaced with another (old) one. I would consider staying here again, but only if I was travelling without children. The pool is not child friendly and you have to walk through the main check-in area to get to it, which is a bit embarrassing to see guests with slippers and robes walk through the posh foyer. Recommend booking with them direct, we booked through Agoda and that placed some restrictions on the flexibility of certain services, such as breakfast package with the room etc. We came for business and a bit of leisure, so it served our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room!”
Reviews.Author: Vacation888
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room in Mandarin Orchard and was impressed to see the hotel's building did a major facelift. The only negative part is the main lobby which is actually located on the 5th floor. They should have arranged a personnel in-charge of informing all the guests who arrived at the ground floor instead of letting us wait in the line only to be told the main lobby is at level 5 and the ground floor only serve group check-in. Well, little hiccup there but delighted to see a broad smilling receptionist at Level 5 lobby. We got a room in their Main Tower and it was really spacious by S'pore standard. The room had a little bit of facelift, with new cupboards and workdesk. The only dissappointment will be the toilet because it looked a little bit dated but fortunately it was clean. Location wise, you can't ask for a better location. Right at the centre of Orchard road and eateries are easily found every corners. MRT station is about 5 mins walk away. Will choose Mandarin for my next visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lioness64
Reviews.Content: Only stayed two nights on a quick business trip. My room was in the main tower. It was very clean and comfortable. Check in took some time, but that was mainly due to a mistake of double booking, which was sorted, not the fault of the hotel. Had breakfast included and really enjoyed the huge variety of food on offer. Had dinner one night, and again, there was plenty to choose from in the buffet. Couldn't work out the in room wifi and ended up paying for it, which i thought was expensive. The room lacked information about how to use the phone and didn't really have any 'hotel info' booklet. Maybe mine was missing? All in all it was a lovely stay even only for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “quite good but some rooms was old”
Reviews.Author: Ryen112
Reviews.Content: I have an experience stayed at Mandarin at May 2010, it was the first time we stayed. Rooms OK, good view to Orchard Road at Main Tower. I traveled with my 02 kids. I met many Indonesian there. Even, my sister-in-law always stayed at the Mandarin each time she gets medical check up at Mt. E with her family, once she had a very bad experience to have a room that looks worn and fairly a lot of dust. I though, they placed at old building or old rooms. It look like a spooky rooms while in night come. I don't know why it become. Next March at 04-07 '12 is my second stay at Mandarin Orchard, hopefully I can get my previous rooms in NEW Tower with same rooms category in Deluxe with Orchard Rd view. Since I have strongly request to my agent to put us at NEW Tower rooms. And it confirmed by Fennee (pls see my room book under name Yossi Indra D). Thanks..

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: charadf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mandarin Orchard for 2 weeks during a business trip. Dispite the luxury entrance hall and prices, the hotel is run-down with ancient rooms with heavy furniture, gold and mirrors everywhere. I would not say anything if this hotel was 4 stars but, when its 5 stars we need to start taking a look at the details. For example on the two weeks I was there the airdrier fixture was broken and never got fixed, the in-dining menu (paper version) was inexistent, the room bar options were limited. Like I say, small details that make this 5* hotel look like a 4* or even a 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but had a blip during my stay”
Reviews.Author: Tedzski
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing deal when I booked online for this hotel. The hotel is located in the heart of Orchard Road, 5 minutes from Somerset MRT Station and 10 minutes from Orchard MRT Station. The hotel entrance was a bit uncomfortable because it gave the impression of small and cramped area. Then we were directed to the lobby area which is more comfortable. The check in is quick and efficient. When we first arrived at the room our impression was the room are nice and comfortable. But on the way to our room, we smell smoke from cigarettes and yet we ordered a non smoking room located on a non smoking floor. So that was pretty disturbing. Then on the second night, we found a leakage on the sink of our bathroom coming down to the floor. It was brown and a bit smelly. I called guest service and waited until 30 minutes without receiving any response. Then I called again directly to housekeeping and someone from maintenance showed up in about 10 minutes. He then found out that the leak came from the walls of the bathroom. He cannot find a solution since it is pretty late in the evening. He called housekeeping and asked for some extra towels and put it below the sink to prevent the leak from getting into the floor. I reported this to the guest relation and ask if there is a solution to this problem because it is pretty annoying staying in a 5 star hotel with a leak in your bathroom. She said she will bring it up to manager and will come with a solution in the morning. I left her my cell number since I will be out all day on the following morning. So me and my wife went out and did not receive a call. So I was guessing that the problem was solved. But when we returned, the same problem occurred. I had to raise my temper to the guest service and again they can only come with a towel solution. When I checked out the following day, there were not a single word of apology from any of the staff. And when I complained to the receptionist, she said no note were given on the condition of my room. This was pretty disappointing. I expect a superb service from a hotel using the name of Mandarin. But I found out otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “OVERALL GOOD LOCATION ,GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JasmeetCHD
Reviews.Content: After so many poor reviews on tripadvisor i was really afraid for my stay ,but my overall experience was very good ,hotel was spotless check inn & check out was very smooth,staff was attentive though had high heads,location is on the spot you will never miss any thing in singapore if you stay here,But the only problem was with housekeeping very rude on the phone ,anything you want will be delivered after calling 5 times and will be delivered to you in 45 minutes that was only problem i faced but overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: eriktera
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mandarin Orchard 4 or 5 times on business. It is mediocre. The entrance is awful and uninviting, like an underground parking lot with people milling around at all times, and staff that are hit and miss about opening a door and taking luggage. They were always helpful when I wanted to leave a bag though, so that met expectations. Then you take an elevator, to a unimpressive lobby and walk around a corner and down the hall until you finally make it to the front desk. Whoever designed this hotel did NOT have "great first impression" in mind. The rooms are clean, and the service is decent. The room service food is excellent. But the rooms are very small. It is not so evident by myself, but and when my wife and children joined me on this past trip in connecting rooms, even with two rooms there was very little space. I would not go back with a family, and with so many other choices in Singapore at this expensive price range, I will not choose to go back alone either. At more than SGD$300 there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Gracia12
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel when you intend to do your orchard shopping. Rooms are a little dated but we didn't mind as long as its clean and beds are comfortable. Complimentary bottled water throughout our stay (they are generous with refills) and complimentary internet connection. Breakfast has a wide selection. There is no airport transfer. Check in and check out took us quite sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tony p
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meritus Mandarin Orchard for two nights. The location is great (quiet in the middle of Orchard rd). The service was also great, quick check in and check out with a very polite staff and during check out a bellhop was very helpfull on fixing my broken luggage!. They have good promotional rates in the internet (hope its inclusive with breakfast tho). Very helpfull staff as well in getting a cab in the taxi stand (getting a cab is a problem in singapore thesedays).

Reviews.Title: “So-so for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: theprincessw
Reviews.Content: I have very high expectation for this hotel, which didn't fell into place. First of all, I hate the fact that from the taxi/car drop-off to my room,I have to take separate elevators. From the drop off, I've to take an elevator to the receptionist,then walk a bit to the elevator to the room. The only thing that cheered me during the walk is the fragrance that the hotel has, it smelled luxe and glamorous. Then, I feel that the services are pretentious. They would smile when they greet you like its just a procedure, and as you starts to ask questions their tone will sound annoyed. Especially the girl in the cake counter, she was ignorantly rude. I started asking her questions about the cakes, while she was handling a customer's billing. Instead of saying excuse me, I'll get back to you after this, politely. She asked me: 'are you a guest here?' I was shocked, and just to see how she would react, I answered: 'no!' Then, she just brushed me off and took off without any excuse. The room itself is so-so. The size is slightly bigger than most rooms along Orchard street. However, no fancy room design, interior or anything. I guess if you are into dimmed lighted room, you'll be happy. I'm more of a sun lighted room. Even though the rooms has been refurbished, it looks old and lifeless, though still well maintained. My other concern is the amenities, that are hotel branded, while other hotels are starting to supply toiletries from Crabtree and Evelyn or L'Ocitane even for standard room. The only thing I enjoyed about my stay other than the hotel's fragrance are the soft bed, pillows and location.

Reviews.Title: “Never pay your bond with your credit card”
Reviews.Author: edward y
Reviews.Content: Everything was great till i asked for more details on my $500 bond i had to pay for 2 rooms. They told me not to worry about it as they don't give out receipts with the deposit payment details. Even when i left the country they told me not to worry, it would all be figured out when i check out. But when i asked one of the staff they told me it usually takes up to a week to get my bond back. Its been 1 week and still no money in my bank account, i have no evidence that i paid for it as they told me i don't need to worry about the payment and $500 gone from my account. NEVER pay for your deposit/bond in credit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room - strange foyer”
Reviews.Author: jpwilli
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. The cost was very reasonable to the location. Checked in and the room was a bit 'YMCA'. It seems these main tower rooms are unrenovated. Was OK but the fridge didn't work. Got moved to the Orchard wing which faces Orchard rd. These are better furnished rooms and a nicer bathroom. The staff at reception were very keen to assist and we appreciated their help as they did allow us a later checkout because of our delay in getting a room. Problem was that nowhere to sit while they sorted things out. Good choice of english TV stations. Expensive internet $5 per hour. NO CHAIRS AT ALL in the foyer on Level 5 or ground floor - this is just bizarre. Don't buy the story that they can;t get rid of locals who would use them. The position was fantastic just next door to Takashimya, 8 mins walk to Tangs and 4 mins walk to Somerset MRT. Would definately come back as everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and service at a good price”
Reviews.Author: EssexRichard
Reviews.Content: when I decided to stay on in Singapore the Marriott upped the price by 50 percent because of the air show so I looked for another hotel near by and found this gem. It is smart and modern with all the facilities you want and the service and price is great

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very expensive, dirty room, inattentive staff,.”
Reviews.Author: BangkokStu
Reviews.Content: Very expensive hotel in a great location. Cannot even manage a doorman or bell-boy. Not even the courtesy to ask. Many managers strutting around with little direction to staff. Very disappointed. Peanuts - yes peanuts - on the floor in room om arrival. Carpet dirty. Walls stained and shabby.... Pillows sloppy.

Reviews.Title: “Just another building with standard facilities! Restaurant staff is another story!”
Reviews.Author: iQLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and it was an ordinary experience, room was tired, the lobby looks good but shouldn't the hotel be spending some effort on making the room nicer? Thats where we stay right? The breakfast was so so ..it had the train station ambience... and there were way too many wait staff floating around aimlessly (totally zoned out), we really had to wave both arms to get their attention... I asked for salt and pepper shaker which was missing from our table and it was delivered in complete silence (with a totally straight face) .. after 5 minutes the waitress appeared again and without permission or saying anything picked it up and walked away and gave it to another customer. We know not to expect service in Singapore but thats just plain rude. Sorry but doesn't tempt us to go back again. We asked for a high floor so we can take some photos of City view ... we weren't successful because of the dirty windows!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: edikp
Reviews.Content: It had been my first stay at the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located on Orchard Road close to the shopping malls with Mandarin Gallery the closest one, being adjacent to the hotel. The room was clean and spacious, so was the the bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Had to ask for direction and they were very helpful in assisting me. I did not use any of the hotel's facilities such as the swimming pool or the gym. Didn't even go to any of the hotel's restaurants merely because there were plenty of other choices outside of the hotel. Closest MRT station to the hotel is Somerset which is well within walking distance; about 5 minutes. Next closest one is Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it was better”
Reviews.Author: RRGT
Reviews.Content: I had another opportunity to stay at the Mandarin Orchard on a business trip. The hotel was the preferred venue of the meeting organizer but was not actually my first choice, at least for the price. I was hoping it had improved from the time I last stayed there but sadly it wasn't. I was in a room at the Main Tower and admittedly some improvements had been made such as the new entertainment system, which now has better quality TV channels that included a few HD channels, which was a first for me at a hotel in Singapore. The room itself was seemingly refreshed but a few of the facilities were still rather dated and should have been dispensed with. The old love seat in the bedroom, the shower in the bath and the bidet are a few such features. There was likewise a bathroom scale that was grimy and damaged and clearly needing replacement. The bed was also quite odd. It was a queen sized bed, which you would not typically find in a hotel of this category. Admittedly it was comfortable and I did not have any issues sleeping but usually you would expect a king sized bed. I also found that a few comments from previous reviewers on the lack of face towels as well as turndown service were indeed true. Now these are small things in my view but if you are competing with other hotels in the vicinity then I must say that even the little things do count. There were a few other little things that I also noted. I didn't get my morning paper on any of the 4 days I stayed. At first I thought it was because of our company rate but apparently my colleagues who were on the same rate as I got their newspapers. I also found that my used towels were taken daily despite the hotel's policy on saving on laundering towels guests intend to reuse and signify so by hanging in the appropriate places. Worse was that one day the towel was not even replaced. I had breakfast only once at Triple Three and I came in early so did not have the opportunity to observe whether they had resolved the long queues that usually set in around 7 AM. While the food spread was admittedly good, I still don't think it is worth the price. Frankly though, this observation really applies to most hotels I've stayed at in Singapore so not a specific issue with the Mandarin. I would say that given the price and the quality of the hotel as it is now, there are much better options to stay at in the Orchard area.

Reviews.Title: “jus for its location only”
Reviews.Author: joannegoh
Reviews.Content: check in is slow, n where i upgraded to the club rooms cos we had a midnight flight so we could crash at the lounge till we were ready to go to the airport The club lounge is doin the best job in the hotel i would say. The tea food is amazing. But i would only suggest for people to go there if u dun care about service but wan location n dun mind waiting for checking in. The club rooms nothing fantastic as we came from the fullerton bay hotel. Probably a third of the room area. I wont suggest staying here for more then a night or two to get your fill of orchard road n a cheap room. N then moving to the bay to get a different feel and more service in a nicer room. Or go to hilton btw the cancellation period is 2 days before 2pm.. so beware! n the breakfast downstairs closes at 10am!

Reviews.Title: “Good for shoppers, not business travellers”
Reviews.Author: dtai010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of the shopping district, like 10 min walk from nearest train stations. Great for holiday and shopping for sure. But the traffic around the area is terrible, takes forever to get a taxi during peak hours. And the taxi is always stuck in traffic going in or out of the hotel. Also, the excessive taxi fares in Singapore, it's like 25%-50% in addition all the time plus the additional charges for city area pick up etc. So, stay away from this hotel if you are here for business.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location in orchard”
Reviews.Author: wira66
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nites and enjoyed staying in the hotel. check in and out very smooth, staffs provide good service.We have nothing to complaint about the hotel. while the hotel location is like heaven for the shoppers. I still believe orchard road is still the best place to shop in the city !

Reviews.Title: “location, thats it.”
Reviews.Author: bongkeh
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not even close to 5 star hotel, and not even lux. they're seems going back behind eversince ive been staying in this hotel since I was a kid. Let say, check in was slooooww. like seriously sloowwww. check out is ok. but sometimes the queue was very long. the shampoo and bath soaps? how can you make sure it will be enough for two person for two times bath? the shampoo or the conditioned shampoo. they're cutting cost to have another conditioner. Theres no bath mat. 5 star hotel give you 4 bath towel, not 2. and I need to wrote notes to the hausekeeping to have it all. the bed? no way. if hyatt can invest millions of dollar to change their bed, why cant mandarin orchard does that as well? 2 nights staying there, I always went back home with backache. there is even once they have a free upgrade if using the standchart, but they never give the upgrade anyway. blah. yesterday we book 2 room for 2 nights there, and my sister has a pregnancy complication, that she cant go with us to singapore. and I asked them, if just one room open it to next week or just change the date, is that possible. they dont care, if someone is dead, someone is sick, someone just cant even stand. far from what they call it asian hospitality. they only mean money and of course its a big NO WAY. This hotel, never offer you membership, like any hyatt hilton four seasons marriott all do. they dont care how many hundred of time you're staying there, they never treat you like their members. it seems the lippo management is really stingy to be call the best developer in indonesia? whats best about this hotel? location. thats it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: travelinmanila
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not bad for the price I paid (through agoda's best rate) but for a 5-star, it fell a bit short compared to others. PROS: - Location. It's in the middle of Orchard Road and just a few minutes walk to the Somerset MRT or the Orchard MRT. - Room was simple but nice and comfy, overlooking Orchard Road. Bed and pillow were comfy. - On the 3rd floor of Mandarin Gallery, there's a great breakfast place called Wild Honey - I want to commend Duty Manager Isabel. Upon checkout at 12nn, we left our luggage at the concierge and went around Orchard and Clarke Quay to kill time before heading to the airport. I realized I had forgotten to check the safe of the room upon checkout and my passport was still inside. I called up Mandarin and mentioned the problem and Isabel was able to sort things out and I got back my passport when I returned to the concierge to claim my luggage. CONS: - Lobby is on the 5th floor and not the ground floor - Upon check in, front desk didn't ask if we preferred a smoking or non-smoking room. The room I got smelled like cigarette smoke even though it was just cleaned but the room my friends got on the same floor but further down the hall did not seem to be a smoking room. We weren't sure if we were put on a smoking floor or not though the hallway did not smell like a usual designated smoking floor. - No turn down service. Got back to the room late at night after spending the day out to find that the curtains were not drawn and the bed not turned down. It's no big deal but other 5-star hotels I've stayed at have this service so I was surprised Mandarin didn't do this. - Bathroom amenities incomplete. Only 1 bar of soap, no face towels (bathroom had just the 2 bath towels and 1 hand towel), no emery board, no sewing kit. - Comforter could have been thicker (surprised it was thin) since the room was always cold even if we had adjusted it to low and at a temp of 25. - We asked for late check out (Mandarin check out time is at 11am). Front desk lady said she could give us a late check out up to 12nn without charge. Other hotels' normal check out is at 12nn. Check in time: 2pm We arrived from the airport at around 10:30 am, checked in and left our bags at the front desk because the rooms (we booked 4 rooms) were not ready yet. At 2:30pm, we came back to the hotel to get our room keys and 1 room was still not ready. Our friend staying in that room had to follow up for the room until past 3:00pm by phone until he finally went back down to the front desk to make sure they were able to give him their room key. Neither pro/con: - In my friends' room, the hotel slippers that they used were removed (instead of being placed neatly by the bedside) and new ones were placed in the closet. Waste?

Reviews.Title: “Great for access to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravW
Reviews.Content: A good business hotel with excellent service on the Club floors and in the Club lounge. Everything from airport pickup to welcome and check-out worked like clockwork. Affordable luxury at a great location for central Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshishBansal10
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. The rooms are good. This hotel is best suited for business for family vacations this would not be a gr8 option. The service of the hotel lives upto it's mandarin tag.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keentravellerDelhi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Orchard as it was a stone's throw from the place I had my meetings in. The location is fabulous - connected to the mall, right in the heart of the city and the shopping district. Takashimaya is right next door, Paragon is rright across. Excellent location if your agenda is shopping. I did not end up using any of the services - I did get an early check-in, which was a nice gesture. As I was jet lagged, and at work, I ended up eating outside of the hotel with a group - plenty of places around! However, if your reason to stay is not primarily work/ shopping, I would recommend staying closer to the Singapore River - less crowded, pretty walks.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star in Name, 2 Star in real service”
Reviews.Author: Zanpaktou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mandarin a week before Chinese New Year, just for 2 nights. We had quite expectations considering its reputations and high price.
