Oh no... it was the waste of money I had for the past 5-year travelling experience. 1. Check-in not on time. Because we arrive at 1pm, we were told to come back at 2pm, as mentioned in booking. We can take that so we went some Orchard walking. Then when we came back at 2.15pm, we were told to wait another 20min! So my parents waited at hotel cafe, and I went checking around hotel. When I came back at 2.40pm, the hotel told us to wait for another 30min! They said the housecleaning just started. I got so pissed and complained, after 10 min complaining and some supervisor said that he will treat us for coffee. But we were not in mood so we went out for some appointments with our friend. What really pissed me off the most is...the guy kept blaming governemnt's policy of not giving some monetary supports blah blah blah... Does it really matter for tourists? 2. So much cost reductions I was amazed such a big name, so little towels they give. 2 big bath towel, 1 middle bath towel, no face towel...even 3 star hotels in Singapore provide minimum 2 face towels! 3. So thin blankets 4. So thin pillow 5. Check-out time? First, one receptionist said it has to be 10am. So i asked other lady, she said 12pm. What the.... if you win lottery and has so much money to waste for nothing, please come to Mandarin. Otherwise, Goodwood is better, or even Perak Lodge in Little India is more worth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for shopping”
Reviews.Author: FennyG77
Reviews.Content: For those that love to shop and watch movies, this is the place to be.....Takashimaya next door and Paragon across, perfect place indeed...buy your things, drop it back to hotel and continue shopping...at night watch movie behind hotel which open until even 4 am... Room wise it is more classic in the newer wing but smaller...depends on what you like really...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but below Meritus' standard”
Reviews.Author: Everywheretraveler
Reviews.Content: If I did not stay at the other Meritus hotel in Singapore, Mandarin Orchard would have been fine. The room was comfortable, and the service was quite good. I really appreciate room service rushed my order upon request. That said, this hotel fell short of the chain’s standard I experienced in the other Meritus hotel. I believe the hotel had been renovated but it still looked outdated. The hairdryer was of an old model and very inefficient. The room looked a bit depressing because of the lack of lighting. I was perplexed the shower mat only showed up two days after I’d checked in. There was no hair conditioner or wash cloth. The food at the breakfast buffet did not taste good and most were not hot enough. Located in the middle of Orchard Road was convenient but I found the surrounding too crowded. I prefer the less-busy Marina Bay area where I found most of the shops on Orchard. Last thing about this hotel: those all-in-one universal adapters will not work here as there is an on/off switch on each electrical outlet. Please bring individual plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Mandarin Orchard”
Reviews.Author: mobias
Reviews.Content: We stay here from 20th to 23rd of January and all I can say we had a great time staying at this hotel and we will definitely stay at this hotel again. They very coordial staff and careful hospitality taken care of all our needs to the best possible. Also it's location is awesome. It really adds up on our wonderful stay at Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Vinay P
Reviews.Content: During my tour to Malaysia, Phuket and Singapore, this was the most expensive hotel I had booked into and was expecting the best kind of stay amongst the 3 hotels I totally stayed in. But was highly dejected with my overall experience. I was first given a room that faced a construction sight (a total eye sore). When requested for a change I was given a room facing a 120 ft blank wall of the old wing. The bathroom was VVVEEERYYYYY BAD with a very small shower area. The shower was creaky and would sing along while bathing. The photos displayed on the site of the pool just don't exist. Instead they have a very small pool right at the entrance area (scary). The house keeping guy was sweet but the quality of towels provided were bad, in fact torn. Breakfast was sumptuous while the floor managers were very supportive and kind. However, very nicely located bang in between two metro stations giving you good options for travel as well as bang in the centre of the orchard shopping district. No free internet / wi fi in the hotel. In spite of booking a room for 2, toiletries and others were provided only for one person and had to keep asking for stuff for 2 persons.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service!”
Reviews.Author: Kapil J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 13th-19th January for a holiday & had a very disappointing experience overall! We had a good check-in where Violet was very quick to respond to an early check-in request & accommodate us with a room quickly. There on the poor service started. Our bathroom drain was not working with the shower clogged. We made a complaint and the same persisted for 3days. The room was not cleaned on most occasions with the linen unchanged on some days, dustbin's uncleared. After 2-3complaints the room would be cleared completely. Room service food (breakfast) trays was not cleared all day despite the room being "serviced". I wouldn't recommend to stay here again except for the great location of its proximity to Orchard Rd.!

Reviews.Title: “Good but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Ch B
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been obviously refurbished a number of times now as old and new styles are visible everywhere. Apart from that there is a Main tower and a Mandarin tower, which makes the hotel into a complete labyrinth of corridors and lifts that will bring you to certain floor only. This makes the hotel into a stacked away number of rooms on Orchard Road.though. So in case you do not mind the labyrinth, the hotel is right a Orchard road with stylish shop beneath for good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best location in Singapore for shopping,food and medical ect”
Reviews.Author: dimu007
Reviews.Content: Very good location near orchard road which is full of shopping malls. the hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.One special thing which I noticed was all the time there is a manager available at the reception area for quick response for any issue.

Reviews.Title: “Tired interior and noisy. But some good points”
Reviews.Author: Arvinder_13
Reviews.Content: Bad points… Unlike a fine wine this hotel has not aged well. They interior is need of some modernising and the rooms need sound proofing urgent. You can basically hear people talk normally next door. Finding your room can be a little confusing as when you check in at ground floor, they give you your room card and show you to the lift. The lift however will take you to the second lobby which is on level 5. From there you will have to find someone to show you to the lifts which go to your room as there are no signs. These are past the checkout desks and completing in a different part of the building. When you have been on a 13 hour flight NOT including the extra hours spent at the airports, transfers, 8 hour jet lag this can be a little confusing. Good points… The hotel is in a great location if you like shopping and malls. Not to good if you want some traditional Asian culture away from the branded stores you find in most major cities now. For cheap beer and good priced food go to China or India towns. You can from level 5 go straight into the mall, so don’t have to leave the air conditioned buildings to go to the malls. Pool is ok. Staff are actually very polite and smile, which I like. If you need to use the business centre outside the hours of operation just ask main desk and they will open it for you, always good for last minute checking in and printing your boarding pass. Good link to the MRT, buy a pre-paid card for $12 at the station as this will save you money on top ups and each journey is cheaper than singles each time, there is however a $5 non-deposit included in the price so only get if you will be travelling more than 4 return journeys during your stay. The wait for the Taxi’s can be long, so make sure that you tell the door staff that you’re a customer, local people also use the taxi queue, the door staff will bump you up the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at orchard”
Reviews.Author: Nonie S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at club floor. The room ok. Not the best. The food ok. The service, so so. U have to pay 3 sgd for ice cubes. But they have perfect location at orchard. U can get the taxi so easy. Walking distance to 2 mrt (orchard & somerset).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, the service wasn't that good”
Reviews.Author: AnnieDuong
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here with my sister. The location of the hotel is perfect as it's right in the middle of orchard road with many shopping malls. The breakfast was in buffet style so a lot of choices. Rooms always clean, nice view...etc. However I wasn't too happy about the service. Firstly the TV screen showed a welcome text calling me "Mr" instead of "miss/ms". It's not a big problem but we couldnt choose the channels on the tv and I asked a person from reception, she told me she would ask someone to come check right away. And it wasn't until the next day when i asked another person and complained about the TV. Took 2 men and a few phone calls to fix the TV. Not happy about it. They told me that internet and breakfast come free with the room rate. The breakfast was but not the internet, which I didnt know until I checked out. And they charged per device which they didn't let me know at the time of check-in. So I paid 64.20 dollars per day for internet. which's ridiculously expensive. I wasn't happy as I did ask them twice whether the internet came free and they told me it did. Don't think I will stay here next time as I only spent a few hours at night there and not worth the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: Great location to everything! Transport , restaurants all near in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: suami_intan
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at this hotel after their renovation. This property used to have a very nice lobby, but management decided to turn the lobby to shopping mall. Given the premium situation of retail space in Orchard road, we certainly can not blame the owner from doing that. Our primary complaints is the quality of staff manning this property, there are restaurant staff yelling at customers including us (because our one year old daughter spilled some milk to at the table) And then there are reception staff who are very slow in operating their computer making check in and check out process very very slow (Almost missed our flights due to this slow process) My familiy members are not fussy, but due to many defficiencies of this property we were forced to fill out official compaints form (something that we have never done before) Simply put: Try other properties in the area for better experience, such as Hyatt scotts road, Marriot Orchard or Hilton Orchard. I sincerely hope that Mandarin can fix this situation since this property has so many potentials.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: aslHelen
Reviews.Content: Great location on Orchard Road, shopping, dining and public transportation just outside your door. Beautiful room, spacious and modern. Staff was mostly friendly and very professional. Visited during Christmas holiday, decorations were tasteful and not over the top. Will stay here again when passing thru Singapore on the way to Malaysia.

Reviews.Title: “No Way !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sanjeev B
Reviews.Content: apart from the location, we could not find anything good about Mandarin Orchard. Terrible staff. During check in Mr. Naveen the staff had the guts to tell us to go down and open our suitcase and make the payment just because I happen to explain to him that our money is in the suitcase and the luggage is still at ground floor, whereas the reception is at 5th floor. He was behaving very professional. room was clean but with no view. Old TV with little options on channels. Would NEVER re-commend this to anyone. Building is very old and it shows. at Reception no sitting place, you have to be in queue standing and your family would also be standing tell they check you in.... DONT EVEN TRY THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Okay-ish”
Reviews.Author: taniaviews
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Orchard road right next to Takashimaya. Great location, if your purpose here is to shop. It's placed between Somerset MRT and the Ochard MRT stations, but I do recommend you walking to Somerset as it feels closer. We had a late check in and the receptionist was very friendly. We got connecting rooms (as we wanted) and basically the service was great! However, the in-room dining food are highly overpriced, and the cleanliness of the room can be improved (I found left over chips in the drawers). Some of the appliances need maintenance, and the tv channels were limited. However, it was overall a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Normal hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: daniel_2402
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is good with lots of shopping and food around. Check-in was abit slow as front desk could not find my reservation. Swimming pool was abit let-down as it was relatively small comparing to other same grade of hotels. Overall was a normal 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surviving on Old Glory”
Reviews.Author: ayushmanc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very prominently located on orchard street, its a fairly old property, glimpses of which will be visible in every part of the hotel ( frequent travelers would understand what i am referring to). The room though decently sized had old fittings everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “It was about what you would expect..”
Reviews.Author: Natural1der
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nothing special. Great views (31st floor). Onsite restaurants were outrageous... 2 coca cola lights for $20 SD. I think I am going to stay in the Regent next time. There are better hotels than these two but my company only allows for certain ones. You will not be dissapointed here nor overwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: HamburgKIwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated close to everything. The decor is pleasant and our room was just fine. Stayed for 3 nights whilst at a conference. We would certainly recommend it and will stay again next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location property”
Reviews.Author: ClubAstra
Reviews.Content: Located right in the middle of Singapore's shopping paradise - Orchard Road, this hotel from the Meritus chain offers an environment that shoppers and holiday makers would delight in. It is bang opposite the Takashimaya Shopping Centre and has quite a few shops located in and around its ground level. Approximately a 15 minute drive from Singapore Flyer and the Marina Bay area and 25 minutes from Universal Studios, the Hotel gives you several dining options around it to suit most budgets. The rooms are large, though dull with inadequate lighting and service is nothing to write home about. Buffet breakfasts in the Coffee Shop / Mandarin Court have a distinctly Chinese spread, unlike other hotels in the vicinity which offer a more balanced continental & far-eastern spread. The Mandarin Gallery is a 4 storeyed shopping complex within the Hotel, which can provide comfort to some of the guests. All in all, fairly expensive for what is on offer. The demand for the location though, probably explains the tariffs.

Reviews.Title: “The good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: ubmagus
Reviews.Content: 1 week stay for work in fall of 2011. As mentioned previously, location is superb and right in the center of Orchard road if shopping is part of your itinerary. Rarely ate at the hotel as there are number of more affordable and delicious alternatives nearby. The room was acceptable but the internet speed was poor. Service and hospitality was "A" for effort but "C-" for results. Example: I had forgotten my adapter (I'm from U.S.) and merely asked if the front desk by chance had a spare. After multiple attempts and numerous trips between my room and the front desk, the 3 different adapters they gave me failed to work. So, I commend them for their effort, but execution resulted in wasting my time. Generally a fair experience given the reasonable rates. Next time, I'll pay the extra money and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nudams
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on 26 December 2011 with 3 year old son and a pregnant wife. The check in was excellent and helpful. We came earlier that the standard check in time and the hotel let us to check in early at 12 pm. The room is clean albeit small. The towels unfortunately have damp odour. We didnt bother to change it since we brought our own. However, find it funny for a 5 stars hotel providing smelly towels. Heavily pregnant wife had difficulty in waiting during the check in and check out due to the non existence of chairs. Hotel should consider having special counter for family with children, senior citizen and of course pregnant ladies. The hotels should also consider having swimming pool that are friendly kids since I noticed that there are many families with children decided to stay here. Would have been better if the hotel is friendly to pregnant mothers and families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Lenox_Square
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel because of the location, orchard rd. , can go to all department stores by a walk. The hotel room is nice, not too small and fully equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Look all the way into South China Sea and make no local phone calls”
Reviews.Author: gohl
Reviews.Content: I have heard about flimsy walls and non-existent sound proofing but I like this place all the same. To me, it is quiet, and it offers a great view if you are on the right floor on the right side of the building. I did not have any of the unpleasant experience. The room is very quiet, and because the room faces the east, i had a superb wake-up view of Marina Sands Hotel and beyond to the South China Sea with all the ships on anchor. TV switches on automatically and plays some soothing music when you slot the doorcard into its place. You can watch all sorts of news and entertainment channels. The bathroom is spacious and clean. You have to climb into the bathtub/shower place so maybe not so easy for seniors, but I am not 100% certain. Sometimes the towels have a dull damp odour but if I put them on the floor they get changed anyway so it may not be a big deal. Each morning the local newspaper is delivered to your door, and it is quite entertaining and informative if you are interested in Singapore as well as world affairs. The staff are all very pleasant and helpful. Taxi wait on a rainy day can be quite tricky though as there seem to be a lot of VIPs from Indonesia or China staying at the hotel and they seem to be allowed to jump queue. One time I ordered the famed hainanese chicken rice online through the TV and for some reason it did not get noticed until quite late at night when I could no longer wait and decided to give room service a call. Not worth the wait and certainly not worth the price at SGD35. I was told by locals that Boon Tong Ke a chicken rice shop is much better. There is a lot of choose from at breakfast table, except they don't offer the local kopi-o! I would think it would be nice if in addition to the espresso and cappucino and all the fancy coffee that it can probably provide also some butter toast and kopi-o! The other thing that one should take note is local calls are not free. A 30 min local phone call costs about SGD7. Internet is not free unless it is included in some package deal.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Pre-Xmas stay”
Reviews.Author: kram23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a premiere room, one room located in 28F and the other one is in 26F. The location is excellent, as it is along the busy streets of orchard road. Very near to shopping malls, restos, etc. The check in process is a bit slow if i may say, considering that I booked directly on their website, but nevertheless, it was handled accordingly, based on what I reserved. The staff are also kind and easy to talk with. The room is nice also and i have no issue whatsoever in the facilities, furniture, nor appliances. The room is clean and all are functioning as expected. The concierge is also good, as it only took us 10 to 15 mins to wait, and we got our bags already. The express check out feature is also nice, and very hassle free. Just ensure that you check the charges of course, then, I guess, it is really good thing to have as it is hassle-free. Definitely, i will go back to this hotel, if given a chance.

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to shop til drop, this hotel is the best choice. Since it situated at center of orchard road shopping area”
Reviews.Author: Purbaningrum_Sasmita
Reviews.Content: Very comfy to back and forth so you dont need to carry shopping bags along . And they also has nice coffeshop which you can order yummy hainam chicken rice.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are terrible but location and friendliness Are excellent .”
Reviews.Author: mojay_9
Reviews.Content: It's a very affordable hotel in a fantastic location.the service seemed friendly.we were only here for 1 night.it's only that the rooms and views are not nice at all.definitely needs an overhaul renovation.check in staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Only checking out tomorrow but must review now!”
Reviews.Author: thadgoff
Reviews.Content: At 3:15 pm this afternoon the emergency drill went off and as soon as I quickly evacuated our room and headed for the exits I was informed by two staff in the hallway that "it's an emergency drill only for staff"! Good to know that but why wasn't there any communication to guests? And this happened only one hour after a knock on the door delivering to me "an important envelope". It wasn't until after the staff left that I realized the envelope had another name on it along with "Room 2730". I'm in Room 3630 though! How could this mistake have happened? At check-in yesterday I reluctantly allowed the Concierge to take our two bags as I had read several reviews about slow bag delivery to the rooms. The good news is that our room was ready even at 1pm. The bad news is that our bags had still not arrived by 3:30. I called the Operator then and she promised to revert. No reply so I called again at 4pm. At 4:20 the Concierge called to ask me what color were our 2 bags. Finally at 4:45 they magically arrived OK! My TIP - carry your own bags to your room if you plan to use them within 3 hours of getting your room. Sadly the hotel's baggage "system" is BROKEN! The hotel's location is excellent and the room (#3630) is ok. But when one is paying 5 star prices we don't expect three star service.

Reviews.Title: “Lowest Cost on the Orchard Belt- superior shopping but not service”
Reviews.Author: PrincessCathie
Reviews.Content: I have 1 last min stay at Mandarin Orchard. I was shocked that the hotel lobby is @ level 5, and that the waiting time is quite a long time (15mins or so) I sprained my ankle a few days ago, but there was no high touch to see such need in a customer until I opened my mouth to say that I needed to sit down. Nothing fantastic about the service, jus that there is a FOC charging of my i-phone, which was flat. I think with such price, I don't think I will ever step into this pricy hotel. The ones who impressed me are select few like the porters, the room service (students), Conceige, etc. The whole hotel feels very cold!

Reviews.Title: “Best service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: WayneSandhu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for our wedding ceremony and luncheon on the 11th of December 2011. We also had a two night stay over that same weekend. To say that service was excellent would be an understatement. From our very first appointment with our wedding planner, we were treated in the best possible manner. Right through the event and stay in this hotel, the staff were friendly, prompt and showed initiative in their service. An example would be the banquet team providing the bridal party with food and drink while we were in our suite, changing outfits. My father-in-law took ill in the middle of the luncheon and the staff were right on hand to organize the ambulance and try to make him as comfortable as possible. One of the waiters even went so far as to offer his jacket because my father was cole (Thank you Hakim!). The day after the event, I was waiting in the lobby for some of my relatives to show up for breakfast, I was noticed by one of the staff who enquired about my father-in-law and commented about how I must be tired. These small gestures were genuine and heartfelt. This same member of the hotel's staff left me to wait for a few minutes before returning with a tray of pastries and a cup of coffee. I could not have asked for more from this hotel. I will be recommending this place to anyone who is planning a wedding or looking to stay somewhere in Singapore. Thank you for everything staff of Mandarin Orchard, you could not have made my wedding any better. :)

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: LeeBee79
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night here after moving from Parkroyal Beach Road. The location is superb, right beside Takashimaya and nearby to all the shopping malls. A fantastic hotel to stay for the night especially in this holiday season, easily accessible to the beautiful Christmas decorations along Orchard road. The housekeeping service was fast to our requests. We had some delay in our luggage delivery (waited for > 1hr) as the bell captain could not locate our luggage which we left at 5th level while he looked at Level1. Some confusion over the 1st and 5th level reception drop-offs. We loved the bathroom but it would be nicer if the toiletries were of better quality. Room and bathroom was spacious and quite well maintained despite some reviews. Overall a good stay for the location. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service attitude from the staffs, dont bother to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: benster1688
Reviews.Content: my work require me to be in singapore 5-8 times a month and everytime I'm in town, I stayed at the hotel. I have stayed at this hote a few times and it seems that everytime I stayed here, the service got worse. As USUAL( it happens everytime)when i checked in, I was not given the room type that I 've booked( premier room)and instead the staff is wasting my time and trying to upsell room to me by tell me that the room i 've booked is currently not available. ( it happens EVERY SINGLE TIME when i check in , what a joke!) when i refuse to upgrade my room with a fee, they told me that my room is not ready and expect me to wait an hour. So i waited an hour and when i approach the staff after the time is up, they expect me to wait another 30 mins more. Meanwhile i happened to see and overheard the other guests who happen to check in later than me and paid to upgrade, got their rooms. I was very mad at this and I request to speak to the manager, suddenly out of nowwhere, there is a room available for me. At that time which is already 3pm, its already one hour later than the hotel offical check in time(2pm) the rooms are ok, but the problems with this hotel is the bad service attitude from the staffs at the check in counter all the way to the house keeping and the room service.When i requesrt for one extra shower gel and bath salt, the housekeeping asked me why do I need that!! what kind of question is that coming from the housekeeping? Ordered room service but it seems that they forgot my order and have to call them twice to remind them. Wrote in the comments form but never got a reply. this is a five star hotel with a five star location but with not even a one star service attitude. I would NEVER EVER stayed here at this hotel again and never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “weird lift system”
Reviews.Author: dugong78
Reviews.Content: Firstly, to get to the lobby, you need to take the lift to 5th flr. Then when checking in, felt like the time taken is somewhat longer that other hotels. Had to wait for more than 10min before they can get to my turn. Two guests in front of me took more than 15min each. Luckily mine took ard 10min only. Then to get to my room, i had to take different lift. However, that lift does not bring you to the Fitness centre. To get there, you need get back to the initial lift which gets you to the lobby. I just find the whole lift switching thing a bit irritating. Probably it's due to the hotel being built ontop of the mall, thus this messes up their layout. The ground flr is also quite busy since it's connected to the shopping mall. The rooms were ok. Mine wasnt very spacious comparing against other hotel of the same range. For my nxt visit, will check-out other hotels along orchard road. With the rate i'm paying, there are plenty of options available. Internet speed is quite slow too. No complementary fruits or chocs. Location is ok as it's along Orchard Rd. Nearest MRT (Sommerset) is about 5mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozgirl73
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mandarin Orchard for 3 nights. When booking this hotel I had my doubts but let me just say that the hotel was excellent. We had booked 3 rooms and one person in our party was checking in one their birthday. They were upgraded to the Junior Suite which was large. Huge bathroom. The Deluxe rooms were nothing to sneeze at. The staff at check in were friendly efficient and fast. The breakfast was very good too. The standard fare with a lot of Asian and some Indian options. The staff in the restaurant couldn't be faulted. The room service was aloso very prompt and efficient. This is not a luxury hotel but more a practical hotel for the serious shopper. It is in the central part of Orchard Road but there was no noise in the rooms. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel for a short stop over!”
Reviews.Author: PaulineAndBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights enroute to Langkawi for honeymoon. Read many Singapore hotel reviews and was very confused which hotel to stay in. This hotel had some very positive and negative reviews which made it even more confusing! Pros. Hotel is in a great location on Orchard Road btw two MRT stations in easy walking distance along Orchard Rd. Hotel is opposite the tourist centre where you can get useful, helpful and friendly info. Hotel in the middle of the key shopping strip. Hotel is opposite the bus stop for the zoo and buses to Quays and Marina Bay. Convenient shops downstairs to buy beers and water to stock in room. Buffet breakfast is busy with lots of patrons but run efficiently. Hotel common areas are newly refurbished and maintained well. Actual room (we had a nornal standard room) was clean, air con was fine (despite negative review by others). The room was small but adequate for a four night stop over. Our room was by the lifts but wasnt as noisy as we expected. Check in and check out was hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Shop”
Reviews.Author: davidaubrey
Reviews.Content: From upon arrival until departure this hotel excelled itself in all aspects, from the swift transfer of luggage to room warm friendly staff and smiling faces. Perfect position for that Singapore shopping spree especially as we arrived in time for the Christmas season. Only a lift ride from the 31st floor to the Orchard Rd exit and into the busy but friendly atmosphere. For only a few Sing’ dollars more we booked a Meritus Club room with lounge access, well worth the extra expense for those wishing to avoid the hustle and bustle of the main floor breakfast area in the morning rush, and being able to relax after a hectic morning with a coffee and cake in the early afternoon and pre dinner drinks early evening. Staff in the lounge always willing to go that extra mile to help and ensure coffee and tea was fresh and drink replenished. Room clean and open, bed was Goldilocks just right, bathroom facilities fresh and hot shower perfect. Was there any minus points? The reception area was huge and the queues sometimes long and for the elderly no seating was foreseen, but again that few dollars extra for the club room enabled us to check out in the lounge area and there is an in room check out facility but seemingly little used. And for those smokers amongst you a rapidly disappearing smoking deck on the 5th floor and not a cramped area either showing respect for those that still indulge. All in all a experience. worth repeating and worth the expense of a 5 star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of town”
Reviews.Author: marcodasha3
Reviews.Content: If you can find a good deal for this property, it is just the perfect spot. Overlooking Orchard Road, you can easily move around by foot and with the metro system (MRT) avoiding the use of taxis...the hotel is enormous, the reception is more like a busy train station. Clean rooms, very efficient service - but don't expect a personalized service or a classy environment.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, elegant hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: tjhess74
Reviews.Content: I had a one day layover in Singapore and decided not to spend it in the airport (even though it is a very nice airport!). I chose the Mandarin Orchard based on the recommendation of a worker at the airport, even though it was a bit pricier than what I originally intended to spend (US $198). The hotel however, was extremely nice and very elegant. The rooms were well appointed, spacious and clean. My room was on the 32nd floor overlooking Orchard street and the skyline. The staff were very friendly. There were three minor things that detracted from the hotel. The first is a slightly confusing floor plan when first entering the building. One set of elevators takes you to the lobby, and a second set to the room floors. Once you figure it out, its not an issue. Second, was the price. It is a bit spendy for those not needing elegance. The third was a lack of full toiletry offerings that are available in many other 'lower standard' hotel/motels. Because I was on a layover, I did not have my checked bag with my toiletries (oversight on my part). Toothpaste, a brush, and cotton buds were provided, but there was no deodorant available. I was directed to walk around the corner to a 7-11 convenience store. I was very surprised that no travel deodorant packs were available in a 5 star hotel. In other 5 star hotels I've stayed at in the States, the staff would go to the store for you!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel, not very good service but good location”
Reviews.Author: Angela J
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the real selling point, but the service in the hotel was poor (there was no help during check in, the room did not have a working TV, no room service menu etc). Overall if its the location you are after I would go for it, but if you want a nice relaxing stay I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterplus
Reviews.Content: great service and great value. Always upgraded to a fantastic room and breakfast buffet is one of the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and variety meal for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Barliansyah
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in this hotel for 2 nights for joining conference on the same location. Good impression initially appear during I check in, hotel staff take care for asking the question and give way for check in processing. The room is comfortable but I feel TV programming not so many selection, but I can enjoy for cleanness room. To get this hotel just need about 20 minutes by taxi from Changi Airport and it takes cost SGD 22 for regular taxi meter. The nearest MRT station is Somerset, you can walk 5 minutes to get to this station. It means you can easily to go to anywhere during you stay in Singapore. For the breakfast, we can find variety of meal during breakfast. From Melayu traditional food, up to International food also available here and also good taste. Overall I can say this is a good hotel with great service and good location.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite getaway Hotel from work”
Reviews.Author: treesye
Reviews.Content: Staying at Mandarin Orchard is my fave place since three decades ago when my first child was a baby. Everytime we visit singapore always stay at the same hotel. Why? I love the services and the location is near everything I need to shop and spend time either by myself or with my two beautiful daughters. Now, with two grown up daughters I still stay at Mandarin Orchard and love the new look of the hotel. Always and forever my favorite hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at better for less”
Reviews.Author: kaindec
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the location is great if you want to shop around Orchard Ave. However, the cost of a taxi in SG is cheap so stay further out and you will save a lot. Communication is an issue, had a lot of issues but one I could not get across to them was no alarm clock, minor yes but I needed one. They said there was definately one there so you feel like an idiot looking in the same place 10 times to no avail. In the end no alarm clock for my stay. No iron, no directory as most hotels have. No one picking up the phone for in room dining (menu is on the tv). English is the first language in SG but is rarely communicated effectiveliy or understood. Basically for the price I would stay elsewhere like Mandalay Bay and take a taxi to the precinct if you want to shop, let me tell you there are no specials to be found and pricing is cheaper around little India. All in all wasnt the worst experience but not what you expect for that price. Also they will just walk into your room so hit the swithc outside the room.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Price with 3 star room & service! Never come again!”
Reviews.Author: Scm3566k
Reviews.Content: We check in here yesterday to celebrate our wedding anniversary, checked with front desk lady "Karen" whether can upgrade our room, request late check out, all the request was rejected by a cool face "No" not even complement with "Congratulation" even we told her our purpose here. Very disappointed! But not end, we had a non smoking rm but our room is smell with cigarette. Only 1 pc tissue left in the box, 1 face towel, and no hand towel? Not sure how the room service work? We stay in main block, claims to be newly upgrade but room still look old and worn down! Will not come again!

Reviews.Title: “Last trip in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Indra B
Reviews.Content: I have just went back from Singapore after staying in this hotel for last three nights. When we arrived, check in was efficient, met with Ms Daisy the Meritus Ambassador, what a nice and warm lady. We had our room in level 21 facing to Orchard road or they called it as Orchard wing. Room was spacious and well renovated. All went ok until the last day, we have requested a late check out upon arrival and was given a late check out until 3pm, however not sure why, at 10.30 am their Housekeeping Supervisor entered our room while we were sleeping, actually we have placed a Do not Disturb Sign however the staff still breaking our privacy. It was told that our room was vacant in their system, as a bit annoyed about this, i then called the operator to speak with their Duty Manager, approximately 5 minutes later, a young guy called me back and offered assistance. I then told him about the whole story, and was informed that I have vacated and settled the bill, this was surprised me as i have just woke up by the time their Housekeeping guy break our do not disturb sign, he then promised to re-instate our room status in their system, i guess this never been done, as at 1.30 pm another Housekeeping entered our room despite the do not disturb sign still in place.. This totally ruin my whole experience. Breakfast was ok, with almost empty buffet - we arrived at 9:00 am, i guess they have high occupancy at that days. Room cleaning was so so, as they failed to clean the ashtray and throw the old newspaper despite I have placed it on the floor. Seems they are rushing when they cleaned the room- this is on the second and third days. Empty soft drink can and an bunch of old newspapers were laying down on their lift landing console table in level 21 for two night, i think the Housekeeping team need to be more attentive on this - i am not sure who left those items there. I hopes my constructive feedback can lift up their service level and hopes they can be one of the best hotel in town, as indeed they have a potential. I will try to stay elsewhere next time..

Reviews.Title: “Same price with other 5 stars hotel around ORCHARD, but very very different service !!”
Reviews.Author: hyura
Reviews.Content: Just like the title of my review, it is still ok if you stay here for 2 or 3 days, but if you stay here for long holiday, please don't choose this hotel. Can't sleep after a shopping day, cause the noisy sound opposite the hotel keep bothering your ears. The housekeeping service only serve once a day, only in the morning, its very2 different from the other Hotel at ORCHARD. POOR service, can't get what you expected from 5 stars Hotel, really2 dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: George G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad. It is an older hotel which has been renovated. Guy at check in was really nice and upgraded us to a club room. We asked for a late checkout and he gave us until 3 pm for free. Hotel is quite big and busy, the check in and checkout desks get quite busy but they work hard to get to you. There are staff everywhere to attend to you so it’s never a problem, do realize the hotel has quite a number of rooms. Rooms are nice, bed is a little hard but good. Bathroom is ok, but I was never fan of shower in bath though. Pool is quite shallow but very nice, just the sun is blocked by the two hotel towers so get there 10:30 to noon or later in the arvo if you want to get some sun. Breakfast is crazy, we walked down to a huge queue, but don't panic the line moves very fast. The breakfast is a huge array of items for all tastes from Asian to western breakfast. My girlfriend loved the location as right on Orchard road with the shops. She was in heaven as H&M and TopShop were right on the same block -- we don't get them in Australia. I broke my laptop screen while there, and the concierge was really nice and sourced a spare computer monitor for me to use for a further two days of my stay. The hotel has a bar on level 5 which made some really nice Singapore slings. Better than Raffels. The gym is ok, it’s in a temporary location so the guy said it will be a better fit out when it is moved to it’s new location.

Reviews.Title: “Room: Good, Service: Terrible”
Reviews.Author: GaluhPutri
Reviews.Content: - I was able to enter my room at 6pm, whereas I arrived at the hotel at 12pm. - The receptionist is not informative, and it seems like there are no communication between the organization flow of the hotel. - After I finally can get my room, just when I thought my problem with the hotel is finish, I don't get any extra bed, whereas I already specifically said and paid for the room and the extra bed. And so to get the extra bed I need to complain again. - No body answering room call, not the receptionist neither the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is old does not meet the star criteria”
Reviews.Author: kivancgorkem
Reviews.Content: Mandarin name can this time disappoint you. This hotel is very well located at orchard avenue in Singapore but everything in this hotel is very old and it is full time crowded with people running around. Rooms were not ready we needed to wait long, concierge could not speak english well and could not help on simple issues. We needed to change rooms because of the bad smell in the room and high noise level coming from the chiller on the next building. This hotel does not deserve that mandarin name and star level just avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “As expected for an international class hotel”
Reviews.Author: CurlyClaire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights as my husband had a conference at the hotel. As you would expect for one of these international class hotels the room was spacious, clean and well appointed, and all the facilities were available without anything really standing out. Most of the staff were pleasant and helpful and some were downright wonderful such as Mary, the maitre d' at breakfast and her restaurant manager colleague. The slight negative for us was that the breakfast buffet was a little chaotic and it was difficult to find everything. Apart from that we had a pleasant stay, no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “very poor service”
Reviews.Author: nono1967
Reviews.Content: I go to Singapore at least once a month and I have stayed in many hotels in this city. My last experience at Mandarin Orchard hotel was very disappointing. It was first time I came there after they renovate it. Maybe management thinks that their great location is a good reason enough to come there so no need to make extra effort to serve their customer. One example, I have ordered a breakfast in my room: the brekfast was delivered on time, then come the troubles...I poured the coffe in my cup and suddenly saw a leak....cup was broken. After calling room service, they did not replace my coffee pot but just brought one cup of coffee; then I discovered that they forgot the croissant; after calling, I got them 10 minutes later. Well very bad experience to start a busy business day...Room cleaning was half done...so as a summary: great location, nice room, poor service and too expensive for what you have. Hopefully there are many other choice for hotel in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Rooms”
Reviews.Author: siomao
Reviews.Content: The last time we were here was in 2007. Now we are back with a toddler in tow. We arrived a few days before the F1 race last September and checked in to our club rooms at Club Level reception. Staff was courteous and efficient. However, children are not allowed inside the lounge, so my husband checked in while we stayed outside. Rates are very expensive compared to other more luxurious hotels, but then you really stay at this hotel for the location. The walls and doors of the room are thin and you can actually here noise from the room adjacent. The beds are comfortable, bathrooms spacious and views are ok. Housekeeping is a bit of a hit and miss. They do come everyday, but they just make the bed, change towels and refill the toiletries. But used hotel glasses, cup and cutlery were left on the table for two days, we finally washed it ourselves and put it away. We like the buffet breakfast, it has a little bit of each regional cuisine and the staff there are extremely friendly and helpful. If you have a small child, getting around the area is extremely convenient. It is right beside Takashimaya and in front of Paragon with a lot of food choices. The location is the best feature of the hotel. If location is not that important to you, then the hotel will seem overpriced to you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but service should have been better”
Reviews.Author: CitigirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located. Rooms lovely. However some of the staff are a let down, including one particular glib waiter in their breakfast restaurant. Also service was slow in some places.

Reviews.Title: “Bridal suite was great”
Reviews.Author: travelaholic-1313
Reviews.Content: The shower in the bridal suite was great, somes with a rain shower and many shower heads that give you a spa feeling. Room was nicely partioned off so you can create 2 rooms, guests cant disturb you. Each mini room has its own tv. Bed and pillow was way too ahrd though

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the heart of Orchard road”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Paris
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the heart of Orchard road: in the middle of swanky shopping malls (Ngee Ann City, Takashimaya, Paragon, 313@Somerset), just next to a major entertainment center (Cathay Cineleisure) where youngsters gather till very late making it one of the most lively stretch of Orchard road. Many buses pass on Orchard road and the subway is close making it very convenient to move around when it rains and taxis are in short supply in the city center. The rooms are modern and very clean with all the amenities you would expect from a good business hotel. The buffet breakfast is good without being exceptional. I had some problems with my access card and slow check-in but the staff compensated by their helpfulness and friendliness. Overall a very good choice if you look for city center buzz and high-end shopping galore

Reviews.Title: “merry making at the Meritus Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Rhea S
Reviews.Content: writing this review takes me down the memory lane..yeah 5 yrs back..it was on my first trip abroad ...celebrating our first anniv....singapore it was n " Meritus manadarin" was the place..Wow..the feeling was just overwhelming n so was the place..okay the rooms were okay in size not too big n not too small..aahhh..little smaller than i had anticipated..the best part of the place was its location..bang on the " orchard road"..which had just too many malls like the " paragon mall", " takashimaya"..etc etc which was like a treat for all the " shopoholics"..yeah even we were very delighted by its apt location..very peaceful, well lit up, neat n clean with MRT about 5 mins walking distance from the hotel..the hotel service was good with pleasing smiles 24x7..The food looked good but we cudn't enjoy much..as we were strict vegies n were from india..so even after subscribing for the buffet bfast we hardly enjoyed ny thing apart from the fruit n the breads..yeah limited options for " Vegetarians" as even the veg rice had egg in it..the lobby was small but very colourful however the reception was very pleasant, sharp n helpful... Overall..both o of us had a nice time at the hotel n wud recommend a visit atleast once.Well.i have my very special memories of the place since it was my first trip ever outside India..n i still cherish the time spent at the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Meritus Club at the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second 10 day stay in Singapore this year and on both occasions my experience at the Mandarin and the Meritus Club in particular were exceptional. All the staff throughout the hotel are very friendly and welcoming and no task is too much trouble. The staff up in the club level go even further to ensure that your stay is as comfortable and enjoyable as it could be and more often than not go above their normal duty to please. I will definitely be returning to the Mandarin Club Level and would recommend this hotel to any travellers be they going on business or on pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonjunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two hotels very close to each other in the heart of Singapore this past summer. The Mandarin Orchard was our first stop. It is clean. Yey. The food in the restaurant was not great enough to make me want to eat there more than once. The room was nice, but nothing to write home about. The lobby on the 5th floor had no seating while my husband waited to check in and out I had to sit on my luggage while waiting...very odd for a hotel lobby! This hotel is just sterile..devoid of personality making me want to return. So I won't. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but poor room cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: gemartraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at two connecting rooms. The rooms are small, not convenient for baby. The carpet is dirty and my daughter got insect bites while playing on the carpet. Staffs are extremely friendly and helpful. Need more improvement on rooms cleanliness though.

Reviews.Title: “our stay”
Reviews.Author: Lijo M
Reviews.Content: the staff were superb! Came in early after a long flight from Europe and requested an early check in with the front desk. The staff obliged and it was such a great service for us cos we needed the rest. This was the fourth time we stayed with them and the hotel and their staff have been excellent. Will go back over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else - no value here”
Reviews.Author: zizzle14
Reviews.Content: Hotels main attraction is shopping location! However there are numerous hotels in the heart of Orchard Rd and I will be trying those next time! Hotel is as many reviewers have described - renovations making the "entrance" down the side street - no seating here. The large but uninspiring lobby is on level 5- no seating here either - you have to stand if waiting for service, friends etc. People traverse it for the two sets of lifts one to each tower and the reception. No view, dont recall any flowers. There is a small uninviting bar area here and a remarkably small breakfast area. First impressions poor. The room was large but tired, marks on carpet, old style well used furniture- we were told at check in that it was recently renovated which it clearly was not. Bathroom large and dark, and shower door did not close properly and floor got very wet and slippery. We asked for nonsmoking and the room was OK but smokers in the corridors made the whole floor smoky and we kept the aircon on to keep smoky atmosphere from entering the room. Only 2 ordinary teabags provided throughout entire stay of three nights, a few ordinary amenities provided which were not replaced- only bath towels provided - we requested face washers and hand towels and were brought the latter only- 3SD room service charge for ice as there was no self serve ice. Gym was disappointing- basically machines set up in boring old surrounds- several machines out of order. Beware Internet charges- it is 30SD per day per device- so an iPad and iPhone counts as 2 devices. Finally on charges- hotel took full charges on my credit card a week or so BEFORE I arrived- not just a deposit. This was unexpected. Checkin and out service was indifferent, and the room was misrepresented to us- not a genuine non smoking environment, and not recently renovated. The feeling you get is of "charge to the max" and provide the absolute minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed here was more than 30 years ago when I was still in high school in Singapore. Needless to say, after all the recent major renovations to the hotel, the place looks pretty impressive....except maybe the rooms in Orchard Wing. I had to make a change to my arrival time and ended up requiring an early check in. The staff were (as always) very friendly and helpful through the check in process, but told me that they did not have any rooms with a king bed currently available, as I had requested, and offered me one available twin room on a lower floor. Unfortunately, this was an adjoining room with a very thin door separating the rooms. As such, I was kept awake all night by the young kid next door who was talking and crying all night and very early in the morning. I called the reception at 6am to complain about this and asked if I could change rooms, they said there was one room available. I won't go into details, but after 20-30 minutes of waiting in my room for them to call me back I decided just to go downstairs with my packed luggage and talk to them myself. Luckily I did as it was very busy at the reception this early in the morning so I doubted if they were going to get to call me back for at least another half hour or more. I soon got to talk to someone at reception who managed to get me an available room in the Main Tower. The room was SO much nicer than the one in the Orchard Tower!!! It was larger, had awesome views. The first room kind of reminded me of a Chinese massage parlor, but I won't elaborate, but just to mention that awesome views of the city was much better than looking into a blank wall of the building next door. Since I was in Singapore for a few meetings only, I didn't get to use many of the amenities, except the gym. It was ok, with a few cardio and exercise machines, but maybe 2-3 sets of light dumbbells. I have a feeling that this may just be a temporary location for the gym as there are buffet counters, mini fridges, etc. in here which is obviously where an executive lounge used to be, or will be in the future. I took a quick peak in one of the storage rooms thinking there was perhaps more fitness equipment in there, but it was just stacked with tables and chairs. Plus, the place was too nicely decorated to be a proper gym, so I'm hoping the hotel is actually planning to put a proper gym in the hotel. Part of the new renovations to the hotel includes a connected shopping mall called the Mandarin Gallery (Galleria?). I don't do much shopping when in Singapore, but it's good there are nice restaurants, cafes, provision shops, a money changer, etc. nearby. Anything else you don't find here you can almost certainly find at Takashimaya next door, or somewhere along Orchard Rd. I loved the fact that there was an outdoor MacDonald's kiosk across the road for a quick and cheap breakfast. The only real complaint I would have is more to do with the design of the hotel. Once you're dropped off at the entrance lobby, you have to take a lift up to the 5th floor to check in, then depending on which tower you're assigned to, you have to walk and talk yet another different set of lifts to your floor. It just seemed like a maze to get anywhere and I was sometimes taking the wrong set of lifts, then wondering where my room had disappeared to. I guess I wouldn't mind staying here again for the convenience of location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paykan S
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Mandarin Orchard whenever I am in Singapore. I always get the club level. Whenever I am in Singapore in the future I will stay at the Mandarin. I highly recommend it especially to business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTAP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Orchard for 4 days in September 2011. I am a frequent business traveler but this was my first visit to Singapore. This hotel was the BEST that I have ever stayed in.....including the Penninsula in Beijing. The staff was welcoming, responsive, and helpful. The club floor is the best deal! The room was spacious, beautiful, and modern. Free internet and laundry for 2 items per day. But the meals and cocktail hours were by far my favorite experience. The food was plentiful, fresh, wonderful variety of eastern and western delights, and beautifully presented. I recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: DJEBath
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Orchard for 8 days in September 2011 during the F1. I usually stay at the Shangri La but was put off by the pricing and cancellation restrictions during the F1 period. I upgraded to a club room in the orchard wing, which was a good size and well equipped, including a massage chair. The club lounge was good - serving breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails. My only issue was despite paying the same for the room as if 2 people were staying, i was not allowed even 1 guest in the club lounge without a fee of SGD60++. i think allowing 1 guest would have been good. Overall an excellent stay. David Eldridge.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome F1 Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Robby131
Reviews.Content: Smart Hotel and Staff that managed to cope well with a very busy weekend, all the staff we came into contact with had a welcoming smile and treated us with respect. Well Done

Reviews.Title: “Watch internet wifi rates”
Reviews.Author: Denmattali
Reviews.Content: The staff were five star the facilites at least four but I do think their internet charges are high in that they charge consecutively not cumulatively for the time. In other words, whilst most hotels charge for 24 hours and you can log off and retain the remaining time, once you log off you are charged again. I have suggested they advise guest of this but beware!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vipul2007datta
Reviews.Content: the club class is great with separate breakfast lounge, business lounge and internet centre. we had a great stay for 5 days. the room mis well appointed and the shower is great. the toilet kit was inspired with aromatherapy & matched well with our holiday spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Holidays”
Reviews.Author: pime_an
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location but for the prices they ask. they are better. The a/c is not good the room temperature is never below 24 degree even do I changes 2 times of room. The breakfast is expensive and it is not good. They do not make omelet. so they are better choises but if you want location this is the hotel

Reviews.Title: “For the price, they can offer better sports entertainment on TV”
Reviews.Author: Walter L
Reviews.Content: I am an ardent sports fan and likes to catchup with soccer and rugby when i travel for business. I was rudely surprise to find there are no decent sports channels on TV, no ESPN and no Premiere League. Formula One was running in Singapore, and Rugby World Cup is on, but i couldn't catch any of the races and matches in the room. I have to go look for a sports bar to catch them. For the price I'm paying for this hotel, I'm expecting more. I'm not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ren1316
Reviews.Content: Excellent services received during our recent stay. Staff were helpful and always smiling, particularly those at the Triple Three restaurant and at the reception area. My suite is big and comfy. The gym is well equipped and the view is fabulous. The pool is cooling & refreshing. The location is perfect, easy walk to great shopping. Its near MRT, also plenty of taxis downstairs. The food at 333 left you wanting for nothing. Great variety. Ate too much every time. If this hotel is within your budget, you should experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.........”
Reviews.Author: HeartyTime
Reviews.Content: What more can you say when a hotel like Mandarin Orchard is just like home. Rooms are comfy, food is great, gym is top class, pool is refreshing on a hot day, staff are friendly with a smile, and the service is excellent. It saved my life literally so what more could you possible ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Stormen
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent hotel. On the exterior and in the lobby it actually looks great. The rooms are very spacious and cozy. However, if you scrath the surface, you might get a surprise. The hotel is very dated; look only to the 80s inspired furniture in your room, or try visiting the far from luxorious skybar at the top of the hotel. The entire hotel bears the markings of being in need of a restoration. The staff is also terrible. Slow during both chech in and check out, arrogant and very little forthcoming. Having travelled the world and been to a lot of really great hotels, I was diappointed by the Mandarin Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel but 3 1/2 star facilities”
Reviews.Author: tyk2828
Reviews.Content: My family went to stay 1 night at the hotel over the weekend. They gave me Orchard view at Orchard Wing after upgrade (using voucher). Here are our findings: Good - 1. King size bed 2. 3 types of pillows to choose from 3. Comfy sofa 4. Shower heads 5. Fast room service 6. A lot of mirrors 7. Direct access from shopping level to your room. 8. Very convenient to shopping areas. Good for shoppers. 9. Free parking, but must go to level 1 lobby to get your ticket. Bad - 1. No chair at lobby, although there are customer service officers to help you 2. Need to pass through lobby when going to swimming pool. People looked at you when you are drenched 3. Normal swimming pool 4. Room not sound proof, can hear people talking outside your door 5. No free Wifi or cable internet 6. Must pay for local phone call when using room phone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for shopping!!”
Reviews.Author: OreoBoy
Reviews.Content: Nothing beats this prime location in the center of Orchard Road shopping madness and right next to the recent open flagship H&M outlet. The newly re-furbished premier room meets the high standard of 5* hotel but nothing really to shout about.

Reviews.Title: “5 Reasons Why You Should Spend Your Anniversary Here”
Reviews.Author: Juanki_Lemonn
Reviews.Content: Before anything else, my girlfriend and I spent our 7th anniversary in Mandarin Oriental, Singapore. And it was just amazing. These are 5 reasons why this place blew my mind 1) Welcomed by pretty receptionists. I may be biased since the receptionists were Filipinas but they were tall, slender, pleasing to look at and very good with English. From the moment I stepped out of the taxi I was greeted with a smile and felt like they were expecting us to come. 2) Divine bathroom. Period. I am very meticulous when it comes to hotel bathrooms and the one in our room had all the basic 5-star hotel amenities. We enjoyed a nice bubble bath. :) 3) No questions asked turn down service. It's either they were spying on us or they had CCTV cameras. When my girlfriend went out for a snack in McDonalds (right accross the hotel) when we got back up the hotel, our room was cleaned and we had something special prepared. 4) Something special for our anniversary. We were given a bottle of wine. And being the ever so stingy Filipino that my girlfriend is, she forced me to call room service to ask if it's complimentary or if it will be charged to our bill. And the answer was, "Sir, compliments from our manager. Happy Anniversary." We drank the whole bottle and had an amazing evening. 5) Did not want to leave. This hotel makes you want to stay forever. The bathroom especially, we took a guiltless 30 minute shower each time we would find the excuse to. The service and staff was very neat looking with their uniform and they performed amazingly. Hands down, this is THE hotel to stay in when you visit Singapore. Stayed June 2011, traveled with the love of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping or Service?”
Reviews.Author: distractinwanderlust
Reviews.Content: If you want high end shopping, this is a fantastic location on Orchard Road. It is also in the same mall where you can get Singapore's most famous (yet overpriced) chicken rice (the locals say you can get better for cheaper elsewhere). If those two are not important to you, I would not recommend this hotel. Visually it was appealing, and quite clean in appearance. My rate included internet and breakfast... Well, breakfast closes at 10am which is fine for business but inconvenient if you're on a more relaxed trip. Check in and Check out were treadfully slow. The concierge, Matthew, was a bit arrogant/rude and quite unhelpful. When asking about a specific street, he essentially circled the general area where it should be (but wasn't), and he made me feel as if I inconvenienced him by asking for help. So unless high end shopping is your # 1 priority, I would highly recommend considering another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: PDjani
Reviews.Content: Our family have been a devoted Mandarin Orchard customer for more than 20 years. We loved their location and delicious room service meals. But these last 2 years, we tried other hotel everytime we visit Singapore. Then last week, we decided to stay in Mandarin Orchard again, mainly because of its location in the middle of the Orchard shopping area. Turns out it's a wrong decision! Everyday we have to call for asking basic hotel room necessities like bathroom mat, face towel, hand towel, etc.. On first day, we thought the cleaning service just forgot to put those things in our room. After we called, someone came to deliver those towels then we gave him some tips. But this happens everyday! This is a 5 star hotel! Are these employees didn't put these basic necessity things for a 5 star hotel room on purpose? So we can give them tips after that? What a lousy mentality! Sadly, Mandarin Orchard used to be our favorite hotel in Singapore...

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT IN THE HEART OF SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: jzkpmd
Reviews.Content: The Meritus Mandarin or Mandarin Orchard in Singapore is right where you'd want to be in that island city - Orchard Road. It has expanded its room offerings with a new tower and had renovated its rooms. Not only that, it has its own 4 floor-mall to cater to its hotel guests! From the moment you arrive, there's a hotel officer that triages guests, instructing them where to go as the reception area is in the 5th floor. ( for a first timer, it's of help that they tell you where to go). Bags are left downstairs and brought to the rooms once you had registered. ) Another thing, there's another Mandarin called the Mandarin Oriental in the SunTec area near the Singapore International Convention Center so if its a hotel near the convention center, that's the one. Mandarin Orchard has its famous Hainanese Chicken at the Chatterbox. The breakfast room is on the 5th level and there are other specialty restaurants in the area. If you want other malls, Orchard Road's 4 other major malls are within 200 meters of the hotel. If you want a sampling of Singapore's other places and sights, the subway line is less than 100 meters behind the hotel. Besides taxis are aplenty in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars hotel with a three stars quality and service!”
Reviews.Author: bl0wn_away
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mandarin Orchard Singapore for four nights and from the first time I check-in to the time I check-out nothing went right... (1) Check-in: They have so much counters but only two receptionist are available. Causing a long line-up. (2) The bath tub had brown stain on it (3) The bed linen was torn / ripped (4) The housekeeping did not do a good job cleaning the room. (5) Took a long time for a bath towels: For some reasons, they gave away towels after eight o'clock at night. (6) The worst part was the concierge look at the tip in front of me upon departure. This was my fourth time staying at Meritus Orchard and it maybe the last. I will try other option such as Grand Park Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly reasonable but never outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: NZTaveller
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a reasonable quality business hotel offering everything I need (primarily the location), however it fails to excite in any area. If you have business in and around this area then this hotel will not cause any grief.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation only at lobby part”
Reviews.Author: A S
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I was stunned by the lobby's new look. However that's about it. The rooms are still basic, everything was standard. The superb location is the main key. Overall everthing was just average, the complaint I has was long wait during check out and there is no chairs at the lobby

Reviews.Title: “UTTER DISSAPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Booaaaa
Reviews.Content: We have been a loyal patron for as long as we can remember (25 years at least). It was definitely THE HOTEL of Orchard Road. It is still because of location but other than that, it has gone down so much in terms of service and cleanliness. After teens of hours of travel we checked in at 2 PM only to find rooms are not ready, had to wait. normal for such a "FULL" hotel. We FINALLY got into the room at 11pm at night and that is after the second moving and we will need to change to another room tomorrow. TOTAL AGGRAVATION. A perfect example of Location Location Location. Even if service is bad and its cleanliness questionable, you still have to come back because there is simply no other alternative from a location perspective. I do respect the willingness of the staff to help. But keep in mind willingness alone cant give total customer satisfaction. its the ability to carry out that willingness in a well planned action that makes customers happy. I hope someone from the hotel will read this and really give it a serious thought. We love the hotel so much till we hate it too. such an irony.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: mac082
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel but were unimpressed with the characterless room.We had a few problems in the room,fridge not working and a lighting fault plus on our second night an awful smell in the corridor.Although we mentioned the problems nothing was ever done. On our last morning I spoke to the manager about the faults who apologised profusely and kindly arranged transport to the airport paid for by the hotel.We enjoyed breakfast and the staff were generally very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: JohnKL89
Reviews.Content: Courtesy of a friend's complimentary stay voucher, I stayed a night at this hotel. From the beginning to the end, I was irritated by the staff who seemed over-eager to ask whether they could help, and I don't mean it in a friendly way. I mean that they made me feel I wasn't supposed to be there or was in the way or something. By the way, this is one of those hotels that have their lobby on a different floor -- something I find annoying. You'll have a fine time looking for the correct lifts to use while trying to get to your room etc. Having been asked already whether I needed help on Level 1, I went to Level 5 lobby only to be asked the same question. When I said I would wait for my friend (who had already checked in for me) I was asked to stand by the side, as if I were in the way! I didn't see that I was in any way blocking anyone so I was quite annoyed. The room itself is very nice and spacious, so no complaints there. The next morning Housekeeping tried to get into my room even though the Do Not Disturb sign was on. By the way, be very careful to ensure that you're booking a room WITHOUT breakfast unless you specifically booked a room that comes with breakfast because there's a card with your keys that looks like it comes with breakfast but I was told it's "just an advertisement". I can't help thinking it's rather misleading. All in all, room was nice but the hotel is filled with tourists and from the way they treat guests, I think shepherding people is their forte.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: r0sa80
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful,very clean,large,excellent and the check-in went very fast.The location was perfect.Service there was extremely efficient and friendly.The breakfast buffets were amazing!Overall, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The room is very much comfortable, especially the bed, and I love the mini bath-tub they have in the deluxe room - my toddler was very excited to take a bath there (we usually had trouble with take-a-bath routine in hotels with ceiling shower). The room size is perfect, not too big or too small. The staffs were very helpful when we arrived, and very friendly. Will be back, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueChicken
Reviews.Content: It’s a 5 star allright. The staffs were professionals and are trained to please. When we arrive we were not assisted by a staff but a platoon of them, ushering us to the 5th floor reception lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It is not the same as it were”
Reviews.Author: SC T
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel some ten years ago. The location is good and the chichen rice is good and there my family has booked this hotel from July 31 to August 3. The taxi has to circle round and round to get to the drop off point. (I learned that the hotel was sold to new owner who uses the previous drop off point on orchard road and also the lobby to make room for shops. The drop off point is now in the side street and the taxi have to spend 5 minutes more to get to the drop off point. There was a long queue for taxi at the hotel. The worker of the hotel quickly remove the luggae from our taxi not to serve us but to make the taxi available for those who are waiting for the taxi. We went to Chatterbox for chicken rice. It was bad. (I learned it later that the chef has gone). Previously the Chaterbox was located on ground floor and it was in the top floor after renovation. However, it is now in 5th floor and the decoration is really plain. When we arrived the room there was no face towel and the worker there told us it is available upon request. However it is automatically given in rooms of certain floors. Moreover the swimming pool is much smaller in size than in old days and it can be seen by others. You may have the feeling of being seen as animals in the zoo just as if you are swimming in the infinity pool of Sandy Bay hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and close to shops on Orchard”
Reviews.Author: gotraveller88
Reviews.Content: Mandarin was a good hotel, except when we arrived and feeling tired they made us wait for in the lobby which lacked any couches or chairs for a good 40 mins before being given our rooms. We had a group of 6 and for some reason it took an inordinate amount of time for them to get us to our rooms. One of the rooms were not even ready, so another trip to the front desk was needed. Overall, the rooms were clean and the location was convenient. The new refurbishments were good but maybe a bit more work to make this a wow hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We'll keep coming back for more...”
Reviews.Author: John651382
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Orchard Hotel is stretegically located in Singapore's shopping district and posh buildings. Upon reaching the hotel their staff is warm and friendly. Check-in was a breeze and you will be greetd by hospitable staff. Food in their restaurant like Chatterbox was excellent and delicious. Their rooms was cozy and feels like you never left home. Need to order room service food? Their in-room dining was quick and efficient plus the food comes warm and with extra enthusiasm from servers. Check-out equally was hassle free and hotel staff ensures you enjoyed you stay even when they send you off to the airport. everything was authentic and sincere.

Reviews.Title: “The best location at orchard road”
Reviews.Author: amzeeshan
Reviews.Content: I was stay there for 3 days with my wife and two kids. The location is at the center of the crowd at orchard road. It's a good location if you're going to shop at orchard road but it's too crowded if you want to relax with your family. The room is very nice, modern and clean. The swimming pool is very simple, just for you to take a 10 minutes swim and get back to your room. Overall this hotel is one of the best location at orchard road...

Reviews.Title: “Blissful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: ThomasSFernandez
Reviews.Content: My daughter’s dream wedding came true at the Mandarin Orchard Singapore.
