It was certainly most memorable for the couple and all our guests, and months on it remains very much talked-about amongst all that were present to share in the magic of the occasion. Every detail was looked into – from the guestrooms and bridal suite, to the magnificent ballroom that was transformed into a fairyland. The charming setting with thousands of lighted candle and tea lights set the aura for a romantic evening. It was as if we were seated outside with all the brilliant stars above us - extremely stunning! The food was outstanding, made possible by the presence of their best chefs who were there individually preparing the signature dishes on the spot for our guests. This was another wow factor of the evening. It turned out so much better than we had hoped, and my wife and I could not have been happier for the couple. I cannot stop mentioning that we are still getting praises from our relatives and guests who attended the wedding, as well as friends who have seen the wedding pictures and DVD. I will surely recommend the Mandarin Orchard to anyone who wants a truly memorable wedding and work with a team that really helped take the stress out of the planning. Their professionalism and personalized service exceeded our expectations. To the Staff at the Mandarin Orchard, you guys are awesome and must be proud of yourselves! We thank you!!! Warm Regards THOMAS FERNANDEZ Chairman & CEO PestBusters Pte Ltd

Reviews.Title: “wow what an experience”
Reviews.Author: glimpys
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to singapore and after a long flight we were met at the airport by the hotel driver and whisked to the hotel. Check in was quick and easy and we were taken to our room immediately by a beautifully dressed receptionist as the porter carried our bags. Our room was lovely looking down onto the busy orchard road,but as the receptionist was explaining the hotel to us we could hear some banging in another room, in an instant she had us out of there and upgraded to an even better room. This was abolutely amazing. The hotel is situated centrally on orchard road,from where you could walk to all the amazing shops. Red bus stop was just over the road and you coukd get an all day ticket to hop on/off to the many attractions. We were only bed & breakfast but the food there was wonderful. Fabulous hotel and lovely helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PremaDhaka
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel to stay in Orchard. Very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast buffet was very nice with a great view from the top of the hotel....lots of dishes to cater to variety of taste. The location is also great and just in the cente of Orchard. 2 minutes walk to Takashimaya, Paragon.... Loved my stay there :)

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay! Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: thehiep
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel out from several highly rated 5-star hotels from different sites on the web for its proximity to the main attractions, particularly to shopping areas. As it turns out, it was one of the most memorable stay in our recent trips overseas. We stayed at the Mandarin Orchard from July 21 through July 26, 2011. The hotel is on Orchard, the main shopping street of Singapore, and the hotel is conveniently located right in the mid section of the street. The staff, from the employees at the reception desk to the ones at the concierge desk, is all courteous, outgoing, and helpful. The room is nice and of decent size. Having said all this, we have had two issues though, one is with the internet and the other with the bed pillows! Hopefully, the hotel management realizes one day, the sooner the better, that nowadays the web should be free for all guests, and the bed pillows could be more comfortable. We will be back and stay in the same room, though!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AusfamItaly
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights here and would thoroughly recommend it. After reading some of the comments we wondered if it was a good choice but I guess there is no pleasing everyone. The comments made about the orchard wing being old and not as good as the tower block worried us but we were in the old part and it was perfectly acceptable. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. We could all learn something about manners from the Singaporians.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you stay at the orchard side”
Reviews.Author: ms_Dewijakarta
Reviews.Content: These hotel has two sides. Make sure you stay at the orchard side. The hotel connects with a boutique mall . Takashimaya is just next door and paragon accross the street. Excellent location for all your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: derrick49
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Orchard Hotel has a great location and also the staff know how to anticipate my needs. As far as cleanliness is concerned, the room where I stayed is impeccable. The housekeeping attendant paid attention to the minute details. Food wise, in the Triple Three, they have good variety and value for money. Staff service is fantastic and they recognized me even after I haven't been there for quite some time now. Over all I must congratulate the management team for a job well done for their great leadership, from the CEO down to all the staff. They are highly visible and alert. I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all my business associates. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, fabulous location, etc”
Reviews.Author: janitaroger
Reviews.Content: Our 4 nights at Mandarin Orchard Singapore were excellant, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We were staying there because of the volcano ash which had disrupted our flight back to NZ but the staff kept us updated frequently and nothing was to much trouble to them. The location is great - straight on to Orchard Road. As for the food - yummy. A fabulous variety of food (which I didn't have to cook or clean up after) All in all our stay was most enjoyable and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Food with a lot of variety”
Reviews.Author: gv252
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and has at least three restaurants. The buffet food was absolutely lovely with a huge variety of food - European, Indian, Chinese plus a variety of desserts. The only disappointment was that we had to pay for the internet connection and for local phone calls (even the free call numbers). The staff were good and polite. I would certainly love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler068
Reviews.Content: Dingy rooms, poorly maintained, Cheap furniture. Smells. For USD240 per night! WORST THING. $32.10 additional per day to use the internet. UNBELIEVABLE. As a business traveler, I need internet service to communicate with customers around the world and with offices on two continents. When I complained about the charge, I was invited to go down stairs and use the free internet in the adjoining mall. Stay away from this trap...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Bygone Era Services”
Reviews.Author: robertomadan
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Orchard Hotel is a hotel where staff are brimming with pride!! Something rarely seen in many so called five star hotels nowadays. Macau being so called the Las Vegas of the Orient has great lengths to go in learning from what is graceful Asian Hospitality as experienced by me and my famliy. The Hainan Chicken rice which one gets in most hotels is really very different that is was really so good that we ordered it 3days in a row. A great 5 star hotel located in a prime shopping district and only about 15 minutes by taxi to the Univesal Studios. Great hotel, great staff !!!!!! We will be back for more! Roberto Madan Macau

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for shopping, reasonable price, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JakartaSmiley
Reviews.Content: Booked here 2 (two) times in two weeks for our guests. Sales department is very helpful and cooperative with the room bookings when I contacted them directly to do the bookings. 1st visit : Entrance from Orchard Link, your taxi will drop you off to a small and very busy so called lobby. Greeted by the most friendly concierge ever, Mr. Bakar. Good Job for the concierge. The lobby at the 5th floor. You can see the swimming pool from the lobby.This great hotel got to do something with their check in system. Our check in for 5 (five) rooms took almost an hour. When we got back to check in, it's almost 6.00 pm! Rooms are spacious and Ok, not too fancy up to the hotel standard, our guests are satisfied and said the enjoy the rooms and the bathroom are clean. Overall: We are satisfied with Mandarin Orchard : location and facilities, but check in process need more organization. 2nd visit : As our previous check in time took more than an hour to finish, we visit the hotel early before our guests to hand out their copy passport to make the check in faster. But, still.. when the group arrived, they looked confused about their booking system, and.. we have to wait a while. Don't know why that happens. The hotel are fully booked and very busy at that time. And.. the sales person contact me one day before we arrived, and offered me to move our guests to other hotel -with a free upgrade to a club room at the new hotel- because they needed the rooms for other additional booking. Hmm.. I don't know about you, but we booked Mandarin Orchard because we wanted to stay AT THE MANDARIN ORCHARD. Not some place else. I said No to the offer, and wonder why they even bother to asked? The rooms are still in good conditions, the guests are happy and satisfied with the rooms and staff service. Until the check out time, they charged us a twin deluxe with 1(one) person occupant with a triple room charge -which we canceled already and switch to a deluxe twin- maybe because they're fully booked, the information slipped. Overall : We are quite satisfied with the hotel services. But be prepared for a rather time consuming check in time. The hotel really need to upgrade their check in computer system. Not Impressed with the check in - check out process.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: hafidro
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for the first time for holiday with my fiancee. We stayed in Mandarin because we wanted a hotel right in the center of the shopping district. We had a great time at the Mandarin. The staff were all friendly, helpful and accommodating. The room was fantastic. Clean and spacious. We will definitely recommend Mandarin Orchard to all our friends back home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, all worth it .”
Reviews.Author: kcajmclay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, service was very good. Staff are accomodating and the food is superb. Keep it up. We'll go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Always look after you”
Reviews.Author: gw66Darwin_Australia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for only 1 night but recieved great service, upon check in my wife and i got upgraded to an executive suite on the 32nd floor. We then got a late check out which is very handy,the breakfast buffet is nice and the location is perfect. We will stay again on our next trip to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: RajPadhiar
Reviews.Content: I went as part of a British High Commission contingent, on behalf of an international committe from Birmingham UK. I travel a fair bit and have stayed in some fine hotels. I have to say, that my stay at this hotel was most excellent. I found the staff to be polite and helpful and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. The executive lounge and its staff namely Anand and Suresh were spectacular. I for one will definately be staying there again. My tip is to pay a little extra if you are on a business trip or even with family and upgrade so that you have the access to the executive lounge, its well worth it. Mr Matthew Mani ( a manager) came and met me in person which is a lovely touch, he made sure I was fully aware of the facilities and offered valuable help throughout my stay. My family and I will be visiting soon and with the impression I have been left with, my booking will definately be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Bubblytravel
Reviews.Content: After our long day of shopping in orchard road.. Meritus club lounge gave us a relax ambiance and warm hospitality, service was awesome We will definitely come back again on our next visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel, the service and the room”
Reviews.Author: VivekMehra
Reviews.Content: I had read many adverse reviews about the hotel and was aware of the high Internet charges. I had also read about the legendary "long wait" to register. When we landed, we were quickly directed to the 5th floor (I think) where the registration process was underway. It looked like there would be a long wait but surprisingly there were enough staff mingling with guests and directing them to vacant lines. Overall the process took place about 10 minutes and I don't think this is bad considering the 80+ people waiting to register. The next surprise was being upgraded to a larger room. The room was immaculately clean, well stocked with towels and clearly smelling "fresh". It was on the 28th floor and faced Orchard Street. There was always a cleaning person on the floor. We always got extra bottles of water, towels and at the risk of sounding repetitive, they kept the room spotlessly clean. The concierge on the ground floor was always at hand to guide, to provide umbrellas and of course order a cab. The entire staff in-fact were always helpful. I must mention an incident at breakfast one morning. My wife, my 7 year old and I arrived to find a long line of people waiting to get into the area for breakfast. There was a travel group in that day and close to 40 people were in-line. I walked to the front of the line and was quickly spotted by a staff member. He looked at my daughter and immediately found a table in the bar area for us. Within 5 minutes we had our own table. I wouldn't mind waiting in line but its hard for a 7 year old! The only reason I haven't given it a 5 star rating is because in today's age, it is important that connectivity is affordable. I travel the world and have encountered every sort of pricing on Internet access at hotels. This one rates as one of the worst. People who can afford to stay at this hotel are clearly in need of connectivity. I don't mind if there is a charge but $30 a day is ridiculous especially because most people would not use it for more than a couple of hours a day (if they are on holiday). The hourly rate too is absurd. I got around the issue by buying a Star Mobile pre-paid SIM card that gave me connectivity at ridiculously cheap rates. There is a 7-11 around the corner that helped with top ups. I also thought the restaurant on the top floor was a bit over-rated for the prices they charged. Perhaps why I didnt see a crowd even on a Saturday night! The swimming pool is small but very functional. My baby loved the fact it wasn't deep at any end. This is perhaps the first pool that I have seen which has the same depth at both ends. Honestly, I think its a brilliant idea. If I was to choose a hotel to stay in Singapore, this would be my top 5 choices. I would want to stay elsewhere only because I wanted to be away from Orchard Street. But hey, this is a great place to stay if you want to be on Orchard Street.

Reviews.Title: “From Ash Cloud to Cloud Nine”
Reviews.Author: accidental2urist11
Reviews.Content: We were brought to this hotel by accident, due to the volcanic ash cloud that cancelled our original flight to Auckland. What began as stressful uncertainty of delay turned out to be an unexpected holiday for us, due mostly to your wonderful people whose skills and pleasant attitude are certainly 5-star! We would like to commend the excellent hospitality and diligent service exemplified by Mr. Ahmad Fadillah Mustapah, Outlet Manger of Triple Three. During our 3 days at Mandarin Orchard, we observed Ahmad to be a powerhouse of energy, being all over the place making sure all guests are comfortable and enjoying their meal. We likewise would wish to mention the professionalism and hospitality of Joy of the Group desk at the 1st Floor and Joy Ann of the 5th Floor Corporate Desk. . Although I have no wish for another ash cloud incident to bring us to your hotel ever again, I will surely have many pleasant memories and plenty of good words about Mandarin Orchard Singapore. All the best to the staff, and thanks to everyone. Truly yours, JOE. KAYABAN

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: mai_a216
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it's in the middle of Orchard road. The location is perfect if you want to go shopping in Singapore. One day you can venture on the right side of the road and another to the left. Perfect. But that's the only really good thing about this hotel. The bedroom we had was on the 25th flr of the Main Wing. It's supposedly refurbished but a coat of paint, new carpet, and lcd tv cannot hide the tiredness of the room. What I really hated about it was the bath. It's true about some of the reviews here saying that the water in the shower does not heat up well in the mornings. It is sometimes at best, lukewarm. Also, forget about taking a long hot shower at the end of the day as the shower drain does not work well. With the water not even on half blast, a puddle forms to your ankles right away thus making you want to hurry up and finish your bath. A pungent smell also comes out of the tub when the shower is on, smells like bad drainage. As this is a very old hotel, expect to hear people in the hallway and your neighbors' tv. The bed was definitely too hard, but pillows were good. Sheets had holes that were sewn. I guess this hotel is a very busy one because of its location. We were there for 3 days and every single day you would see a long line at check-in. Thank goodness when we checked in and out we didn't have to wait too long!!! Internet was around S$65 for 2 days... and mind you, it was PER device. They don't make this clear anywhere so be warned if you use a laptop and iphone/cellphone in the room. I contested double billing for this and good thing they waived one charge right away. I would go back again if only when doing business or shopping in Singapore but never would I bring my children there. There are other hotels with better accommodations and service for lower the price. The price of this hotel is all about LOCATION and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay only, could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: AndAkiAnd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night only on my way through to Bangkok. Great location on Orchard Road, right in the centre of everything. If I returned with my family I would happily stay here again. Good service all round from reception staff to restaurant staff at 333. My room was on the 13th floor and I could not hear any traffic noise. Was their lead-in standard room and was very spacious. Good size bathroom. Bed was a little hard but I was told this was typical of Asian hotel rooms. Very clean as well. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzskater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week due to the volcanic ash cloud, and would happily stay again. Room was nice (Mandarin Club Room on the 30th floor) with lots of space, a clean, well fitted bathroom and good view. Food at the buffet on the 5th floor was excellent, though definitely couldn't (and didn't) eat here every day. Hotel staff were polite and helpful, and house keeping staff were nothing short of excellent.

Reviews.Title: “too busy, but ok”
Reviews.Author: bluejay713
Reviews.Content: Way too many people. Overflow during breakfast (after waiting in line). TV went out. Hard beds (but typical of asia). Overall too expensive for the service. But they are efficient. Business center (was under construction) was lacking in its' makeshift state. Shiny, centrally located. Very thin walls

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Shoppers”
Reviews.Author: dheedhee
Reviews.Content: The rate for deluxe room was not that cheap but if you're looking for a central shooping area then you cant miss this place. The hotel was located next to takashimaya shopping malls which adjacent to others mall (Isetan, Wisma Atria and Ion). We've stayed here couple of times and this time room was located on the older tower area (you have to advise them in advance to book in the new tower area), bed was comfy, bathroom is a bit outdated but still acceptable. The new tower definitely much better. Reception area need a bit patient since there's not much staff around, and once they serve you they'll took some time to complete your enquiries. Anyways, will probably stay here again for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate but a few things could be much better”
Reviews.Author: jill32dg
Reviews.Content: I was in the Orchard Wing at S$290 per night. Good size and pretty well equipped for an older type of hotel. If you have any difficulty in lifting your knees, then be careful on getting into the shower that is in the bath as the side of the bath is very high. The internet is free on connection in the room, however they want to charge $32 for wireless access.- this does not seem reasonable to me. Food in coffee shop is all buffet with wide variety however, it is often very crowded. This means it is a fast turnover of food and is fresh but it does not make for a restful meal. There appear to be a lot of tour groups and conferences, so pick you eating time carefully, as well as lots of locals, which is a good sign. reasonable value, and company was paying... One major irritant, I had to go to the desk to get my key card changed twice in a 2 day stay... there seems to be some auto cut off time for the cards.... and there were others waiting at the desk to get keys changed. The good thing is that you cannot get all the way up to your room to find this out as the key card operates the lift... so you are close to front desk when it happens.

Reviews.Title: “No response to terrible experience at hotel”
Reviews.Author: missjay10
Reviews.Content: We used to choose Mandarin Orchard as the hotel to stay in because of its prime location at Orchard Road. However, after our horrible experience on March 28 when we check in, we might opt to stay in other hotels instead. When we checked in on March 28, I asked for an extra bed in the room. The front desk clerk told me she will give me a room with 3 beds instead. What she didn't tell me was that there was a renovation going on - we just found out from a written notice in our table that we might find gondolas passing up and down our windows and we just have to close the blinds to ensure privacy since they were painting. What they didn't tell us though was that with the painting came drilling and hammering. Sure enough, at around 5 p.m., the gondola carrying two workers was outside our window ( we didn't close our blinds) and the drilling and hammering started, drowning out our tv's speakers. We complained to the duty manager and she was nice enough to go to our room personally, see the situation herself and offer to transfer us to another room. She went down to arrange it and when the operator called us, I informed the operator that we will just transfer in the morning before 9 am instead since we were already exhausted and didnt want to pack our bags again. She agreed to take note and inform the duty manager of our wishes. The next morning, I went down to get the keys to the new room and the new duty manager was not as accommodating as the first one. He told me abruptly that I can only transfer in the afternoon. When I raised a fuss since I told him it was the female duty manager who arranged for our transfers, he reluctantly agreed to send a porter to our room for our bags. My husband was very displeased with his attitude but we let it pass. When I checked out on March 30, I wrote a complaint on our experience and submitted it to the front desk clerk to be given to management. I waited for months for them to reply to our email complaint regarding the lack of information regarding the renovation, especially on the side of the front desk people who were suppose to inform guests and not give them rooms on the side that was being renovated and also we complained about the rude attitude of the male duty manager who didn't want to transfer us . Unfortunately, it seems Mandarin Orchard Singapore cannot even be bothered to respond to our complaint with a simple apology. We've taken this hotel out of our places to stay when we are in Singapore. There are too many hotels that can offer better service .

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Value for money”
Reviews.Author: dd1153
Reviews.Content: I would say this hotel offers good value for money, Nice Friendly Staff, All you need in a central location. Encountered NO Probelms.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: Uglystick
Reviews.Content: We were put up in the Mandarin Orchard by JetStar because of the Ash Cloud over NZ and Aussie. While OK for a free accommodation, we would have been upset if we had paid. The rooms are very dated, porter service took 45 min to bring our bags to our room, which only was a problem because we needed some of our stuff for our baby. Breakfast Buffet was always running out of everything. Pool very small for such a big hotel, and only 10 or so seats available. The hotel is located in a very good location, but there are much better hotels in the same area for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Centralised Location along Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: alanyeo76
Reviews.Content: Just decided to book a room over the weekend. Totally enjoyed the facilities within the hotel. Went to the gym and its pretty well equipped. One thing to note is that there are no suana or steam bath at the gym. The swimming pool is slightly small. The room is clean and tidy. Just that i realised there was a bottle of water left behind by the previous occupants. Anyway, our room was upgraded to the premium room where we were facing Marnina Bay Sands and the harbour. View is pretty good. The hotel is standing right in the middle of the orchard road shopping belt and this made travelling around very convenient. Right within the hotel is the mandarin gallery and beside it, the Takashimaya shopping centre. Opposite located the Paragon. Checking in was a breeze and the service rendered is good at the front desk. Had dinner at triple three located within the hotel and the international buffet had a good spread, just that the price was on the high side, S$105 nett per person. Checking out was also a breeze. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel in Orchard”
Reviews.Author: galbusy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night during my business trip, booked through their website, was easy but a bit expensive than the normal rate from online website. Have to book it through there as there are no availability on online agent. Lobby was good, the people are friendly. Location was great, in the middle of the shopping area, but it is overprice from what you get. The breakfast was ok, the room is standard. People are very friendly. Didnt try much of the facilities. Good choice if you want to stay in orchard, but you could get cheaper place or book early.

Reviews.Title: “never going back to this place or any other mandarin property”
Reviews.Author: harsh540
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a couple of nights earlier this week. the location is great, absolutely on the Orchard, fantastic for shopping. the elevator system is a little confusing but you'll get used to it. the room service menu is very sad, hardly any choice, so i suggest you eat out and come. the front desk staff is absolutely horrible and if you happen to get a room in the old wing, you can forget sleep, it is dark, dingy and depressive. even my 6 year old noticed it and refused to stay in the room, we finally had to haggle to get a room change to the new wing. beware the cancellation policy which does not allow you to cancel without a charge.

Reviews.Title: “My family's choice of accommodation for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Edges
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for shopping and that's why my family loves it. Takashimaya and Paragon, two big shopping centers, are located just across the street from this hotel. Next to Takashimaya are Atria and Ion. This hotel also has its own shopping arcade. To me, no other hotel in the vicinity can beat the convenience of this hotel. From street level, the elevators go directly to room floors (Orchard Wing), otherwise, a short walk to the Main Tower's elevators. I literally shopped till I dropped.....in my own room. The hotel had its heyday when it was opened in the seventies and up to the eighties. It was one of the most luxurious properties in Singapore then. Now, although it is rated as a five star hotel, it can not really compete with the luxury of other newer properties. This hotel is very popular with Indonesian visitors who mainly come for shopping and getting medical services at Mount Elizabeth hospital nearby. As I stayed as this hotel quite frequently for many years, I find that it needs improvements in terms of rooms furnishings, amenities, etc. I like the staff because I feel they are very sincere and seem to recognize me from my previous visits. This especially goes to door attendants, bellboys and waiters at the restaurants. Rooms in the Main Tower are considerably large at more than 30 squared meter with modern style furnishing. Bathrooms come with a bath tub (no separate shower), double washbasins, a toilet and a bidet. The rooms need refurbishment as they are starting to age. In my last stay there I stayed in the Main Tower. I was informed that the hotel was refurbishing rooms in Orchard Wing and started selling those rooms with a premium. In my experience, the rooms in this section of the hotel are much smaller - there is barely enough space to add a rollaway (extra) bed. The bathrooms have a bathtub, a separate shower stall, a toilet and a washbasin. It's better to get a room facing the street (in both towers) because otherwise rooms on the other sides of both towers get noise from cooling towers of the building next door. This property has more than one thousand rooms, so lines sometimes get long for checking in or out. It's better to provide some extra time especially during long weekend or holidays. I keep choosing this hotel because of its convenience for my family's main activity in Singapore: shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Globalnamastey
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took a short weekend trip during easter holidays to go on a shopping spree to Singapore. I had stayed earlier on at The Mandarin Orchard with my family a few months ago and so was pretty familiar with the hotel. I must say that both the times I wasnt disappointed in any way and thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.The central location is unbeatable and I would certainly recommend this place as it saves time and money travelling in from other areas to come to Orchard street.. All the main shopping is just a stones throw away so even if we were tired or needed a break the hotel was just around the corner to go in for a short relax break. Even though we were 2 ladies on our own this place was very safe and we didnt hesitate to step out late at night to go to clarke quay or shop past midnight at Mustafas. The hotel readily flags a cab for you and even going to the airport, the check out...everything was most efficient and quickly done. In fact even though we arrived 4 hours before check in time they quickly arranged for our comfort and stay right away and even accomodated us with a late check out by an hour.I would surely recommend this place for happy memories in Singapore and will definetely return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Smell Coming from bathroom”
Reviews.Author: kiddz
Reviews.Content: There are 2 towers, I think we were given connecting rooms at the building that has not been refurbished. The rooms and everything were ok, except for the bathroom, it looked a bit digussting, the tiles aren't clean, and it smells, really badly!. I suggest people to stay in the refurbished site, looks much nicer from the picture, and its only 10 dollars more expensive last time i checked.

Reviews.Title: “For my taste too old style...”
Reviews.Author: toptom
Reviews.Content: Check in on sunday at 2pm - very busy and staff made a stressed impression. First room given at the Orchard Wing Tower was on 24th floor but quite noisy due to nearby aircon facilities. Asked for room change but got another noisy one with ongoing constructions on Orchard road. Third room was finally acceptable on 35th floor (upgrade to Club Room). Was impressed about the staff's patience and great support. Remarkable customer service. The room itself was old style also the equipment. Except the TV was Flatscreen with uptodate communication system (online city map and guide, message system). All equipment was working. View from window was great and with Marina view in distance. Windows old style (no noise protection). Location is of course great and direct on Orchard road but also busy area. Staff was always supportive and friendly. But I would rather choose anoother hotel next time...

Reviews.Title: “good property”
Reviews.Author: HimanshuG
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. Right on main orchard road. walking distance from metro station. Nice place to shop all around as its the main orchard hotel where this hotel is located. the rooms & service are good. But a very long waiting line in morning breakfast. (it took us arounf 45 mins-1 hour, waiting for breakfsat turn every day!!)

Reviews.Title: “i love the hospitality "”
Reviews.Author: mkutub
Reviews.Content: its a nice and very good place to stay and there newly opened 360 bar and lounge at 39th level top of the m ,is really a nice place to enjoy your sunset drink and too see the whole of singapore from the top,at later part of the night it convert into night club so ,yu can dance and enjoy your drink,and some of delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “2 hours to check in and another 1 hour to get our luggage.”
Reviews.Author: ryan_ibrani
Reviews.Content: here is my complain letter to them We came to spore last week for 1 purpose which is to attend our beloved friend's wedding. Upon arrival in Mandarin at 11.45am we already notice a very long queue and at lvl 5, there were 3 staff serving the check in counter with 3 lines formed behind it so we join the queue. after 10 minutes of queueing, a lady came and told us that she is forming a new queue which is 1 line for all 3 counter and she put the person behind me first because she approached the queue line from behind. When i told her my dissatisfaction, she assure me that she apologizes and promises that once a person is available, it will be given to me. I then ask her why is there such a long queue (it was until the Bar on 5) she mention that the hotel is expecting 600 new arrival today and beside the check out time is 12 since i have not eaten my lunch, I took my family out first, thinking that maybe when I return closer to 1pm, there will be more lines for check in and less lines for check out. to my horror, when i return at 12.30 the lines was even longer and it took me a full hour to check in... 10minutes at the desk where the staff was unable to differentiate between King size bed and a Queen size bed (i booked 2 room and ask for both to be king and she keep repeating that all the hotel room is King and i get 1 room that is king but smaller than the other) another reason was that 1 of our room was not available, it was not cleaned yet she ask for us to return by 15.00 (1.5 hour more...by then the time is already 13.30 and my friend's ROM wedding is at 14.00) disgruntled, i went up to 1 of my rooms and ask for my suitcase to be delivered straightaway as my wife's high heels was in one of the luggage. after waiting 10 minutes, we called the concierge. the reply was baggage is already on its way up then after waiting for another 5 minutes, we called again, getting the same reply "its coming, its coming" they say finally after another 5-10 minutes wait, we decided that we could not wait any longer as we are already late so my wife storm down while i waited at the room in case the luggage was there first. then a phone call came, a man claiming that he could not find our luggage!!! my wife had to go down personally to the storage room and retrieve her heels before taking a taxi to the ROM when we arrive, the event was already over.... even the bride&groom has returned to their home @hougang. we return at 5pm to Mandarin after apologizing to everyone about the reason of our lateness. however the story did not end here. even at 5pm, our room was still not ready (the one that was promised at 3pm) after ticking off the person that was checking us in, she suggested us that a king size room is available but on different floor. We are not taking anymore "bs" from this hotel. we stood our ground asking for a nearby room at 20th floor where the other room was situated in. She then mention that there is 1 room but it's a double bed. exhausted, we accept it anyway since it is just next door. 2034 & 2035 Later at the room after dinner, we try calling the operator to put us through for someone whom we are able to voice our complaint to. a duty manager she answers and she told us to wait a moment when she try to put the duty mgr to the phone. after 5 minutes, no one pick up the phone. so i hang up. i was tired and promises myself that i will talk with the duty mgr personally tmrw. the next day i go down to the lobby asking for the duty manager. when she arrive, it turns out that she was the one who check us in at 5pm (ms. morana) i told her Mandarin was supposed to be a 5 star hotel but what i just experienced is a poor poor service. i break it down to her in 4 points. 1. long queue 2. luggage issue 3. unavailability of our room 4. phone operator who left the phone she apologizes and offer us a complimentary breakfast. I just missed my friend's wedding because of the 2 hour delay at the hotel and the best Mandarin can do is giving me a free breakfast? I am curious to find out what Mandarin Orchard plan to recover from this embarrassing series of events especially after receiving below email.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but service very poor and getting worse.”
Reviews.Author: ADM69
Reviews.Content: Just spent 15 minutes waiting for service in the main bar while staff walk by ignoring us - don't come here if you value service. This after I had to go to business centre to get reliable internet access as the wireless signal too weak for rooms on higher. floors. Better places on Orchard than this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accomodation on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: nitin_gup
Reviews.Content: Stayed during my business trip in November to Singapore. Researched a lot before finalizing this property. I am glad i did becuase its the perfect foil on Orchard Road for a person wanting to get the best out of Singapore in a short 2-3 days stay. Great staff, good service, great bar having an open space as well. Superbly located on Orchard Road with all malls and food destinations in striking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in the heart of singapore”
Reviews.Author: fazee
Reviews.Content: Perfect location nice rooms nice staff,great Front Office Manager interacts with guest.Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Awful facilities, staff and service! Save your money - a 3-star is better!”
Reviews.Author: SunDiver
Reviews.Content: This is the cheapest 5-star hotel in SIngapore on booking.com -- with good reason! The staff, the building facilities and the service are awful and the only saving grace is the location smack in the center on Orchard Road. First, my gripes about the building. There are no chairs or sofas in the lobby on the ground floor. So when my dad (who walks with a cane) was waiting for a friend to pick us up, he had to stand around for 20 minutes. When I asked the concierge for a chair and why they didn't have sofas -- the reply was "security reasons". So the Mandarin has security concerns, but the Grand Hyatt and the Marriott across the street don't? I'm sure the hotel manager would say the lobby is being renovated, but when we stayed here a month ago, there were still no chairs. The hotel is designed so badly that you get off on floor 1, then take an elevator to floor 5, then change elevators to go to your hotel room. There are two wings which are completely separate towers -- looks like the hotel has bought out another property later and tried to combine the two into one brand. So if you are stuck in the Tower Wing (which we were first time around) then you have the old, horrid, dingy rooms. And if you get the Orchard Wing (where we stayed the second time around), the rooms are better - much better. But wait..... we had two rooms - one on level 14 and the other on level 22 - and you can go up in the same elevator, but if you want to come down from level 22 to level 14 you have to use a different bank of elevators and you need to come down to the lobby level and go back up a different set of elevators. We wasted most of our time doing this! The hotel has sold it's soul to shopping. It looks like most of level 1-4 has been turned into a shopping mall, which is why the hub of the hotel (lobby, restaurants) are on level 5. Chatterbox restaurant used to be at the ground level, but they have moved this to level 5. And there are no chairs or sofa to wait in the lobby either -- they just direct you to sit in the hotel restaurant instead. I wanted to upgrade one room to a suite - but the receptionist said it would cost an additional $700 per night, taking the room cost to approx $1000++. I refused -- for that kind of money I can stay at a suite in the Raffles Hotel! They then offered a club room at $170 extra, but you know what -- the room is the same size, just on the club floor. But kids are not allowed into the club facilities despite paying for it? So what am I supposed to do with them -- give them up for adoption? And to confirm that the hotel hates kids - get this! The TV has news, Indonesian, Korean, Japanese, Arabic - you name it - channels, but NO KIDS CHANNEL. So when we woke up at 7am and asked if there was a kids channel, the operator said that there is a one hour kids program on channel # 7 between 0900-1000. And what was I supposed to do at 0700 -- operator says, take your kids for a walk or a swim! So once again - the facilities are horrid! The service is unexceptional, uninspired and sometimes downright rude. We didn't get our luggage for 30 minutes, and my kids were sleepy after a long haul so I went to the lobby to check. My 6 year old daughter was with me and when she stepped about a foot into the aisle next to the reception desk (but not even behind it), the receptionist, Mr. Tommy throws a fit -- saying that you cant come in here. I asked him firmly whether this was an airport and whether we had committed a security breach. He smiled but didn't say anything. So I asked him again - even more firmly - and then he apologized. All this for a kid straying a foot forward! Imagine my surprise when the same Tommy shafts me at check out time! My bill came to $859.78, so I handed over $1059.75 expecting $200 in change. Now I haven't seen a 5c coin in Singapore, so I thought this would be fine. But no, Tommy insists on the 3c, so you know what, I handed him 5c and asked him for my $200 and 2c change back! Now the sneaky Tommy hands me a 5c Malaysian coin from his own wallet (not the hotel till). I only spotted this later when I had already left the hotel, but can you imagine the cheek of the guy! Finally, it doesn't look like the concierge desk has it's act in order. I had a package waiting for me, but it didn't show up on their system after I had checked in. The concierge desk said they had no record of it. Yet when I insisted that the package was there, they go into the luggage room too look for it.... and find it in like two minutes! Would have saved me the cost of three long distance calls to my Singaporean friend (who was overseas, hence the drop off) to locate the package if only they had checked even once without saying "no". Two good service experiences -- we called Room Service to ask for the kids menu, but when I said I would think about it, the day called back in 10 mins to check if we had decided. And our next door neighbours were making a lot of noise at 6am so when I called to complain, the duty manager said he would speak to them -- and he did! Wi-fi is frightfully expensive, beware! The exchange rate that the hotel gives is horrid - take the elevator down to level 4 and go to the money changer there instead. He usually beats his rate by 2c for a decent amount, and is good to do business with! We didn't try any of the restaurants except the breakfast once (which was good). I have been too scarred by my experience to stay at the Mandarin again. Farewell Mandarin - for ever and ever! The sooner you turn completely into a shopping mall the better - because clearly the facilities are more geared to you maximizing your revenues from retail space rather than running a hotel. The best thing about the hotel is the location - smack in the middle of Orchard Road - so the sooner it decides it wants to be a shopping mall, the better!

Reviews.Title: “We expected the worst! But it turned up GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Biajera
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 10:30 at the hotel 5 persons in front of us in queue and we were checked-in and in our room at 10:50. Uur bags came in at 10:58. We asked for an extra bed and the bed was availble and set 11:10. PRO:Checking-in was fast Cons: No waiting chairs in the lobby From the reviews in Tripadvisor, it was number 58 for hotels in Orchard Road, so we expected the worst. But unexpectedly, the room was great! It was clean and spacious for a Singapore room, we checked the sheets and it was not dirty, towels were clean, bathroom clean. PRO: Room Clean and spacious, Bathtub and shower area separate. Top of the line shower and several mirrors( on full length in bathroom(bright light) and full length in bathroom(dim light) and makeup mirror). Two hairdryders so me and daughter can style our hair at the same time. Cons: Some towels smells like sunblock Great location, just in front of the bus station, 5 -7 mins walk to MRT Station and has a taxi queue at the lobby. PRO: Great Location. Cons: We stayed at the 22nd floor and we can hear the music from the bar above (but tolerable) Staff was courteous, very helpful and really goes out of their way to assist your needs. PRO: Great Staff Breakfast had several selections, American, asian, Indian and vegetarian. PRO: Great Food Had a great time and certainly enjoyed ourselves – that is why we booked our next trip there again on August 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting expereince at Mandarin Orchard”
Reviews.Author: jyotinmehta
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights - April 24 & 25 and stayed in the executive room. Right from arrival, the service was beyond expectations - and exceptionally warm. A couple of glitches in the room were set right with amazing efficiency and courtsey. The complimentary lounge service was generous and almost round the clock. Staff managing the executive lounge went out of the way to be helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bath fittings could be better - but certainly not worth complaining. The food wa good and had a wide range. Location of the hotel is a big plus - evening walk along Orchard road i refreshing except for the shopping crowds. Overall a pleasant stay that will tempt me to revisit, even if I am on a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: choksi22
Reviews.Content: Terrible service dont waste your money on this hotel. All the following issues were raised with the hotel's staff in the evening and none were resolved as we reached the room post midnight. 1) Wireless phone not working in the room 2) Flat screen TV was mounted crocked 3) Housekeeping didnt clean the room Better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “A one night stop over in a lovely hotel and great city”
Reviews.Author: AlbionBoy72
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at the hotel and the staff were excellent and effcient. We were upgraded to a fabulous Exec suite. The rooms were very big for Singapore and nicely furnished. The hotel does a very good Asian/Western buffet breakfast. Nice pool area too. The situation in Orchard is good and we walked to Raffles Sq and Chinatown in about half an hour. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is its location”
Reviews.Author: newrad
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel every time i came to Singapore since 1998 when it was Meritus Mandarin. But this time maybe the last time i stayed at this hotel. I had to wait in line for 32 mins to check in and it was not a busy time. There were more people to "reform" the queue (in a zig zag line and not a straight line because we would stand in the walkway) than people at the front desk. Room was super tiny, and mind you, i paid $340 tax excl each night for 5 consecutive nights, and no complimentary wifi (extra $35/day). Wallpaper peeled off, countless hideous stains (i do not want to guess what are they from) on blankets (see pictures). Bed sheets are dusty under the blanket, with some human hair at the end of the bed. I felt I was staying at a motel at $40 a day and not at a 5 stars hotel at 9 times the rate. Staff were slow and cold. I had to call housekeeping to give me new towels once for they forgot to change them. I should have book the Orchard Parade instead for half of the price, not as well located as Mandarin but is cleaner, offers free wi-fi, better bathroom and better selection of free channels too. Farewell Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location for Singapore Fun”
Reviews.Author: gunjan67
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Orchard is a great hotel in terms of international standard 5 star quality. However, what made it outstanding for me is the location. Right across from Ngee Anne City (Takashimaya) and Paragon and attached to the newly done gallery, one has immediate access to the great food, shops & recreation (Pure Yoga @ Ngee Ann) of Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Improved service and lobby but still not up to the mark”
Reviews.Author: Darshans
Reviews.Content: I have again stayed at Meritus Mandarin (now known as Mandarin Orchard). This time, unfortunately I did'nt get lead time to book a hotel in advance (not an advisable idea if you are visiting Singapore) and I ended up landing in Singapore in the early morning. Most of the hotels including both Pan Pacifics have said they are full and they offered room to me at ridiculous rate (SGD 1000++). I ended up reaching Meritus and to my surprise, they have considered my last minute request and considering I am a guest who stayed there quite a few times, they offered me room at same discounted rate and my request for early check-in was also taken care of. I saw an improved Meritus after renovation. Now the reception and check-in area is bigger ( they shifted it to 4th floor) and check-in was easy. The breakfast room is on the same floor and i enjoyed the fulsome breakfast. The problem is breakfast area is too small for the size of hotel and no of guests, so there were huge queues for getting in to the breakfast-room!!! I found this very awkward for a 5 star hotel. The room was similar and was ok for couple of nights stay. Service, politeness and efficiency of staff is reasonably ok - not best in class. The location is THE plus point of Meritus as always! Bang on Orchard Road and with malls like Takashimaya are just few steps away, it's a very convenient location to shop and hang around for a while after busy day at work in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but check in process is a letdown.”
Reviews.Author: erwin_g
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on Sunday afternoon, and there were quite a few people waiting to be served. There was no clear indication which line was for check in or check out, so we just stood behind one line which looked to us like a check in line. After a few minutes waiting, one lady staff pointed to us in a rather rude tone that we were standing in the wrong queue line. We politely told her that there was no clear indication where the check in line was. Instead of assisting us, she quietly put a check in/check out sign on the the receptionist desk. The other staff, seein that we were not impressed with the attitude of that particular staff, quickly assisted us with the check in process. Other than that, the hotel is clean, though clearly shows its age, well maintained and in a very good location. The nearest MRT is just minutes away, and many eating places, restaurants, bars, shopping centres, fast food are within walking distance. Many of those places open until late, so if you like to go out late at night, you'll have plenty of places to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: Markperthmarkperth
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times. We came through this time on our way to bintan indonesia. We emailed ahead and said we were coming through and it was a special occasion and specified a renovated room. The request was ignored. We were put in a old room on 20th floor. The room was a bit dirty. The Internet cable was broken(although once reported it was fixed promptly). When I checked out the hotel attempted to charge sg$100 more for the room. Luckily I had a confirmation letter. They amended the price an eveythjbg was fine. We were supposed to stay at the mandarin orchard on the way back from bintan but have since cancelled and booked the grand park orchard across the road. O erall great location. Reasonable service but for $400 a night would expect a he'll of a lot more from the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Discursus
Reviews.Content: Due to a last minute change in accommodation, we ended up booking an evening's stay at Mandarin Orchard three nights before we scheduled to stay there. The hotel has a great promo where you book at the last minute and get a cheap rate -- the rate was even better than my company's special rate! The only downside to the rate is that it is exclusive of the breakfast. We decided not to get it and explore the other breakfast options that Orchard had to offer (perhaps the hotel might have gotten more business had they included the breakfast price in their rate?). The entrance to the hotel is a little off the main road as the main road entrance was for the mall which eventually also led to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and was always willing to help out or guide us to where we needed to go. The room was nice and it had a good view of the busy city malls. The bed was big and had a nice comforter. We especially loved the cozy little couch beside it. There was a desk where one could work which we didn't use though. The bathroom was very nice too, it even had a weighing scale! The shower had hot and cold water, although the pressure was slightly less powerful in the morning, I guess when everyone else was in the shower. There are two sinks and a toilet with what seemed to be a separate seat for the bidet. There were quite a few good channels to watch from on the tv. At night though, we could hear our neighbor's doors slamming and other noises. In the morning check out was quite smooth. We chose to leave our luggage in the hotel luggage room area (most hotels just keep it in the lobby for all to see) while we had lunch and waited for our flight. When we finally picked it up, it took them awhile and asked for our help in identifying our bags. It was a big room filled with a lot of luggage. Overall, it was a very nice stay in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: 123ozzie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to the standard set by many other hotels in singaore. Firstly, I booked online at hotel club for a club meritus room. When I showed the voucher, reception insisted it meant only a club level room , with no privileges. I disagreed but did not bother to argue further. They then gave me a room Not on club level and in the old ( orchard) wing. The carpet was faded, wallpaper was peeling in some areas. Breakfast down on the reception level (5) was always busy, although we did not have to wait too long for a table. The wait staff are too busy and donot respond promptly to requests like topping up teacup. Juice bar was allowed to run till empty, and took a while before it was refilled. But the location is great. Near subway and shopping and food courts. However the hotel should honor bookings to correct rooms and should spruce up the old tower. A friendly can do attitude would be an asset too.

Reviews.Title: “Not as grand as I expected”
Reviews.Author: hkadviser
Reviews.Content: Pros : Very good location Mattress - hard enough Quilted cover - soft enough Pillow - one hard & one soft for selection Cons : Price - Not cheap HKD1700 (incl ABF) Room - small ABF - enough variety but too many people No free internet (SGD4/hour; SGD10/4 hours; ...) Local restaurant - Laska is not as delicious as Sheraton Check-in - take more than 20 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: SeanNZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had good deals for weekend for a month or two. Thats rather surprising because the hotel is really nice and the location on orchard is great for business and dining. Sue any hotel that have its reception on the seventh floor is always a bit confusing for first time visitors but when you first get up there then navigate around the corner to the reception all issues are quickly solved. I have stayed here twice in the last month and both time have I been served at the reception within 1 minute. Thats excellent. service there has been very good. professional and with a smile, heck the girls are so cute and charming I almost dont want to leave the reception... I prefer to stay in the tower where the reception is. Easier access to orchard road. I have stayed in both. The rooms are fresh if you get a simple upgrade the main difference is the bathroom that actually is very nice in the tower I prefer. the bed is a bit extra high like it should be at a place thats spent some money on the rooms. In general I cant fault anything in the rooms. However come on free internet for all. I got it from a corporate deal but my colleague didn't. 5 dollar per hour or 25 per day I think the rate was. That's just plain stingy and not worthy of a decent hotel. The roomservice surprised me and was good and even more shocking reasonably priced (Singapore prices ok so never good, but...) the cafes and restaurants are typical hotel but the cafe isnt bad and one can get a glas of wine or a beer and wind down there without having to spend a fortune. Almost same prices as outside. Location is great. orchard on rolling distance, those that want budget food have kopitiam around the corner where all sort of Asian food are served streetwise and for 5-7 dollar per portion. Great shopping, lots of restaurants and for me that like the more quiet part I walk up to Emerald Hill for a quiet beer after my day working. To be honest get the right tower and its a great stay. and if you look at my previous reports you'll see I usually dont say this. Even a small candy to my little one when we left. Just that extra I usually never receive in Singapore ( I asked reception staff and those that had served me were malaysian Chinese and not Singaporean., that's probably why service was so much more than I usually get in Singapore..) Anyway book here if you want to be around orchard you cant go wrong if that's your district.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RayWaspe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel at the end of September 2010 for 5 nights, our main reason for traveling to Sinapore was to watch the F1 GP, which was brilliant I may add. The hotels location is perfect for all those that what to go shopping along Orchard raod, we found the staff very friendly and helpfull, we arrived at 6 am and although check in was normally only at 2pm they arranged for us to check in at 10am, which gave us time to have breakfast along Orchard road. A nice touch by the staff was to arrange our daughters soft toys on her bed once they had made it each day, brought a chuckle to our faces. The only thing that I found a little annoying was the cost of there drinks in the bar, well above normal rates, but we ate out most eveings and therefore this never really effected us.

Reviews.Title: “Sleekly upgraded .... a business hotel, but don't expect luxury.”
Reviews.Author: wingdaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the "Meritus Mandarin" in 2007, so this is my second visit to the rebranded "Mandarin Orchard" (with at least three Mandarins in singapore, run by at least two different hotel chains, won't people be confused?). I was pleased by the big changes. I miss the grand and traditional lobby of 2007 facing orchard road, with its decorative columns, but I don't miss the messy halls near the lobby with their cheap air and oppressive black marble. The new lobby on the 5th floor is sleek, subdued and clean-looking (but be warned: no chairs, sofas, or seating areas). A mix-up with the bell service forced me to leave my check in line and return to the first floor entrance hall to retrieve my passport, but that was a minor issue. I was very pleased to be told that my room was ready for me at 1030 am (requested by email a day earlier). My orchard wing deluxe room was comfortable, rather traditional-looking (with Chinese accents) and nothing to rave about, but a notch better than the main tower room I had in 2007 (which had fake wood panels and felt smaller). The 11th floor view was marred in the daytime by the dominating big black mass of the Grand Park Orchard hotel across the street, but that's not the Mandarin's fault of course. I found the room lighting a bit on the dark side (a friend of mine found it to be just right, with all the lights on). There was a dark spot right where the baggage stand is (I'm glad the baggage stand is a solid platform, not a flimsy rack). I liked the marble floor in the entry area --- nice touch! The bed was a large king-size, a bit firmer than I liked, but nonetheless comfortable (and the pillows were huge). Room was just about the right size. Bedside lights refused to come on on the second night, until I removed and replaced the key card in the master slot ... then the lights worked perfectly well. The bathroom was even better.... a separate shower, a stained-glass window above the bathtub that reflected light into the bedroom area (a classy twist on the usual bathtub window), a spacious feeling over all. Service was friendly all throughout, but I noted a number of lapses: no bath mat towel on the second night (I stayed three nights), no hand towels on the third night, no supply of hotel stationery on each of the three days at all (but I was generously given several sheets upon my request), a 45-minute wait for room service one night, etc. The room was kept very clean, however (but there was a funny chemical smell in the otherwise spotless 11th floor hallway throughout my stay). There were screaming ladies in the room next to me .... young ladies (teenagers?) ran out into the hallway, chasing each other and laughing uproariously even as they screamed (and banged their door twice). So much for soundproofing, but that was an isolated incident. (Not the only unusual event --- one breakfast diner at the coffee shop hurled a plate or bowl onto the ceiling, smashing it to pieces that rained down on the empty table next to mine. That's a first for me!) The breakfast hall is a classy, hushed place with subdued lighting (cozy atmosphere at 630 am). Food was quite good, but the selection was a bit disappointing (not enough Chinese food, with only two dimsum choices; no pancakes/waffles on two of the days I ate there.) The staff and the manager were efficient and very friendly. But eat early .... I saw a very long line of people waiting to enter the coffee shop at around 830 am, and there was quite a crowd inside. My biggest complaint: the SGD3 charge for bringing anything up to the room (even a simple bowl and spoon!). Enough for me to demote the hotel from 5-star to 4-star --- I encountered a similar charge only once before, in a 3-star hotel in Madrid, so it was a surprise to encounter such a charge in service-oriented Asia. I suggest that the management reconsider this unnecessary and customer-annoying practice. Oh, I did appreciate the efficiency of the staff in managing a very long queue for taxis on a busy, rainy morning ---- maybe 40 people ahead of me, but a rather quick wait that took less than 20 minutes. Well done. And the location, of course, is perfect. Less than a 10-minute walk to the Somerset MRT station through the discovery walk pathway ... smack in the middle of Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NatureHigh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is rather expensive, but the location is very convenient. It is close to shops, although I didn't have time to do any shopping. The place is very well put together and the people are very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: stockholmofsound
Reviews.Content: The concierge service was excellent. We left a baby stroller in a taxi from the airport, and the concierge staff helped us to contact the taxi services to locate the taxi driver. The staff was very professional and reassuring, and we got our stroller back. It was rather confusing that the hotel reception is on the 5th floor. There aren't any clear signs from the lifts on the 5th floor, and we had to wander around a bit to look for the reception. However, i should add that they do position a number of staff around to direct guests to the proper area.

Reviews.Title: “Most convient”
Reviews.Author: unknown53Kathmandu
Reviews.Content: Most convient place to stay. Very centrally located. There is no need to stand in taxi queues as it is in the centre of the shopping district. Friendly staff , always ready to help. Near the Hospital Mount E , so it was easy to go and get back to the hotel in between the doctor appiontments.

Reviews.Title: “the most comfort bed ever”
Reviews.Author: cantique
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and comfort, the bathroom was also nice, and the food in the restaurant was delicious in good variety. Overall, I feel satisfied staying in this hotel. Good location too, once you go downstairs, you will find a lot of malls in Orchard area. Too bad, the staff was not so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bulk Standard 5 star hotel - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: s_pearceHoChiMinh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent position in the center of Orchard road, close to restaurants and shops. However, the rooms are disappointing, they feel sterile and lack the 5 star feel. Everything was clean and the hotel functioned well for a business trip. Room service was poor, expensive and lacking a good selection. The pool is also very small. Reception was generally well manned and quick for my trip. The buffet breakfast was very extensive, a large selection, that was very good. However, I felt the staff in the restaurant were not very good at service and were unhelpful. Wifi internet connection was NOT available in the rooms, which I thought was strange for a country like SIngapore. There are some excellent hotels in Singapore, this is not one of them, try somewhere else, I still prefer the club rooms at the Hilton on Orchard Road or the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “They could be annoying, so fight for your rights here.”
Reviews.Author: redshappire
Reviews.Content: I never missed staying in this hotel due to location, its near the mount e hospital, its closer, but now I can forgot about this hotel after the parkroyal hotel open in the opposite. I stay in this hotel eversince I was little, going here with my parents. Check in queue time totally disturbing it could take 1hr for 3 person infront of me. I wonder what is the reception doing, why cant they just add more staffs then. One thing, the room is always not ready, they will ask you to leave your luggage, and then come back after 5pm, if you're lucky may be 3pm. Taxi queue were also one of the most annoying, they let any other people that dont stay in this hotel to queue as well. in the morning and the afternoon time is the worst, you need to queue for so long, and then when its your time, there will be any guests prioritized to go to the airport. Once there was a promotion paying with citybank, there will be a free upgrade room, and they dont upgrade us. and I was fighting for it, they says, it was full. so I let go of it. Another time I went there, I purchased a voucher since it was cheaper by 50bucks for the mandarin room. and they gave me the other tower room with more simpler room, dark old horrible bathroom, and you need to climb up the bathtub for showers. so I told them, this is not what Im paying, and I want the mandarin room, its more expensive of course. and they told me, no, its not. anyway, your room is bigger and bla bla bla bla. and I scream at them, and yes, they says, tomorrow then we can move you. I mean cmon. do you still want to stay in this hotel? One time I have a dead cockroaches on the cubicle. lately after the renovation, its getting more annoying to reach to the orchard road, you need to go through this way, then this way that way, then you'll finally hit the road. This hotel is annoying, room is ok, but for the price youre paying, I know we should get better bath amenities. not a cheapskate glycerin bath gell, and a shampoo that makes your hair looks like a broom. whats good about this hotel? Location. Thats it. but now? nah, forget it im not staying here anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Never Heard of Such Charges!”
Reviews.Author: Nigsten
Reviews.Content: I like to spend weekends staying at various hotels in Singapore. The last time I stayed here was before their renovation and didn't much care for the rooms. This time round, I decided to come back and check out their facilities after renovation. The rooms look fine, not fantastic. Pool was very small and was located on the same floor as Reception, which means EVERYBODY can see. What I found to be ridiculous was, you get charged $3 everytime you call for a service. Eg, asking for ice, wine glasses etc. Shouldn't this be part of a hotel service since we need to pay 10% service charge??? I was taken aback when the operator told me about this fee and said this started last year. No way am I going back to this hotel, even if there is a weekend promotion rate.

Reviews.Title: “Simply loved it”
Reviews.Author: AbuHammad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the hotel and simply loved it. We had read the reviews on trip advisor and frankly the negative views were way out. The service was excellent, from the check in which is one of the fastest we have experienced, to the room service, house keeping and especially the conceirge. One of the floor managers Naveen was amazing. It was as if he really cared about us having a good time in Singapore like he was family. All hats off to him and his staff. The hotel was family friendly, the location was amazing it is smack in the middle of Orchard road literally 2 minutes and you are are there. For any Muslim travelers there is Al-Fallah mosque about a 5 minute walk just off Orchard road. The breakfast buffet was very good and there was always seating available, I want to specifically mention that because one of the reviews had mentioned there was shortage. The hotel was extremely busy but there was always places available in excess.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in central Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Mostly_business1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and for the most part was very satisfied. The location is good and was a short walk to my office. You could not possibly ask for more food choices near the hotel and the room service was fairly good - not a lot of choices but good quality. The hotel buffet restaurant was overpriced, unless you were eating a lot of seafood, but there were tons of choices. My room was fine and modern and for once the wireless service worked in my room. My only complaint about the room was that once a smoker moved in next door I would get whiffs of cigarette smoke from times to time, which I'm sure came from the airconditioning vents. I'm not a smoker so I found this obnoxious. Also the noise from the hallways could be loud but I found if I kept the fan on it tended to drown out the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location and Perfect for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: NBHT
Reviews.Content: Well, I was here for 3 days in Feb, booked here as this was the cheapest in the category I wanted. Was very apprehensive as had heard some -ve reviews, but was very happy at the end of it. The room was perfect, beds were good. I took a non smoking room and thus no issue there. No disturbance during the night. Location allowed me to go out on Orchard Road for food and evenings. The breakfast was just great, spread and care the waiters and hotel representatives took was awesome. I had a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Service quality from start to finish is lacking”
Reviews.Author: Taposhc
Reviews.Content: To check in it is a momoth task - front desk efficiency is very poor. Rooms are good but a bit complicated to get to - one needs to change elivators. Resturant for breakfast is not well organised. Service is POOR - no one cares.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but rooms & pool are not great”
Reviews.Author: mag_ty
Reviews.Content: The service levels from the conceige, check- in up to the cleaning staff was excellent & exemplary. The room size (orchard wing) was however not great as it was quite small compared to the rooms at their sister hotel, Marina Mandarin. The same applies for the pool - it is very small pool & on the same level as the lobby (this meant that kids had to trod in their swimming costumes across the lobby before reaching the pool). It is thus not a family friendly hotel more a business hotel. As such, I will not recommend for children but will recommend it for business travel as it is conveniently located in the heart of Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, within city center, nice rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: rishi_4u
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in September 2010 during my first trip to Singapore. It is located on the famous Orchard road famous for the shopping and major brand shops. The hotel is accessible by main MRT line. Hotel Staff is very friendly and helpful. The food in the hotel is good and the best part is the buffet breakfast. You will find heavy traffic around hotel at peak business hours. There are many places to shop and eat close to the hotel and for night life lovers this is a perfect location. Although the room rates are a bit heavy on the pocket, but the qualtiy of stay that you get is also great. Most recommended for business and leisure stays.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid”
Reviews.Author: KT785
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has so many shortcomings, I am going write in point form: 1. There was two 6-8 deep queues at a non-peak 2.30pm at the reception with as many "supervisors"/"ushers"/"managers" watching/chatting as staff actually working behind the counter. 2. They gave "1 of the 2 remaining" non smoking rooms with King Size bed. I went back to reception to quickly claim that 1 remaining room as the aircon was rattling (in an "unsleepable" way) as I stepped into the room. 3. This is a loudish package holiday hotel. 4. This hotel thrives on hard-working but relatively unaware immigrant staff, even (wo)manning the reception. 5. In most (many?) rooms the only phone you will get is a bedside one - forget working at a desk - the reception confimed this when I enquired about getting a phone for a teleconference. 6. It actually uses imitation toothpaste (see my photos - and you will what brand it imitates)!! 7. In that "last room", I found that the bath tub backed up (see my photo showing stagnant 2 inch deep water 5 minutes after I showered). I was too tired to battle further when I showered near midnight and just pretended I was bathing in a stream.... 8. It must have been a good hotel once as it has a standalone bidet in it's standard rooms, and it has some classy shops in its shopping area. Many 2-3 star hotels well below S$200 beat this hotel squarely, so I don't know why it is still here in competitive Singapore - it/it's partners must sell some realy swell package holidays and thy must have a captive market....

Reviews.Title: “Confusing layout, offset by amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on business. Upgraded to room on top floor, bonus! Check in is located in strange way. Would not have found check in if staff had not pointed the way, in the front, up a lift, round the corner and down a corridor. Service from staff was great, very happy courteous and helpful. Very pricey room rate. There better deals available in the marina area. Maybe it is just Orchard Rd. No fitness centre in the hotel is a big minus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but some minus points...”
Reviews.Author: Dungdang
Reviews.Content: As they had a pay one day for two offer, it was affordable. Location cannot be beaten, and the staff is friendly. Strange is the uncomfortable and cramped breakfast saloon. Also very disturbing is the fact that they have no chairs at the lobby. As they had a very rigid checkout regime, long queues of checking-in and checking-out people were visible, and the waiting partners, some of them being old, had to sit on the floor....

Reviews.Title: “not value for money”
Reviews.Author: luckyrabit
Reviews.Content: Location is good, especially for one would like to stay in the center of downtown, very near from shopping mall as like Paragon. (But singapore is not big and relatively easy to take a taxi, so I am not sure location itself coule be a big merit.) Service is average (there are a few woman and man wearing a uniform in the lounge always, but they never helpful at all, I don't know why they were). Swimming pool looks not goodl, even though in hot weather I do not feel to go there. Breakfast is also just average, but restaurant itself is too narrow and so crowded. (this hotel do not have Lobby rounge !) Room is not good, considering the price I can say poor. there's no noise protection at all, I waked up over midnight, I was frighten due to I felt somone talking beside by bed. But is was from next room. (I do not blame the guest, because they just watched TV, not high volume) Compared with other hotel in Singapore I could not find any good thing in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know what its like to sleep in a coffin”
Reviews.Author: motherofluzza
Reviews.Content: Hated this hotel, from the start to the finish, no service what so ever, the room had no air in it on the 29th floor gross-No one to take our baggage up and down, stood in line for 1hr to check in, breakfast was great but other than that never again!

Reviews.Title: “Bringing the inn back in MandarINN orchard. Dreadful stay.”
Reviews.Author: cendut
