Reviews.Content: From Check in until checkout, there is absolutely nothing positive, nice nor enjoyable about this hotel. I loathe it SO much I am going to make this as short as possible. Tried to book Mandarin oriental but full. Booked a 350 sing$ per night two double deluxe rooms at the main tower. Paid 25$ more to stay in main tower. Check in was super slow. Poonam the reception should get fired or sent back to school. Kept saying the system is down but her partner right next to her, joy ann, did a terrific job and checked in about 4 to 5 guests while we were stuck there for almost 40 minutes. In the end she put us at the orchard tower. We got the ugliest, dirtiest rooms possible with dusty carpets, peeled wallpapers, broken flush button at the toilet and a decor either straight out of the tv series hawaii five 0 back in the 70's or CSI (CRIME SCENE investigation) of today! Bed was super hard, bed sheet itches. Room service food was icky, spaghetti I suspect was made by using old gym socks. Positive side: Had this 4 storey mall downstairs with a few restaurants but you DON'T have to be hotel guest to use. Just stay in park hotel across the street and you're good to go. Have to go to fifth storey first (hotel lobby) then change lifts to go to room (because staying in ORCHARD TOWER). Check out was hectic because they happen to be filming something (an ad I guess) so the main two queue lines were taken for this. Never been so happy to be this far away from that dementor-dreary kind of place. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Overbooked and short-staffed.”
Reviews.Author: Bluestar79
Reviews.Content: I checked in to this hotel on New Year's Day in the afternoon with my 20 month old daughter, my husband, his parents and his sister's family. We were told our rooms would not be ready for two hours, despite the fact that we were travelling with 2 babies who were ill, and were asked to wait in their cafe (which was completely overpriced, eg. A slice of cake for $7!). It ended up being a three-hour wait and the reception staff were the ones cleaning out the rooms, because they were so short of housekeeping staff! Even though we wanted the double beds in our rooms, two of the three rooms we got had twin beds instead, because they were running out of rooms. That night, no one got much sleep, because our room was situated right next to a very noisy hydraulic pump thing that kept stopping and starting. This woke the baby up five times through the night! The housekeeping staff were also so short-staffed that they took forever to answer to any request. Extremely frustrating and time-wasting. The only good things about this hotel are its very central location, right next to Takashimaya shopping centre and the high quality of food on its in-room dining menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing fantastic”
Reviews.Author: yongsy
Reviews.Content: The hotel had just undergone a round of renovation but the interior leaves much to be desired. Bathroom water was weak and barely warm. Have stayed in much better hotels for less. No free internet and any requests (wine glasses, ice etc) will cost you SGD $3. Free breakfast was limited and honestly quite horrible, thanks goodness Jones the Grocer was downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “bad reception service”
Reviews.Author: Dayang911
Reviews.Content: the reception was very bad. During check - in it was very slow and it get worst during check - out. Worst of all the receptionist is not friendly. I had my daughter crying with me during the check out and none of the staff was helping to make her stop crying but instead they gave me "that" stare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Levels, Great Food"”
Reviews.Author: jgioiaherman
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Orchard Hotel is well-located, right on Orchard Road, convenient to some of the best shopping in Singapore. The hotel provides outstanding and gracious service and its award-winning buffet restaurant Triple Three more than lives up to its reputation. The pumpkin soup will have you coming back for second and thirds. For business travelers, the hard-wired Internet works really well and the meeting room even had natural light. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel to all. As a road warrior who travels a lot for business, I am very discriminating and this hotel met or exceeded my expectations consistently.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great location on Orchard Road with all the shopping and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: intheairagain
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in downtown Singapore on Orchard Road with all the shopping and restaurants just go out the door and walk around. The staff is excellent and helps to dispell the fact that this is a large tourist hotel. This is what I liked about this hotel: great location good for sleeping as it is quiet, good bed and air conditioning dinner buffet 24 hour gym nice outdoor pool attentive staff taxi queue was always short attached to the mall This is what I didnt like about this hotel: breakfast buffet was good but overpriced at SGD 38 + tax + service charge laundry is overpriced business center only open until 6pm no lobby furniture Other notes: Check in is on the 5th floor in between the two towers The restaurant on the top floor is closed

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and fantastic location but rooms were old and broken....”
Reviews.Author: kizzcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business event for 4 nights and several comments: Staff were very smiley and friendly. Check in was quick and hassle free (despite reception not being on the first floor). Staff were efficient and led me to the room and took care of the luggage delivery which arrived in the room within 5 minutes. They kindly offered me the newer Main Tower instead of the Orchard. Staff were really great and cannot fault them. However the rooms left a lot to be desired. They are so old! Even being in the newer wing I felt the rooms were very cheaply furnished with pieces falling apart. There were cracks everywhere and the toilet felt like a public toilet! The toilets I have in different Spas have better toilets than them. The bed was big but mattress quality was not good. Design was strange and the rooms were very noisy despite being on 30+ floor. Chicken rice in chatterbox is great and location is unbeatable. Therefore I will rate this a 3* experience since the hotel gave me a 3* feeling overall. I'd rather spend my money next time on Naumi, Studio M and/or other boutique hotels of similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & security at one place - a royal place”
Reviews.Author: manojk9
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel, but not the first one at ORCHARD ROAD in Singapore. i liked the hotel, when compared to the other hotel. The special thing was the way the front desk accomodated us, when we highlighted our problem, & helped us resolve it. This is the most important thing in the hospitality industry where you give the guests a feeling of security & comfort. The breakfast, in addition, was good, for we vegetarians.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Orchard - place for all the Singapore Action”
Reviews.Author: zia_zaneer
Reviews.Content: Located on Orchard you can't ask for a more central hotel in Singapore. Regular 5 star hotel will all the trappings - very large room, great bathroom with italian marble flooring and multiple head shower jets. Quality of beds were also great Service was fairly soulless and impersonal. Also the check-in process took really long and they struggled to find my reservation even though all papers were in order. Stayed for 3 nights on my way back from Melbourne to Mumbai - did not spend much time in the hotel, but enjoyed Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sjahuja
Reviews.Content: Was good value for money. Excellent breakfast, vast spread. Staff was attentive and courteous. My room was upgraded complimentary since I visited while renovations were on but we were given a smoking room and the smoke smell was quite prevalent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: samuelle63
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to Singapore and usually like to stay at same hotel but this time we decided to try 2 new ones. We stayed at Meritus for 2 nights on our way back from Bintan Island. I have to say that I was a bit apprehensive after reading all the comments on the internet. We got there at 2h30 pm. Indeed, the check in process was quite long as the reception was absolutely packed with new guests arriving. After waiting for about 20 minutes, we were told that we had a room with 2 single beds. that was not what I had requested from my travelled agent. The lady said that if we wanted a king bed, we would have to wait 1 1/2 hour for a room, which we decided to wait for. Being on holidays, I didn't want to sleep in two single beds. At the time, I also requested a late check out and was told that we could keep the room until 2pm which was great for us as our flight was a late one. We went for a bite to eat and came back around 4pm and we were told that we had been upgraded to a room on the Executive level. When we saw our room, we were absolutely amazed! Wow what a beautiful, huge room. We couldn't have been more pleased. As I said, the room was stunning. It had a sofa, a massage chair, the bathroom was huge and beautiful. And, we had beautiful views of the city. Great service from the staff all the way. When we booked, we took breakfast with our package. We find it's always easier for us to have it included with our room, hence we don't have to race outside to find a place to have breakfast. Breakfast is very very very crowded. No matter what time you get there you have to line up to get seatted for breakfast. The buffet is huge, good variety. The only thing is that there's so many people that it can get a bit hard. There's no direction, therefore everyone walks everywhere and its a bit difficult as you get push around by people that obviously don't know how to behave in public. People are coming right in front of you and pushing and serving themselves, even if you were there before them. That would be my only complaint really about the hotel. Now, on the day we were leaving, I tentatively went to the receptioin to ask if we could keep the room a bit later than 2 pm since our flight was very late. To my surprise, I was told that with our room, we had a late checkout time of 4pm. Wow! what a treat! We really appreciated that. We will definitively stay at Meritus Mandarin again. The location on Orchard Road is the best we've had so far. Just out of the lobby and you are right in the middle of the shopping precint.

Reviews.Title: “Class. Fantastic breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonpiecake
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel apart from the flyers in every room advertising a telephone company to use to make calls abroad, I made a 2min call home letting my parents know of my arrival was charged 50 euros then the same company took a further 50 euros the bank rang to warn me that my card number was being used in luxemburg. After looking up the phone company on the net I found that it has been ilegallly taking money from peoples accounts all over the world. Shocking that such a wonderfull hotel would advertise this fraudulant company. DONT USE THE PHONE!!! - http://www.complaintsboard.com/complaints/bbg-luxumbourg-bbg-communications-c292393.html Slightly dishartend that due to the hotel´s advertising that company I am over 100 euros down and had the hastle of having to have my credit card blocked at the begining of my holiday causing me even more bank charges as I had to pay cash for everything, meaning I had huge bank charges every time I got cash out.

Reviews.Title: “just so-so”
Reviews.Author: lovelyladypat
Reviews.Content: very convenient when it comes to the location. you don't need to take a taxi to shop. you'll see evrything around. good restaurants and fastfood and the malls wow!!!! The service was good, but what i don't really like is if you are travelling with small kids, is they have a very limited channels on tv, no cartoon network, disney channel etc.. only HBO! quite small rooms...some outlets are not working, the bedsheets have holes, the housekeeping should use nice bedsheets, it just shows the management is not doing a good job in maintaining the standard.... over all review, well just ok!!! but when we go back to singapore we might try somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “better than the 51st rank on trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: roppongi
Reviews.Content: modern renovations made this hotel a pleasant surprise. i was not looking forward to having to stay here but it exceeded expectations. rooms modern except carpets were overlooked in the last renovations. huge bathroom. downside is that you can hear people walking past your door, and if you arrive at the breakfast restaurant anytime after 7:10am there is a long line because the waitstaff are too slow. great location to all of orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: yolanderHK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a 3 nights stay in Singapore. We booked a Deluxe Room and when we checked in, the staff member indicated that they only had twin beds left for the Deluxe Rooms. As I was travelling with my boyfriend, of course we did not agree to this. The staff then upgraded us to a premier room without us requesting it. The room was spacious with an arm chair and good view of the surroundings. We were on level 25 and even then we could hear the music coming from Orchard Road on the weekends. Fantasitc location, being in the centre of the shopping district of Singapore. Somerset station was only a short walk away. Taxis were also always available from the taxi stand downstairs. Would have to complaint about the business centre wanting to charge $10SGD for an hour to use the net. Also if you are a tourist, check out the visitor Centre across the street - very helpful. Overall very happy with the service, cleanliness of the room and location.

Reviews.Title: “Location"s the best”
Reviews.Author: banyuwangi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Oct 15-Oct 19th. Check in was fast.Rooms are a bit small,but no problem once you realize the location is just in the central of Orchard.It is to me the best located hotel, so we don't have to walk that far from the MRT(Somerset). The only thing I regret is the Buffet breakfast.Everday It's packed and crowded. Didn't feel the comfort of waiting in line.I've stayed in other 5 star hotels and they've had enough stations for us,so we don't have to wait a long time in line. The variety of breads and pastries aren't as much as Stamford swisshotel.Stamford"s breakfast food is way better then here.Everyday I just ate their fruits, salads,eggs,and chicken sausage.the others... hmmm don't like it! However crowded they were,they've managed to get a table for us every morning. The beds are a comfort....I love sleeping in them...very comfy.They have LCD TV. the rooms are clean.No complain. So for a great location this is the best place, especially if you love shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: TeenalS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for about 6 nights just before Christmas. The location is great on Orchard Road - great for shopping and to see the beautiful Decorations and lights. The hotel also has a good taxi stand - which makes commute rather easy. The hotel itself was very good with decent sized rooms. But the best part was the breakfast - outstanding spread and quality. Will love to stay back here in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PandoraBehr
Reviews.Content: After a night here I could barely fault the place. The room was spotlessly clean though a little small. My only gripe - the internet charges were exh\orbidant.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: Rayz_Tan
Reviews.Content: We booked through Agoda for a package which was worth SGD345 per night for free internet + airport transfer. When we emailed the hotel that we will be travelling into Singapore Via Batam, and hence requested for transport arrangement from habourfront. The hotel just emailed back that they only do airport transfer without any counteroffer. This was disappointing as we did pay extra for this service, considering that we could have paid SGD333 for internet + breakfast. On the day of checkout, instead of an arranged transport from the hotel, the hotel offered us cash $25 to take taxi to Airport. The hotel was just returning back some cash for some service that was initially offered within the package that i've paid more for. So essentially we were paying SGD320 for a room with internet, when i could have paid another $13 for a breakfast buffet for 2. I have feedback directly to the hotel 2 weeks ago and they have no reply to my feedback. I will definitely not come back to this hotel nor recommend this hotel to anyone as you are paying a high price for a bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with equally fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Sthlmeast
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the Mandarin Orchard in Singapore both as a solo traveller and with my family. I have lived in Singapore and have tried a good number of the hotels in the city but I think Mandarin Orchard is the best. Obviously it cannot be compared to Shangri-la or Mandarin Oriental but then we’re talking another price range which would make a comparison difficult. When staying at the Mandarin Orchard I have chosen to pay the extra money to have a club level room. The rooms are located on the higher floors and are big with a beautiful view over Singapore. The club room comes with access to the club lounge and a separate club level check-in which takes place just next to the lounge on the 33rd floor (I think). The club level manager Angela is a fantastic person and remembers your name every time and asks about the rest of my family who have stayed there before. In the club lounge you’ll be served a breakfast buffet each morning and a chef is on hand to cook your eggs to your liking. In the afternoon they serve afternoon tea with so much to choose from both sandwiches and pastries. And in the evening there is a couple of hours with free drinks including champagne, wine, drinks and liquors and a small buffet which is quite sufficient to keep you full until next days breakfast. All in all Mandarin Orchard is a fantastic hotel, in an excellent location and terrific staff. It’s my first choice when travelling to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ondama
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Orchard Singapore is an older hotel that has been nicely refubished at some stage. The Service is impeccable, good sized rooms and right in the shopping district. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my most favorite hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bobseiji
Reviews.Content: I always staying in Singapore couple of days when i go back to Japan and so far this is the best hotel i have ever stayed in Singapore. Good Location, Good Price. The room was very clean, modern a touch of elegance and huge!. Only the thing i didnt like was that they had connecting door in my room so at night, i can hear the people next door. but other than that, everything was good. Nice Bed too. After i checked out and got to the airport and i realized that i left my envelop full of cash in my room. I was so stressed and thought someone will take it so i rushed back to the hotel and made phone call on the way back to hotel and the lady who answered my call straight away organized Duty Manager to inspect the room so when i got to the hotel, Duty Manager returned me my cash. Sometime i am not sure how much i can rely and trust the hotels and services in some countries but in this hotel, they provide you safe and comfortable environment for the guest. I will go back next time for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: lolainlondon
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Orchard is what is to be expected of an average large, 'luxury' hotel. It is busy, large, and impersonal. The most attractive part of the hotel, I woud have to say is the location on Orchard Road. The hotel is smack dab in the commercial heart of the city, surrounded (literally) by malls, luxury shops and restaurants. The rooms are quite average, though clean and comfortable. There was however a humming sound and severely impaired the sleep quality in the rooms! Business Center also does not have enough hours, (open from 10-6 and closed sundays) and the breakfast is exceptionally unimpressive. Otherwise, the hotel has no real faults, though there is also nothing largely notable about the hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Experience”
Reviews.Author: yeelor
Reviews.Content: The reason I booked this hotel was mainly of its location, and I thought my family would enjoy five star hotel like Mandarin Orchard but I was totally wrong. We arrived around 2pm, waited 45 minutes to check-in. There wasn't a lot of people but the service was very slow. We booked 4 rooms but only 2 rooms were available @ 2.45pm. The receptionist asked us to wait at the room for the other 2 rooms and they would give us a call when the rooms are ready in another 30 minutes. Guess what, we got the 3rd room @ 4pm and the 4th one @ 7pm! That was very frustrating as we have elderly and children travel with us. Besides, we also waited almost 1 hour then only the bellman brought the luggages to our room. To conpensate the time wait etc, the hotel finally agreed to arrange shuttle bus service to the airport. Anyway, the shuttle bus was late for an hour and even worse they sent my family to the wrong airport terminal. Breakfast was good though. In conclusion, that was the worse hotel experience I ever had. I would never go Mandarin Orchard again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Charmed2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 15 nights (August) in a premier room on the 26th floor. Amazing service from check in to check out. We had no problems during our stay, we left by noon and upon return our room was always clean and hoovered. The service staff left us to simply to get on with our holiday. Mini Bar is extremely expensive so stay away at all costs, international calls are not too bad. Great bathroom and shower facilities too. Location is great, you can also exit your room through a shopping mall if you want to avoid the glare and attention of hotel staff in the front lobby. Felt like an apartment really. Shopping malls and food malls are everywhere, and the nearest MRT is Sommerset station. Just outside the hotel is benches and ice cream carts( A beautiful way to end a night shopping) All in all I would definitely go to this hotel again(and probabaly in a premier room) as it was just a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “4stars hotel, good location, room OK don't expect good service”
Reviews.Author: jess5549
Reviews.Content: - I booked this hotel through other travel agent on the internet... I did sent a special request for Twin bed and non-smoking.... when I reach hotel at 23.00, they put me in smoking room. Of course, I refuse but hotel was fully book. It's seenm like they never look on our advance request by travel agent which show on voucher.... I went in the room and feel bad, dry throat and could not sleep as air is not flow. At midnight, I asked them to open window which was lock and never been open..I sleep with window open all night. I asked the front to upgrade the room and willing to pay more... but it fully booked. Finally, can move to non-smoking in later night. If I would not arrive late night and all are woman, I would go out and find other hotel. - My package include internet but the lead line broken, no wireless in the room, I asked them to fix its in the morning but when I return at night, nothing happen I have to use the internet at the bar where there is the wireless signal. - Check out : It's a mess.... The invoice show room charge which I had already paid through travel agent.... and local call charge which I did not use.... and Add some extra charge of 80$ per room, neitherI and the frontdesk understand the charge.... The system is bad, service bad.... Should not be

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service - Excellent and Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: CKT99
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Mandarin Orchard, which came at the end of a trip around the world. This was our second visit to the hotel following a five day stay last year. We were most impressed with the oustanding service that we received throughout our stay and all of the excellent and professional staff we encountered - nothing was too much trouble and in fact they all went out of their way to make our stay an enjoyable one. We expect to visit Singapore again the year after next and will be including the Mandarin Orchard in our travel plans. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deboeck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mandarin for 10 days. Bedrooms average for Singapore but clean, comfortable and ok. Bathrooms are very good. Its also great location for Orchard Road. However its totally characterless. Staff are polite but a little disconnected. The restaurant and bar were obviously designed by someone whose previous career was designing 1960's school dining rooms. Truly horrible and bland. Went for breakfast once and decided both room and food were poor. Never went back. Incidentally there's a great Japanese restaurant on 4th floor below which is not part of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very very disapointing”
Reviews.Author: GavinSpring
Reviews.Content: I was ensured when I booked this hotel nerly 12 months in advance, that the major renovations would be completed. Alas when my family arrived, (wife & two teenagers) on our return from London to Bisbane all was not as promised. We were very jet lagged and our adjoining rooms were not ready on arrival. Staff were very pleasant especially the duty manager, but boy are they slow with room cleaning! We could not sleep due to 24hr jack hammering and banging drilling etc. We ended up looking at 7 rooms before giving up as even the rooms on the 38th floor were impacted by noise. I must say the duty manager as very patient and tried his best to accomodate us, but things were beyond his control. The pool was out of action so w had to taxi to their sister hotel closer to town. This was a real pain, especially with kids. The food was average at best and below expectations. For AU$2,500.00 for 4 nights the experience was basically terrible. Sorry....I wont be back and can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Best Location”
Reviews.Author: NYtravel12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the Meritus Mandarin for 4 nights. We've stayed here before but that was before they made renovations. Hotel located right in the middle of the city center, on Orchard Road, right by Takashimaya Shopping Center, the Mandarin Gallery and the new ION shopping center. Room and bathroom were good (standard international 5 star), breakfast was ok (but crowded), checking in was kind of a hassle since there were not enough staff at the front desk, which created a little queue. Will definitely stay here again when visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Sentosa”
Reviews.Author: doublego
Reviews.Content: Kewl nice short trip, amazing stay, pleasant place, amazing breakfast, rice chicken must to try. And must visit Sentosa and Mustafa. Just on the opposite side of the hotel there is a tube station to take you wherever you want to travel. Kewl nice stay and strongly recomended place

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs down and very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: poohanny
Reviews.Content: The only thing nice about this hotel is the location. Located right in the center of Orchard Road and for those who love shopping, this hotel is really convenient. However, for this hotel to be considered as five star hotel with the best service, I dont think so, in fact, far from it. The attitude of the FRONT DESK is really super rude. The management of this hotel should have training sessions of politeness and friendliness to its staffs. I forget to write down the name of the front desk lady, I should have done so. My advise for those who want to stay in this hotel, please consider!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Saurabh001
Reviews.Content: Located Centrally in the Shopping District of Orchard Road , It is only a 10-15 min walk from there to the main shopping centres and an MRT station is just around the corner, making it convenient for public transport. Meritus Hotel offers a decent mix of a Good location, decent food and ambience and functional rooms with a clean room and toilets.The Service Quality is too good ! During the Shopping Festival between May and July the Hotel gets pretty packed and its advisable to book your rooms well in advance to get good rates. And thanks to Ms Sonia in Destination Holidays for making our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Norlily
Reviews.Content: We had a family vacation in Dec 2009 and stayed at Meritus for 3 days. I was glad I picked this hotel since Takashimaya is just next door with lots of choices of eateries for adults and kids. The hotel has just been refurbished then and we stayed at the main tower. Room was plush with very comfortable king bed. Bathroom has a tub as well as shower cubicle. I liked the fact that there is a window separating bathroom and bedroom as I can oversee my kids having their bubble bath in the tub from the comforts of the bed. Internet was complementary which was good. During our day of checkout, since our flight was late in the evening and we had to give up the room at 12 noon, the hotel let us store our luggages in their holding room whilst we spent last minute shopping at Orchard Road. Surprisingly, they also offerred us a 2-hour usage of a complementary room to freshen-up and have naps before we went to the airport. This is outstanding customer service and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “just do not expect too much !!”
Reviews.Author: chai77
Reviews.Content: 1. check in / front desk service : confusingly you can check in on 2 levels. ground floor where shuttle buses and taxis drop you off, or you can go up to level 5. on both level there are no proper queuing system hence you form a type of pseudo-line. why can't hotel make those ribbon barriers that they have at airport where it then becomes orderly. took us for-ever to check in, and guess what NO SEATS at all either lobby. hence kids had to sit on the floor. 2. Concierge service : very knowledgeable about transport 3. Wifi : free at ground floor area and swimming pool area, log in using mandarin@meritus etc I think ? 4. Location : this is the only saving grace for this hotel, in the middle of orchard road, cannot get any better with regards to shopping etc. if you are using the MRT to get around use the Sommerset station as base central. 5. Room : there are no twin queen bed facillities in this hotel. so if there are 4 of you, good luck ! we had the king bed with one roll away bed. room was small but adequate. there are 2 wings to the hotel. we stayed at the orchard wing which gives you direct access to the shopping mall and orchard road. walls are definitely not sound proof - heard honeymoon couple practising (if you know what i mean), you read about these things but never expect to witness it yourself 6. Laundry : now as you all know, if you are on extended holiday and you travel with kids, laundry do quickly accumulate and hotel charges so much for basic laundry that it is sometimes better to throw away the dirty clothing and buy new ones !! well found this real gem of laundry mat. behind the hotel, about 10 leisurely minute walk to killeney road look for this shop called AUTO-INSTANT DRY CLEANERS. they charge normal laundry by weight $10 for the first 3kg , and then $2 for every 1kg after that. ridiculously cheap considering the hotel was charging $15 per shirt. our laundry came back clean, dried and nicely folded after that - a real GEM !! Overall singapore is an expensive place to visit especially if you are also visiting malaysia like we did

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: gingk0
Reviews.Content: This is a very large hotel in a good position. The reception staff were charming. The staff in the restaurants appeared to be untrained - breakfast was chaos. Whilst we left the table to collect our cooked breakfast items - our juices and coffees were cleared away, together with our daughter's personal things she had left on her chair. Chaos also and nowhere to sit down when we were waiting for the coach to take us to embark a ship. Never stay there again.Walls paper thin and as there was a very noisy group next door we were forced to complain to them - first time in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean and freindly. A place to base your stay. Central to all.”
Reviews.Author: Fish058
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at this hotel for 5 nights. We arrived in Singapore on a early flight, our room was available for us at 6.30am with late checkout on last day. We found the staff very freindly and very helpful assisting us with airport checkin on the last day. The rooms were clean and had a good view from the Main tower. Meals and drinks were off a high standard and we enjoyed eating and drinking in them.

Reviews.Title: “Quality drop when quantities reach max”
Reviews.Author: Hersyah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for holiday with fam from July 2nd to July 6, 2010. First impression when I checked in, I felt I was in a military barrack. It was 1980s type service, direct question without greetings and even smile, have you done the bookings, passports please, credit card etc. When I requested a connecting room, I ended up in a smoking floor without connecting room, but just next door. For that I even should waited after 7pm for the other room to be ready. I need to call 3 times and I should pick the key at the receiption counter although the check-in staff had promised before to deliver the key not more than an hour after I checked in at 1430 for the main room. The next day at the breakfast, a queue of 15 minutes was considered normal. There was not many variation each day and I stopped brekafast at day 3. I also found out that the room was not clean properly, only the bed, the pillow, the towel which were significant for eyes checked were rearranged, the floor was not clean or vacuum. June-July was peak season in Singapore. However if only due to peak season and the service degraded a lot, it was not a 5 stars hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Not really the best !!”
Reviews.Author: vijay_murthy
Reviews.Content: Perhaps, the only good thing about the hotel is its location. The hotel has a large room inventory, but considering the tower and the old building, sometimes its a challenge to find the right set of elevators to reach the room. The room service is rather average. The room interiors are not plush but rather run down. However, the bath room, tub and shower were in excellent condition. The restaurant was crowded with non-guests and there was not much seating arrangement either in the lobby or the reception area. The internet access is very expensive, which is a serious turn off. I would say that this place would be more of bed & breakfast and not for holiday or relaxation. Not much value for money either. Go for this only if you get a fabulous rate.

Reviews.Title: “Forgetable Experience”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: The entire experience was quite a disaster. Check in was a long process with not adequate seating area in the lobby area. Rooms are quite small and rather in need of renovation. Staff is not efficient and needed constant reminders before the tasks were completed. Overall horrible experience. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone else

Reviews.Title: “good location n excellent service”
Reviews.Author: armin1974
Reviews.Content: good value for money. execellent food. rooms are quite small but good value for money. location of this hotel is execellent, its in d heart of orchard road. Overall service is good

Reviews.Title: “Long Wait”
Reviews.Author: ashishkrg
Reviews.Content: Irrespective of advance reservations at the hotel website, it took 1 hour for the front desk to allot the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Decor But Small Double Room and Did Not Feel Special”
Reviews.Author: Actuarial_Math
Reviews.Content: I made use of the SGD180++ for 1 double room over Saturday night voucher that came with the "Eat at Meritus" Card. The hotel has very plush decor, but the staff is very cold during reception. The service was not personalised at all. I did not feel special at all in this hotel. Just felt like a statistic in the midst of all the other guests and activities in the hotel. The breakfast was bad. Cheap types of mostly local fare. The Japanese section was just miso soup. Staff working at the breakfast were not smiling at all. In fact, when I insisted on sitting at a certain section, the staff showing us to our table gave us a black face. The double room is quite squeezy, considering that the voucher entitled me to an upgrade to a Premier room on the 16th floor on the new wing. There was nothing premier about it. Again, the decor for the room is posh. The view from my room is not fantastic. Though it faced Orchard Road, all I saw were other tall buildings. The swimming pool was small, too. And it was located at the lobby floor, with some glass panel and grills separating the two. Guests can look at the swimmers through the glass and grills. No staff was manning the towel desk at the pool at all. I just had to collect the towels myself. The dim sum restaurant at the highest floor was rumoured to be very good. S, I tried some dim sum there. It was very expensive, even though I have tasted better dim sum at cheaper prices elsewhere. Nothing to shout about. Overall, I will not stay here again. The decor is nice, but the room and swimming pool are small, the breakfast is bad, and above all, the staff looked non-chalent at best, and rude at worst. I did not feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Very old hotel with terrible service”
Reviews.Author: vs123456
Reviews.Content: Old hotel with renovation long overdue. Staff were very cold. Rooms had a starnge smell and i was staying in one of their club rooms. Not a great hotel to stay in. Location is great though.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Singapore I ever been!!”
Reviews.Author: chinggu
Reviews.Content: I just realize in tripadvisor today this is a 4 stars hotel not a 5 star hotel as 30 yrs ago!! But it is actually more like 4 star hotel w 2 star hotel staff attitude!!! Me and my family just comeback from spending 3 nights at Mandarin. I had some business to attend and my kids r on holiday so they came w us. 30 yrs ago mandarin was my second home whenever I was in Singapore, I wished to introduce it to my kids too.. but the management was soooo bad my kids said: mom.. I think the hotel not good, actually it's the worst hotel ever!! even the 3star hotel in small city of Indonesia serve their customer better. That is the view of 7 and 5 yrs old kids... To start: with people line up everyday for check in n check out on 2 lobby floor-1st n 5th floor, the hotel only manage to prepare 4 single chair n 2 table for it guests... later when we checked out and I told the manager he replied "we had hundreds of rooms n it is impossible to provide sitting for al of the guest" Wow.... what an answer... who asked for chairs for everyone?? a long nice bench will be more than enough instead of 4 single chairs!! n I believe that hundreds of other hotels that also has hundreds of rooms manage to provide better place to wait than this so called Meritus Mandarin hotel!! We got there at 11 something we had to wait for almost 1 hour standing w kids before we went up to our room that we found broken n can't opened. We had to go down again wait another hour to get inside a room that was so tiny.. the bed was really a single bed like 1x2m, w small bathroom. I called the receptionist and asked since I've been staying there soo many times over 30 years and this was the first time I saw they have that small room. The staff agreed to change my room to another tower with 2 conditions: 1> I can not change again, 2.I have to wait for another 3 hours for nonsmoking room as I reserved... I agreed and went downstair. The front desk staff actually was about to gave us the new key directly but then she checked with the inside staff and told us we had to wait 3 hours... I was going to explode w anger but it was already 2 o'clock, my kids had not had lunch so we just said ok n left for lunch. Now that I think about it, my reservation was originally for the main tower plus it was not our fault the first time we switched room.. the room door was broken!!!! to add it, the front office didn't even consider I may need bigger room eventhough I mentioned I need an extra bed!! Anyway, we went back around 5 and they finally gave us the new key.. we got up waiting for our bags which never come.. and the kids r so cranky already since they wanted to change their clothes.. they were up n on the road since 6 in the morning so my husband went down collected the bags himself. We were so tired we took a nap, when we got up I was about to gave my kids a bath when I saw the bathroom rug was stained... badly, smelly stained.. don't have the heart to spill it here what stain that was!! I just screamed on the phone and the superviser, Mr. Gunalan, came.. said sorry a couple time, changed the rug, gave me his card, asked me how many days I was going to stay... I answered, he said sorry again n that was it... to be honest I was hoping he asked how many days we were planning to stay to gave us an upgrade or some complimentary whatever.. but nooooo!!! that was the last time I heard from the management. To complete the nightmare, on our last night the electricity went out twice.. superb!!! not to long since I was up and called directly. the next day when we asked for late checked out they just said sorry can't do.. the hotel sooo fully booked!!!! we explained that we got our room around 6PM eventhough we came at 11 something and they still say sorry can't do.. Great!!! to top it out when we settle our bill we were charge breakfast for our first night.. gezzzz how can we had breakfast there when we got our room at 6PM??? Before I left the counter w so much anger the manager approached me, saying sorry n hope I will gave mandarin another opportunity to serve better. I said to him, well I am sorry too but I don't think I will ever comeback.. I rather stayed at 3 star hotel then back in Mandarin... as my kids said.... this hotel just not good.. anymore.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: mgk69
Reviews.Content: We booked for 5nights stay at this hotel and had 2 rooms booked for us. This hotel is very well located ie right in the middle of Orchad Rd, surrounded by all the good malls eg Takashimaya, Paragon etc. just have to walk acroos the street back to the hotel. the hotel has a fantastic mall too. Staff was polite and prompt. Room service was quick and neat. Food was good. Breakfast was a well spread affair. But the staff at the entrance of the restaraunt was rude at times , they did nt allow guests into the dining room till someone didn't assist them to the table. and because of that there was always a queue of guests waiting to get in... Room was clean and worth the money spent. swimming pool is unimpressive.... security is good...

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, not too comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: gaeul
Reviews.Content: This Hotel's new name is MANDARIN ORCHARD by the way and it's located nicely opposide Cineleisure shopping mall and other leading shopping centres. I took the deluxe room for a night and these are the Pros and Cons. Pros: 1. Spacious room for a deluxe room. 2. Nice bathroom with longbath. Will be better if there's a separate shower. 3. Good amenities. 4. Big bed. 5. Nice and spacious wardrobe. 6. Enough light during the day from the window. Cons: 1. Complicated check in process. I can imagine if I've many luggages and I've to be directed to the next level to do the necessary check in and then, take my stuff and go to my room. Going to the room can be complicated as well because they've so many "wings" and you might end up going to the wrong tower. 2. The pool is right beside the hotel's lobby. When I swim, I prefer it to be at a nice place with a good and quiet view. Not infront of the many people who walks in and out. 3. The mini-fridge in the room is hidden inside one of the small cupboard. Search for it. 4. The room is separated by a thin wall, I suppose and a connecting door to another room. I can hear the neighboring kids making so much noise even in the middle of the night! My partner and I couldn't get a good sleep at all because of all the baby cries and stuff coming from the next room. Remember also, whatever you say, they can hear you too. Totally no privacy. 5. Ordered room service at 9pm, food arrives at 10:30pm. Ordered a bowl of porridge and some meat sticks. The menu doesn't reflect a very high price, but when you order it, it's scarily expensive. Just the 2 food cost us up to $80! Other than that, the people forgot the pepper, salt, the requested fork and spoon. Felt that they weren't very conscientious about the patron's needs and feelings. 6. If you wake up early, and wish to find breakfast anywhere around your hotel, you'll only be stuck with MacDonald's down at Heeren because nothing is opened until 10:30 - 11:00AM. For the price I was paying, I believe I could get a much better hotel, at a much better location. I gave Mandarin Orchard a try because of it's location and I wanted to experience the plushness of living in a 5 star rated hotel. However, i was very disappointed. Things I hope they change: 1. Control of human traffic at the basement. (Shopping level). Although I understand that there's a shopping gallery connecting to the hotel, I feel that the hotel premise should only limit itself to the patrons and visitors and not any stranger(s). The place was filled with just people sitting around on the chairs and we, the real patrons, end up having to stand while waiting to be served. 2. Offer services to bring the patrons up to their room if their room is like way far away from the check in counter. It is terrible if you have to lug your luggage and desperately search for your tower. The staff who served us was pretty rush in telling us where to take the lift from (simply pointing from the counter where she was seated). She showed no sign of offering some help. Left right, left right, ... 3. Better sound proof rooms. 4. Better lit rooms. In the day time, the room's fine. During the night, there's hardly any good light that we can keep on to last the night except the bathroom's. 5. Better room service if you charge so high for service charges. Frankly, I believe any other hotel out of Orchard Road will do better than Mandarin Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: hillbury32
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and the room was excellent. Serviced efficiently and well. Well equipped and quiet despite its location on Orchard Road. Prices were as expected from this type of rated hotel. However the checking out experience was a nightmare, taking over 30 minutes which was mostly queuing. There are two areas in which you can check out although there are no signs to indicate this. One desk again without signs is dedicated to check in and after queuing to check out, for several minutes,to be told that only check in was allowed was annoying to say the least. The whole checkout procedure was so long winded and is clearly designed for the hotels benefit and not the customer. The hotels selling point is service but in this aspect they fell a long way short of being satisfactory. The porterage, restaurant and bar service were all excellent but watch out for the desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Inside a shopping mall, a huge, unpersonal and "complicated" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki-Mic
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean. There was not wireless and the Internet (cable) rate was expensive. The hotel is located on the biggest and busiest shopping street and the hotel is "inside" a shopping mall. The hotel is huge and unpersonal, it was very crowded all the time. The pool area was tiny and not so nice. There were several nice restaurants in the hotel/shopping mall, especially the Thai restaurant was really nice. The Chatterbox and the fried rice (or can't remember the exact name of the dish) that they were so famous for, was not that spectacular. The Sunday brunch was very nice and something I recommend. I was a bit disappointed, since I heard so much about the Mandarin chain and Mandarin hotels. I would not stay at this hotel again. Maybe we should have chosen the other Mandarin hotel instead in Singapore (I think the name of that hotel is Mandarin Oriental).

Reviews.Title: “This is not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: hoektoe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a whole week. Coming from south africa, this is not a 5 star hotel. yes we might have not stayed in a suite or so but the staff service was not suffice. Tha day of booking out the whole system did not work, we had too stand inline for 30minutes before anyone told us what happened. People were queeing up and there are almost no seats availible for people standing with kids and waiting in lobby to pay!!! or check in. I would expect a 5 star hotel to arange something for their clients in such a situation. Fortunately our flight was way later that day else could have been disaterous. I must thank them however for keeping our large luggage for a whole week while we went to thailand, but that is it. The buffet is same as 3 star in south africa.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel was almost kill me”
Reviews.Author: SunTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: I have to wait 6 hours to get the room in this hotel after check-in. I was sick and went to hospital Mount Elizabeth after terrible jet lagged. I did prepaid on internet & I can't get refunds! Careful to stay in this hotel let's the room overbooked. Worst experience in my life.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay, everything first class... except the toilet paper :-(”
Reviews.Author: MajorBlow
Reviews.Content: I stayed 8 nights which included exhibition dates, so rates higher. All the lower priced deluxe rooms had already been taken so least expensive choices were a premier room or a premier 'club' room. As it happened, the hotel quickly filled up with an influx of refugees owing to the Icelandic volcano fall-out. The club room rate included breakfast and free internet which the ordinary premier room did not, and if you added the cost of breakfast and daily internet to the premier room rate it worked out much the same as the club rate, so this is what I booked. The inclusive breakfast was taken in the club lounge which featured butler service as well as buffet. With the premier club room you also got free daily newspaper, free daily laundry (2pcs), a vibrating multi-programme massage chair in the room (fell asleep in it twice, thank you very much!), all day access to the lounge for free refreshments and best of all, free hors d'oeuvres and cocktails in the club lounge every evening 6-8pm. So if you had a mind to, you could stuff yourself silly with plates of smoked salmon, cold meats, vol-au-vents, cheese & biscuits, washed down with your favourite tipple or house wine, thereby saving yourself a visit to a restaurant. I checked in early morning in the main lobby so no problems whatsoever. As a 'club' guest I was able to check-out in the club lounge - all fast and painless. Staff in the club lounge were efficient, friendly and attentive, and all staff including maids and bellboys said hello to you when passing, and in the club lounge staff addressed you by name. As has been said elsewhere, the beds were very comfortable and the rooms well appointed. The bathrooms were state of the art but the oppulence was let down by the cheap toilet paper provided. The paper was thin with no strength to it especially when in contact with anything moist! Worlds apart from the thick plush towels and bath mat. I raised this point with reception, and a day later their head of house keeping knocked at my door. She defended the choice of paper and would have me believe it was of high quality; she obviously didn't know the meaning of 'crap'! Never the less she said my 'complaint' would be brought up at the next management meeting. I sincerely hope they introduce stronger paper. Would I stay again? Yes. The club package offered good value over other nroom choices at this standard of hotel. That said, their internet rates were not cheap although you had the options of wifi or network cable connections both with reasonable speed.

Reviews.Title: “Emphasis is on business travellers”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Mixed experience at this hotel. Very well appointed, swanky in fact and located on the prestigious Orchard Road, but I was left with the impression that business travellers are preferred. We were on 3 night stopover en route to Australia and wanted a luxury accomodation before our modest arrangements in Sydney (see my Crest Hotel Sydney review) but we left the Mandarin feeling we hadn't gotten value for money. For a start, one is now allowed into the top floor bar without formal attire. I've never witnessed this rule being enforced with hotel guests before, but it was here. Check-in and check-out are time-consuming procedures unless you qualify for express service (corporate bookings once again). Breakfast hadn't the international feel one expects in these type of hotels, somewhat limited as was concierge service. On the plus side, you can walk to Raffles Hotel, to visit the famous Long Bar and have a Singapore Sling, the rooms are large and very well finished, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms impressive. I Overall a bit too large, soulless and dare I say, elitist.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished, Nice But Can Be Confusing”
Reviews.Author: Rafaya
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in this hotel since I was practically a kid back in grade school. We always stayed there everytime we went to Singapore due to its central location on Orchard Road. The last time we stayed there in 2009, it was undergoing a major refurbishment and so both my husband and I were excited to go there to experience the "new" hotel this year. We were not disappointed. The rooms have gotten "fresher", the lobby more spacious and the restaurant has been turned into a very modern and classy venue with many seatings compared to the old one. My only comment on the room is that the lighting tends to be on the dim side for my liking. As most hotel service in Singapore, check-in and check-out was simple, fast and had no-frills. There were no personal touches but then again, since this is more of a busines hotel, for me personally it was proper and adequate. The hotel is now part of a new luxurious mall and it can be very confusing. I saw many tourists coming to the hotel getting very confused and during my morning walk bumped into a confused man with a huge luggage who couldn't find the entry to the hotel. So here's my tip and hopefully it can help if you're coming to the hotel. If you arrive by Taxi, it will drop you off on the lobby which is on the side part of the hotel. Now this is not the main lobby so you can leave your luggage here for the Concierge to bring it your room later or alternatively bring your own and head to the elevator. Tha main lobby is located on the 5th Floor and this is where the Reception area is. If you are coming by MRT, then you can head to the main entrance of the Mall, there is a Glass Door in the middle next to the branded / luxurious stores. Upon entrance, you will find a series of elevators and you can take it to the 5th Floor where again, you will find the main lobby. We will definitely stay here again and if you're coming to Singapore for a shopping spree the hotel is very convenient since you can always go back and drop your shopping bags before heading on to another shopping session.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever Check-in Experience”
Reviews.Author: Muggsy23
Reviews.Content: We were forced to stay in Singapore two extra nights because of the Iceland volcano eruption. We only stayed at this hotel because it had a central location. But unfortunately the check-in experience sullied the entire stay. It must be said that the staff were very pleasant and the room was great, but the 30 minutes we spent either waiting for or being catered to by the check-in staff was the most frustrating hotel experiences my wife and I have ever encountered. There were no queuing arrangements and hence it was a pot luck supermarket type situation that ended with me in one line and my wife in another in order to enhance our ability to be served. When we were finally served there was an incredible amount of detail required including the presentation of both our passports and an inordinate amount of key board operation to record the details. Their computer systems must be verging on useless. When we had finally managed this process we were told the room wasn't available for 2 hours; this was OK because were early, but the thought of having to re-queue again did not fill us with delight. We did and the experience was annoyingly, exactly the same!! It is interesting that our annoyance levels with the process were the same as everybody else and no one we saw or spoke to left the counter without having to control their anger. I felt sorry for the reception staff who must be the most stressed hotel workers in the world. Great location for centrality, but only if you have a pocket full of money and are into expensive designer clothes.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you don't mind being in a shopping centre”
Reviews.Author: cham3b
Reviews.Content: I found the check in staff quite cold and whilst they did their job, it was a job only. The hotel complex is quite unusual as you have to walk through a shopping centre to get to your room and it is busy everywhere. Rooms are OK, nice bathroom in particular. Breakfast was excellent but expensive so eat all you can! I stayed here many years ago before it was redeveloped and it has lost some of its charm. The location on Orchard Road is good but there are other hotels around that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with amazing service!!!”
Reviews.Author: rsvedi
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best hotels ive ever stayed in. Form the moment i stepped into the hotel till the time i checked out, i could not fine even 1 fault in the hotel. The location is the best in singapore, service is perfect, most comfortable rooms . Best in all terms. The hotel is an atrium kinds hotel with a center lobby with piano played in the evening, its an experience by itself. I can assure you, once u reach the hotel you would never want to check out...

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: melmel75
Reviews.Content: I had been staying in the hotel for close to a month now due to work in Singapore and so far its been good except the breakfast they serve is the same thing every morning and most of the housekeeping staffs cant understand English. The old wing (tho recently renovated), the fixture looks rather old and run down.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel directly on Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: fruehstueckspause
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel in two high rise towers on Orchard Rd. Stayed there two weeks and loved the breakfast on 35th floor. Flexible service: Arrived early in the morning. Until my room was ready, I was offered to shower and change in another room Pros: Very spacious rooms with large bed and large bathroom (which lack some color, though) Good, friendly and helpful staff Good gym Breakfast buffet in 35th floor with a large selection Good security Cons: There was a lot of construction during my stay, entrance was hard to find. Pool was out of order Would stay there again, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: FCNB
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to it's star rating, with courteous staff. Check-in and check-out was fast and no-hassles. We had 3 adults and 2 kids in the travelling party and booked two premier rooms in the Orchard wing. Knowing this the hotel gave us adjoining rooms with door access which made it very convenient. The hotel also surprised my mother who was travelling with us, with a birthday cake as it was her birthday during our stay. What a great touch. Also make sure you try the Mandarin Chicken....it's th best. The location is also the most convenient in town. Will definitely stay again if we are next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Osim massager”
Reviews.Author: Jaishree_10
Reviews.Content: Loved the Osim massager. good back and foot massage after shopping. Enjoyed the snacks and drinks in the evenings. All club rooms have free snacks and drinks in the evening

Reviews.Title: “Best location for designers brand shopping but not really exciting hotel”
Reviews.Author: yutejilco
Reviews.Content: good location, well trained staff, but it's not something where you would like to stay for enjoy hotel life. the room hasn't got any unique features, no interesting furniture, wall picture, luxurious objects which helps guest forget and release from day to day regular life. Overall, good hotel, but I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located in Orchard road but..”
Reviews.Author: Turki_Saad
Reviews.Content: This hotel with doubt is perfectly located in Orchard Road, with its Chinese atmosphere, it creates an environemnt of the asian hospitality. But it has some flaws: - Very lengthy check in (it took from me 42 mins to queue and check in) - With its location in Orchard road, the Taxi queues will take sometimes (significant) since the most of the queuers are shoppers from around shopping centers. and the bellmen there are really useless. -The breakfast is really crowded and most of the served dishes are from Chinese Cuisine

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BRIJESH67
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with excellence in every possible hospitality parameter. Staff is extremely courteous and friendly. Location is best possible with 2 MRT stations nearby and orchard road. Room size is big enough for a family with 2 children. Only minor negative is expensive internet facility.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Anna_anna83
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Big and light rooms. The stuff is very friendly and helpful. Very fair rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelhoneybee
Reviews.Content: Located on the middle of Orchard Road, very conveniance for travellers. Due to renovation, well-known chiken rice restaurant, Chatterbox was temp located at the revolving restaurant ou the top. We had a great lunch by viewing Spore city.

Reviews.Title: “Made my First International Trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: SakpalVijay
Reviews.Content: As this was my first international trip I was expecting quite a lot out of this trip. And yes the hotel provided all the amentities that we were looking forware and made our stary more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat for location (but can get noisy)”
Reviews.Author: Nando1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the older wing of the hotel (must've been because I booked online on the cheap), so of course, the rooms were slightly dated. Nonetheless, they were spacious and very clean, with very little signs of ageing/wear except for the slightly dated decor. To get to the rooms is a bit of a pain in this wing as I had to take two different lifts from the main entrance. Not a massive deal, but an inconvenience still. All the staff were very friendly and efficient, and all greet you as they pass you in the hallways. On a side note, the staff uniforms of traditional Cheong Sams are VERY....eyecatching. I hate hotels with a combined bath/shower, so the Meritus got kudos for a separate shower. Rooms are big but pretty bog standard with no real differentiating features to any other hotel of this class or era. Location-wise, well there's not much to be said. You're on Orchard Road! A caveat though...this also means the footpath traffic can get VERY noisy in the evening (and if you have a room facing Orchard Road). Overall a nice hotel, good value and location that can't be beat. I hear a new shopping arcade has just opened up downstairs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinetan168
Reviews.Content: Fabulous new rooms. I loved the fact that you need to swipe a key on the elevator to get up to your room, makes me feel secure since the lobby can be a little hectic. Staff was always greeted us with smiles. We even asked to borrow a baby cot, and within a few minutes a nice clean one was sent up to our room. Great hotel overall. Although the twin beds are a little too narrow for my taste. Great location just beside the Takashimaya.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vijaydhiman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated on the Orchid road which is the most happening area in Singapore. I was there for 10 days during Christmas and the whole area near to the hotel was well decorated with lights. Talking about the hotel, rooms are quite small in comparison to other five star hotels. Room service is also not upto the mark. There is huge line in front of the resturant for breakfast every day. I will not recomend this hotel if some body is going for enjoyment

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, beware bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: masAndrew
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel and although the location is great smack in the middle of Orchard Rd the hotel is lacking, especially for the $300USD a night rate. The 1st time I laid down on the bed in that hotel I was itching like crazy. Immediately I noticed red bite marks all over my legs and arms. This was obviously bed bugs and continued for a few days. I complained to mgmt and they did nothing as the hotel was booked and could not move me to another room. Only saving grace is the location, if you have a choice avoid this place. Orchard rd is packed with hotels too bad this place let me down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, useless service”
Reviews.Author: siglo
Reviews.Content: Probably has the best location if one wants to be at Orchard Road Unfortunately, the service cannot cope with its popularity. For my recent stay, I was told that my room would be ready at 2pm but upon enquiry at 330pm, the receptionist tried to push me off with the standard excuse that the last guest has extended his checkout and the room was not ready. It was only with persistence and insistence to speak to the manager was my room handed to me at 415pm. Clearly, if I had allowed myself to move away from the reception desk, I would not have my room until much later. Another guest commented the next day that their room was only ready at 9pm! For S$320++ per night for a standard room, this is not the service one expects. The attitude of the reception counter staff and the manager left one feeling that one was not a welcome guest I do not recommend this hotel if one is expecting 4 star service. The service is certainly 2 star

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hessta
Reviews.Content: Hospitality was great. Centrally located on Orchard, close to food and entertainment. Out of the way and mid price, so not alot of slumming going on. great staging area for families or party revelers.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Mandarian”
Reviews.Author: hgolchha
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. good location, right in the middle of Orchard Road. Good for shopping and very central. Friendly staff and very good rates due to renovation.The only problem is that they do not have free internet. Wish they had.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a good location In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: NathaliaAPH
Reviews.Content: When we went at this hotel On August 2009, this hotel still under renovating, but there is no noisy sound or dirt. The hotel can keep the sound & cleanliness. Compare with December 2007 when we also stay in this hotel for holiday with my family, the hotel looks more elegant & clean. The hotel location is in the middle of Orchard Road, that surrounding with the good shopping mall such as, Nge Ann City, Tang, Lucky Plaza, Paragon, etc. Just 5 minutes walk from Orchard MRT, that can be pass underground from Nge Ann City (next to hotel). The breakfast is good, but if you want to get breakfast near the hotel, you can just go to the Lucky Plaza FoodCourt (Hotel's opposite). Bus & taxi also easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: peripatetic_aust
Reviews.Content: This is huge. Like mega. Staffed by lots of "know little" but well meaning mainland Chinese staff in out of date attire reminiscent of HK 1970s. Rooms are huge and dour but clean and well appointed. Views over bustling SG are great. Food is fast and clean but trad and boring. Check in is ok but the feeling of genuine greeting and care is not there; very much a factory. But then it is big; real big. On balance on value for money and location +++. On experience and ambience, no no no. Staff courteous but flat. Once senses it is a huge engine which it is.

Reviews.Title: “okay if you want central location”
Reviews.Author: AngusC
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms are well presented, and the public areas are freshly presented, although the layout of the hotel can be confusing and lacking in bright external light in the public areas. Hotel pool size is only 1.2m deep and disappointingly small, with no aspect, would have expected better for this hotel size/price. Fitness centre is housed in converted bedrooms with the carpet still in place, so it had the equipment but not perhaps the best atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “An average experience”
Reviews.Author: JohannJ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located but every thing else is lacking, which is a shame. The staff though are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel, but also not a 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: HerrBecker
Reviews.Content: The strategy of this hotel seems to be very clear, decrease the price and utilise the hotel as much as possible. The rooms have very different standards and are assigned quite randomly. Some older rooms are really terribel, some newer are ok. You have to queue up everywhere, as the hotel is normally full. On the other hand, you will not find a 5 star hotel on the middle of Orachrd road for below 150 SGD.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: traveller_in_oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Level 27 with access to Executive Lounge. Room was large, clean and reasonably modern for one person. Executive Lounge was great for breakfast and afternoon snacks. Staff were fantastic and brought a cake and flowers to my room for my birthday - a nice touch. Hotel is currently undergoing renovation - No hot water on one morning was unfortunate, and the fitness centre is functional, but is certainly unconventional in layout.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE ROOM & SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: May20095
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last Xmas and renovation had started. Renovation has been going on for 1 yr and it seems like they only renovated the lobby. The room we stayed is old, TV is fuzzy and old, sheets have holes, etc. Toiletries are never in complete set and we have to keep requesting from housekeeping. Key cards that do not work. What is going on with this hotel? We used to have such good memories of this hotel. But now, we have decided not to stay in this hotel ever. Really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaion but poor service and scruffy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ans1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel only for one night. Arrived very late and were greeted with the sight of renovations all around the hotel. The staff at check in were incredibly unfriendly and bordering on incompetent - it took them (without exaggeration) more than 15 minutes to check us in despite us having confirmed reservations. Yes, the hotel inside has been largely renovated (not to my taste though). The rooms are still ordinary (incredibly small, old-fashioned TV, poor settee, etc.) and the bathroom only adequate. Still having to pay for internet access is a pet niggle of mine and you have to do that here (plus with a cable as no wi-fi). Unfortunately, for me the only thing good about it is the location on Orchard Road but I am sure there are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: savi2
Reviews.Content: It's my third visit at this hotel. It's the hotel I think of if going to Singapore and thinking of shoppings. The hotel is right at orchard road so easy to get around. The facillities inside the hotel are terrific...eg jazz band, shopping arcades and numerous restaurants. What I like is the in room service. My favourite is the bolognese sphagetti! Check in and out are done in few seconds and inside the room it's spacious...lots of pillows (that which I like most). Very soft bed. The price is rather expensive but still I never hesitate to pay for the high price and got back the wonderful accommodation. I like it since the first time I got there in the year 2005 and since then I went back every year and never chose any other hotel. Friends and family are always happy at this hotel and I myself would go back if I happened to be in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but beware the renovations”
Reviews.Author: djcrooks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meritus Mandarin 4 nights to attend the Formula 1 race. The hotel is in almost the perfect location, being the in the middle of Orchard Road and only 1/2 block to the MRT station. I called back in July before making the reservation to check if the renovations would be completed before our stay and was told they would be done by mid September. Upon arrival it was obvious the renovations were still ongoing and we were told by the check-in staff they would not be finished until year end. The lobby is a make-shift area located on the 5th floor and the pool is closed. For the inconvenience, we were quickly offered an upgraded room near the top of the hotel with a full view of Orchard Road and complimentary breakfast each day in the top floor restaurant. The room itself was just standard fare, with two comfortable beds and a typical hotel bathroom. We were surprised to find an old CRT television instead of an LCD or plasma model. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms.. great bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: ParadisoSuites
Reviews.Content: very good rooms for the price i paid.. i think they had lowered thier rates due to major renovations going on in the hotel.. i didnt hear any noises of any works at night but heard a little during the day... the bathrooms were a great feature of this hotel. i was very satisfied with thier showers. nice and spacious with a very homely feel to it.. a small thing though was we had to change lifts (elevators) at the lobby floor to get to the room.. another annoyance was i had to pay for valet parking being a hotel guest.. this is unheard of in Thailand..

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms vs. best location - you decide!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnonUs
Reviews.Content: We've been to Singapore for business and vacation countless times, staying in many different hotels. We stayed in the Meritus once before (about 4 years ago), choosing it for its location: exact middle of Orchard road, next door to Nee Ann City (Takashimaya and Kinokuniya). Irrespective of the price of the rooms, they are VERY, VERY SMALL with virtually no room for clothing storage. Also, the hotel seems kind of sterile! At that time I decided not to return. This time we had no choice. We booked last minute and there were few rooms available due to the Formula-1 events. We booked a Premier room with a view of Orchard road - though I have no idea what is so "premier" about it. It was pretty plain and SMALL. We booked directly with the hotel from their site. Rate was higher because we had the bad luck of stopping over during the Formula-1 weekend. Internet rate normally about US$240 but I paid $290 WITHOUT breakfast. Extra bed for daughter very overpriced at US$56. The hotel was nearly fully booked due to the racing events, weddings and conferences. While the staff were very friendly and made an effort to make you feel appreciated (a big feat considering they have 1200 rooms), we got the sense the staff were just trying to keep up with the volume of guests. Question: Why can't 5* hotels ever give you the right amount of towels? In my reservation form I clearly marked THREE people. There was only 1 set of towels!! This might seem like nit-picking, but we just came from a little hotel in Hanoi ($75 for a room twice the size of the Meritus) and they had THREE sets of towels and THREE slipper sets in the room waiting for us when we walked in!!!! The Meritus Manderin has the best location, but it is a very commercial hotel. I recommend it for a SHORT 2 or 3 night stay, spending all your time out on the town. But if you stay longer or want to spend time lounging and enjoying your room - then stay somewhere that has bigger rooms and better atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!!”
Reviews.Author: marshmallowgirl
Reviews.Content: i stayed in meritus last week during my short holiday. love the location as it is located exactly in the centre of orchard road.. this is my first time staying in meritus and honestly, i expect good service from a 5* hotel.. when i arrived, the doormen/taxi guy took my luggage like some kind of thief and told me in unfriendly manner that the lobby is in 5th floor (which is weird). my first night was ok. second night, i started to feel disappointed with the service. the housekeeping only put ONE hand towel where there was supposed to be two! i decided to call the housekeeping as i did not wanna get blamed for the missing towel and accused for stealing it (which is stupid!). when the guy in charge picked up the phone, i explained the situation and his answer was simply "no maam, we won't charge you for the missing towel".. i guess he simply did not understand what was i saying (as if it wasn't clear enough). he might not charge me, but the FO might when they found one missing towel. he didn't apologize though! and then third day, i arrived at the hotel at around 11 after shopping around and did not notice the missing bath mat until when i wanted to take a shower. i called the HK again and the lady said "ok we will send someone over". did not apologize AGAIN! and then this HK guy came and guess what he brought. bath towel!!! at least he understood the second time i explained that i requested a bath MAT, not a bath TOWEL! i just didn't understand how come there was a miscommunication over simple stuff!
