i felt disappointed already. then came my last day and i checked out. the lobby was freakin noisy and the check out process was SO SLOWWWW!! ok first, i queued and the lady in cheongsam (didn't know what was her job exactly) came and said "check out?" then i was like "yes". she said "just a moment please".. there were lotsa of staffs in the FO area and this guy finally asked me "may i help you maam?" and i was like "i'd like to check out" and he went "ermmmm.. just a moment" and he was like laughing confusedly and this guy and the cheongsam lady was like chitchatting and "joking" about my check-out request. i mean what kind of service was that!!! during my queue, although i came first, this lady let other guy to slip my turn. oh and one more thing, the doormen are not friendly at all. and i cant believe that the taxi guys did not put an effort at all to find taxis for the guests and they even joke around when they thought it was a lil quieter. i mean come on, sometimes people need to rush and it is unacceptable to have slow service in singapore (where everything's supposed to be fast). i might stay there again for a really short stay coz i really love the location (except if the park hotel is back). but if my second stay turns out to be sucks again, well i will never ever go back to meritus mandarin where it is supposed to be a 5* hotel but have 2* hotel service! (even some budget hotels offer better service!)

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location!”
Reviews.Author: sankar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel on a stopover. Located right in the middle of Orchard Road - Takashimaya's next door, Centepoint, Paragon, etc. are across the road. Great place for Orchard road shopping and eat. Large rooms and bathrooms with twin vanities, and the website offers good deals for weekend stays. However, there seems to some renovation going on in the bottom floors and the swimming pool, and the reception lobby has been moved to the 5th floor and made much smaller. The public spaces are hence very busy and it and makes the check in/check out process very chaotic and time-consuming. While all this doesn't affect the rooms, it does make the getting in and out experience very poor, and I hope they complete the work soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option”
Reviews.Author: asia09forme
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights here on a good deal thru wotif, our splurge!. the place is renovating the reception so check in was on level 5 which was not ideal - i guess it will be better after the rennovations but frustrating at the moment/ The rooms were really nice but for me there is a point when you try to be too clever with your technology and it just becomes annoying. I also couldn't turn off one of the lights which was annoying at night - Apart from that beautiful rooms and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely spot-on!”
Reviews.Author: pokpok
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay at the newly renovated Meritus Mandarin, I was there for 3 days 2 nights last month. From the moment I was attended to at the Front Desk during check-in to the moment I stepped out of the premises after check-out, I felt I was completely in good hands.Centrally located on Orchard Road between all the shopping malls, the location is a big plus-point. It is a good hotel with clean and comfortable rooms. The staff is courteous and helpful, and the food is good, not to mention - the chicken rice! I don't mind ordering the same thing 2 times a day! I can't wait till Dec 2009 when the hotel is fully renovated for Christmas celebration. Yes, I'll definitely go back to Meritus Mandarin again this end of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AwayFromHome09
Reviews.Content: I was on a shopping weekend with friends. We checked trip advisor and the Mertius Mandarin seemed reasonable value and a good location for what we were planning. We used the hotel website to book and were impressed with the hotel photos. Our first problem occurred before we arrived. Despite being able to specify 3 adults per room on the online booking, the price we booked did not take this into account. After making the booking we were informed of the extra charge for the third bed. This was frustrating after spending so long choosing a hotel only to find the rate we were quoted for our three bed room was incorrect. Due to lack to time to plan anything else we agreed to pay the extra charge. Unfortunately when we arrived at the hotel we did not see anything which resembled the photos we'd seen on the hotel website, and the hotel was actually under construction. This was not mentioned when we made the booking online. We arrived early and so checked in but without our room being ready, left our bags at reception and began shopping. After spending many hours (easily done) shopping on Orchard Rd we returned to the hotel many hours after we could have got the keys to our room. Back in reception, considering we'd already checked in, it took a long time to get the keys to our room. Frustration increased when once in our room we found only two beds!! A call to housekeeping and this was fixed but not something we expected to have to do. The main problem I had with this hotel was the construction work outside, overhanging the pavement. There were guys welding and banging tools about 20m above the pavement. This was an obvious health and safety issue. The construction work also meant the only entry and exit to the hotel was through the car drop off point where taxis, mini-coaches and cars were moving constantly. There was no pedestrian path, only the driveway which we had to share with the traffic. I was very unimpressed with this, and not something I'd want to have to negotiate with a push chair or small children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jatv
Reviews.Content: During this trip with my wife and 8 year old son we decided to book a hotel in Orchard Road and we enjoyed every bit of our stay. Though the hotel is under renovation the management sees to it that you won't be bothered by this. Though the temporary location of its reception is small and if you plan on waiting in the lobby you can't find a spot to seat. Check-in was a breeze even though we arrived earlier than the required check-in time. Small items added to the over-all experience, like complimentary fruits by the bed side in the afternoon. Location also plays a great role, everything is within a few minutes walk, shops, restaurants, subway station, etc.. Will definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Classy Place”
Reviews.Author: prockbirdman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meritus Mandarin for a week this past February. It was an excellent hotel, right on Orchard Road. A classy venue at a good price... Thank you, you will not regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “very commercial”
Reviews.Author: FussyLilPrincess
Reviews.Content: location is great, and not too pricey. staff not too friendly (have a feeling they are a bit biased towards the guests). queue for check in and check out and concierge is always long. looks more like public information counters. noisy and busy lobby. room is not impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Far too big but nevertheless good for families.”
Reviews.Author: NettiAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time in Singapore and this time with a young kid and a baby. The hotel is huge, which I somehow thought might be good but it was rather impersonal. There are also too many Chinese and Japanese tourist groups, who were taking photos of our baby all the time. The rooms were bigger than we expected and had enough space to accommodate both kids in separate beds, definitely an advantage. The staff was very helpful and sterilized all the bottles twice daily. A definite minus for us was the construction work, which meant that there was no pool. This was not evident from their website when I booked the hotel. We had the choice to go to the Marina Mandarin for a swim and even got the taxi money refunded. However, it was quite a drag to get there and their pool was in full sun and hence useless for babies. In general, I would recommend it for travelers with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “"Ok" but under my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Deanman
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the price was too high for this kind of hotel/room. The water pressure of the shower was pretty low (23th floor), the room was ok, to access the hotel you've to go through a side entrance - cause of building works (till Oct 2009!). Additional you've to switch the elevator to access your floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: BaileyLaunceston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay. The Hotel is in a great location on Orchard Road. Even though the Hotel is under going renovations, we were not disturbed by noise at all during our stay. The staff are all very accommodating, nothing to much trouble, our room was very clean & spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, flawless!”
Reviews.Author: SoniK10
Reviews.Content: Booked our 5 night stay with great anxiety after reading about renovations and noise, etc. Thankfully was completely floored by the hotel. Renovations are on in the tower which is on the main road and we were completely unaffected with our room in the side tower. The room and bathroom looks brand new and is a luxurious size with all the comforts you can think of. The highlight was that you could shop away at all the malls on Orchard and come back to drop off your bags 10 times a day if you wanted to! We got a room for about $140USD without breakfast but inclusive of taxes, etc. Was totally worth the money and could travel around with great ease to Clarke Quay, etc by taxi, although the MRT is a few minutes walk away we didn't bother with it.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Hype!!”
Reviews.Author: macuser8874
Reviews.Content: On the whole this is a good hotel with clean and comfortable rooms. The staff is courteous and helpful, and the food is good. The location of course is perfect on Orchard road. However, there are too many rooms in this huge hotel, and hence constant overcrowding of the lobby and public places. Also because of this the hotel seems "understaffed" in a sense. Breakfast was average. For all of this, the rooms are definitely overpriced. Overall unnecessary hype about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “don't visit until renovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: SandgrounderSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room in the original tower. Rooms are tired and noise from renovations continues from early morning until late at night. With so many hotels in Singapore to choose from best to wait until renovations are over before staying at the Meritus Mandarin

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not 5 star quality”
Reviews.Author: raindropsonroses
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Meritus Mandarin in mid-June. The hotel was undergoing renovations so we had to walk down a long corridor to get to the lifts, but it wasn't too inconvenient. You could hear the construction in the lobby but it was quiet in our hotel room on the 20th floor (although we heard occasional clicking noises in the air-con). The location was fantastic. Centrally located on Orchard Road between all the shopping malls, and only a 3 minute walk to Somerset MRT station. It was also very close to the Singapore Visitor's Centre where we went for tourist maps and to redeem taxi vouchers as part of the tourism promotion. The hotel room did seem a bit old - the furniture was outdated, and the tv remote control was missing the battery cover. The bed sheets and quilt covers had stains and holes - certainly not 5 star quality. I wanted to try out the swimming pool but was advised it was closed due to the renovations. The hotel did say they were able to reimburse my taxi travel to the Marina Mandarin hotel if I wanted to use their pool, but I didn't take them up on the offer. In summary, the hotel is in a great location, but I would not say it deserves its 5 star rating. Perhaps if will improve after the renovations are complete, but I won't be staying here again based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Too long to check in and out!”
Reviews.Author: dmrres
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, excellent location on Orchard road although can get a little busy. Swimming pool and area in need of updating. Staff courteous, the only down side is the speed of service now matter how much you do to prepare they take forever to check you in and out so leave at least 20 / 30 min to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: MsRichie
Reviews.Content: The Meritus was on renovation during our stay. Had to go through a long hallway to go to the other building. Construction noise was heard even late at night and wee hours in the morning. Staff were extremely courteous. Great location for shoppers as it was along Orchard Road and right beside Takashimaya. Easy transportation access. Clean lobby and rooms - except for the sheets and linens! We asked for extra blankets and flat sheets and there were stains all over. Some even had loose hair! Got the rooms on bargain as we were advised of the ongoing renovations. We must have gotten what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gorby
Reviews.Content: The Meritus Mandarin is centrally located along Orchard Road. The lobby is quite busy but you get attended to quickly. Receptionists were attentive - they made sure everyone was attended to at the soonest possible moment. The concierge was very helpful - we made a reservation through them and they helped us get to the restaurant which was located nearby but in an area which was confusing to get to. (Tip: if you're going some place, ask your concierge to print a map or indicate on a map how to get there - especially if it's nearby. Our destination was 3-5 minutes from the hotel but the cab brought us around and around so we ended up paying more than we should have.) The rooms are very spacious. We booked a deluxe room through our travel agent. We had a 1yr 8mo baby with us and there was enough room for a crib, our 2 luggages and space for our baby to run around. There were 2 sinks, a bathtub - it was a spacious bathroom. Lights were controlled digitally with the press of a button. There were blackout curtains to block out the sunlight. Try the chicken rice from chatterbox - the hotel's restaurant. They claim that it's an award-winning dish and I totally agree! Even my little picky eater loved it. (Tip: If you order room service from chatterbox, they charge an extra SD15 or so per dish. If you mind the additional SD15 per dish, order it from the room and then go pick it up yourself and you can eat it in the room. They provide disposable tupperware and utensils.) Our room was between our brother's room and our aunt's room. Our baby would cry now and then in the middle night and we asked them if they heard anything. They said they didn't hear anything at all. I guess that means their rooms are sound-proofed well enough. Renovations are going on but I think they're doing their best to keep the noise level at a minimum. I was once awakened by a banging noise around 8-ish in the morning but it didn't last long. This is probably the best time to book with them since they probably can't demand a full price yet considering the construction and what a deterent that is to most travellers. But seriously, it isn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the city- feel the pulse !”
Reviews.Author: Gutsy420
Reviews.Content: Being located in the midst of Orchard road, the shopping paradise of Singapore, a hotel shopaholics cannot ignore. It brings you right in the heart of the city, you can feel the pulse of the city especially during Christmas and New Year, when the Orchard Road is lit up, watch the parades from the comfort of your room or just see busy shoppers jostle by. You have ample choice of rooms which comes with all the facilities you expect from a star category hotel. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Theirs a good choice of F&B outlets but they are not classy enough. The service standard needs major improvement.The pool area is not what you expect from this type of hotel, with broken tile at the swimming pool bottom to the landscaping and quality of sunbeds and towels, all needs up gradation.

Reviews.Title: “good slumber for mall shoppers”
Reviews.Author: laurice m
Reviews.Content: located at orchard road -an ease for mall shoppers; nice hotel which gives a better view of the city during breakfast at the observation lounge (level 38); and oh, the perfectly soft and flabby pillows made me sleep in a haste!

Reviews.Title: “great time in Meritus”
Reviews.Author: Kuhlit
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. The staffs were friendly and gave us fruits, bottled water and newspaper daily. Rooms were big and toilet was clean. Location is also great since it is in Orchard Road and near MRT station and shopping areas. We will definitely stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a noderful stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thejos
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore, and we were really impressed with this hotel, particularly after reading so many unhappy reviews prior to our travel. We were upgraded to the 37th floor on our arrival, to a room overlooking Orchard Road. Room service great, with no tipping expected (unlike Thailand). The staff were lovely, particularly the bellhops, and the restaurant staff. Enjoyed the (free) breakfasts each morning, and had no complaints about the selection of food. Booked this accommodation through Wotif, and were treated with as much courtesy as everyone else, so really good value, and of course a great location. :)

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: periwinkle23
Reviews.Content: We had to book 6 rooms and they did their best to give in to our requests. Excellent service from the doorman to reception to housekeeping and bellboys! Everybody was very accommodating, friendly and was always wearing a smile. The rooms were clean and well-appointed. Location was perfect!!! They were having renovations when we stayed there but it wasn't that bothersome. We didn't notice any noise. Though we had to walk through a long hallway from the lobby to the elevator of the Orchard wing but a lot of hotel personnel were present to help. The breakfast was on the 38th floor and had 360 degree-view of the city. Only downside was the breakfast itself since it lacked variety. Over-all, great hotel, great location, great service and we would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting something better”
Reviews.Author: cluntks
Reviews.Content: Chose the Meritus Mandarin because I wanted to stay in Orchard Rd for a few days and heard good reviews about it. The experience at this hotel was very disappointing as I was expecting, the least, an average business hotel. Btw, the Meritus was going through renovation when I stayed there. The room - standard deluxe. I was upgraded - which was a pleasant surprise, but and I wonder what the experience would've been if not... Room view gave to the roof of another building, with the air filtering system above my view, and ears. I was aware that being in the middle of Orchard Rd wouldn't guarantee perfect silence... or maybe I'm too sensitive to noise. Room size itself was quite big. You can see the furniture and room is a bit dated though. Bathroom decent sized with bath. Found a hair in the tub and there were ponctual waves of a sewage smell coming from the water bassin I think... Bed was basic. Comfortable, duvet a bit too thin. I also wondered about the grills on the ceiling in the room and bathroom... ventilation? They weren't closed properly so called room service which was quite quick to act. Breakfast is a complete joke. My fault because I chose to pay for it, but at around 28 S$ I was expecting more than white loaf bread (the sweet square ones), fried dumplings and co, NO fresh juices, a tiny egg station with noone actually there to prepare the eggs, and... the weird sensation you have when you come in a gigantic ballroom and see a little U shaped table with the buffet. Sure, you have female staff members standing in front of the main entrance in traditional red chongseams. But half of the time they are talking to collegues or ignoring you. To finish with a positive point, the location is great if you want to indulge in shopping or having amneties close to you. I spent hours at the Starbucks in the shopping mall facing the hotel, using free internet. For the moment, at the price the rooms go at the Meritus, you can definitely find something else better in Singapore, around Bugis, Marina, etc. Except if you're dead set on staying at Orchard. Ah and one last good point, the chicken rice at their restaurant Chatterbox is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotl”
Reviews.Author: raviessar
Reviews.Content: great location,expensive,old rooms,dingy rooms,bad room amneties,construction going on in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with a view!”
Reviews.Author: Konline
Reviews.Content: I came to Singapore from Seoul. The Taxi driver who took me to the Hotel was sweet and the ride cost me about Sing $ 23/ The Lobby was full of beautiful girls in bright red welcoming all guests. We got a Room on the 11th floor which was noisy as construction is going on. When we complained, we were immediately upgraded to the 23rd floor. The location is excellent as apart from being on Orchard Road, the Hotel is right next to Takashimaya and extremely convenient for shopping, eating and also for money changing. In fact the real friendly hotel staff guided me that I should change money at Takashi & not in the Hotel. The Coffee shop on the 33rd floor serves a sumptuous complimentary breakfast. The Chicken Rice (Room Service) here is famous and to die for. Security is excellent too. This Hotel good for women alone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the affection”
Reviews.Author: 29SP
Reviews.Content: Good Hoel in center of Singapore excellent business center good food good location good for money business and family suitable to both

Reviews.Title: “Half Service Construction Zone”
Reviews.Author: 45South
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this well located hotel many times over the last 9 years however this year it has taken a turn for the worse. They are rebuilding the hotel and should actually close it as half the services are just not there and the reconstruction is both noisy and disruptive. The Chatterbox restaurant is the only restaurant open and is poorly organised with disinterested staff and rather cold buffet food. The fitness centre is a joke. Gym equipment set up in tiny hotel rooms with poor lighting and ventilation. Club lounges that used to be useful places for meetings or evening drinks are closed. I got food poisoning from the fruit platter in my room from an apple that had so much pesticide on it that I gagged immediately and threw up. Sort of defined how I feel about this once great hotel that has gone bad.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: saintjared
Reviews.Content: Good Value for Money! Good clean rooms, bathroom showing signs of old age- blackish marks inside marble. Change the marble

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shoppers but taxi charges are high”
Reviews.Author: 3T
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. It is great in terms of downtown location, closed to shops, restaurants, cafes, and easy to get taxi. However, it is far away from my conference site and paying taxi with always some kind of extra charges is a minus experience. I was charged double to the airport just because I left before 6 am, and ended up paying over 40 dollars. The room and service are good, standard for this type of hotel. I stay in 27 floors of the main tower, so the renovation noise dose not bother me. The gym was temporary relocated at multiple of the former guest rooms. It was okay, but not great. The pool was still under renovation, so no relaxing swimming at the end of the hot day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterKuwait
Reviews.Content: The room we got was on the 26th floor (Non-Smoking). We were lucky that the street & renovation noise did not reach our room. Rooms were clean and well serviced. Toilets were surprisingly clean in comparison to the reviews I've read on trip advisor before going to stay there. We were there for 3 nights. In regards to the breakfast, since the prices were just too high at the hotel, we just went for breakfast to the malls across the road (Takashimaya & Paragon) where there is French and English Breakfast served at most of the Cafe's for 1/3 the hotel's price. If you are a shopper and like a decent stay, then Meritus is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Room, Good Service but Sloppy Checkout”
Reviews.Author: lil_punjabi_angel
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I thought this hotel was very good! I was very concerned about the level of noise as I knew that reconstruction was taking place. However I called the hotel before my journey to request a room on a higher floor so I'm not disturbed - and thats what I got (a room on the 32nd floor in the Main tower) and during my whole 8 day stay I didnt hear a peep of noise. Location: Excellent for a first time tourist to Singapore in the heart of Orchard Rd. The shoppers paradise. Taxi drivers never had a problem finding this hotel. Apart from shopping you can find Western fast food chains like Mcdonalds, Subway and other outlets, Currency Converters, Post office, Fresh fruit juice bars, cinema, bars, Orchard Rd MRT station etc. Check In: Very Smooth, didn't have to queue up. I arrived at 9am and requested an early check in. The lady at the desk was very polite and checked us in immediately at no extra charge. Another lady escorted us to our room. The porter brought our luggage with us in the same lift (as I had said that I need my bags immediatly) which was good. In the room, the lady took my credit card details as a gaurantee and saw our passports. Room: A good sized room with twin beds (as requested). The room had a very effective Air-con system and a iron board + iron . A kettle and stuff to make tea was in the room and was complimentary. The room was very clean and was serviced daily. Bathroom was a good size, fluffy towels, two sinks(?) and a bathtub with a shower. Breakfast: OK I can see some problems. The breakfast rooms got a bit too busy at times - however we never had to wait more than a few minutes for a table. They offered a continental breakfast choice: fresh fruits, crossaints/pastries, breads, beans, sausages, bacon (a bit too crispy for my liking), potatoe wedges, yoghurts and cereals. Omelletes could be ordered from the omellete bar, this could take very long as there was only 1 man with one stove! Local b/f choices were also available which I didnt try. On the whole I don't think one could go hungry. I noticed other reviewers complaining about inefficient staff, I didnt encounter this and thought all staff at b/f were very polite and efficient. Checkout: PROBLEM, two days before check out I called reception and asked what my TOTAL bill will be provided I don't use the minibar/telephone etc. I was given a figure and so I changed the appropriate amount of foreign currency so that I'm not delayed on the day of checkout. So the night before checkout, I go to settle the bill and guess what, the figure quoted is nearly SIN300 higher than before. I told the lady that I was given a different figure and she said that was only till the day I called!! Even though I made it very clear to the man on the fone! So I had to go out again and change more money - very inconvenient! On the whole a good a would reccommend this hotel to someone visiting Singapore. It's clean, in a great location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: Davepow
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this fantastic hotel. The room (south Tower) was lovely and had a good view over the parklands behind the hotel and parts of Orchard road. Good ammenities in room and always very clean. Staff were also all very friendly. A word of warning is that the hotel is under renovation. This didn't affect us in the south tower but one morning we went to the other tower for breakfast and the noise of the construction is noticable there. Also pool is closed during renovation but they will take you to another hotel if you need a swim. Location is perfect right on Orchard road if your into the shopping experience and less than a 5min walk to the MRT. As a first time user of the MRT I was surprised at how easy and effecient it was and would reccomend this method of transport for exploring Singapore. Only one negitive, every morning for a week we ate at the buffet for breakfast and every morning most of what we ate was cold (or not very hot). Great range of food available and it didn't really worry me that much.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: alyushka
Reviews.Content: lobby welcoming, room grubby, shower dirty, breakfast disgusting and expensive, noisy renovations ongoing of which we were not made aware at time of booking. despite advertising a swimming pool it was not available

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsKat_m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week in January 2009 for three nights and loved it. The service was brilliant, it was right on top of a shopping centre which was handy. It was a little out of the way for doing a lot of the sightseeing stuff that we were wanting to do but then taxi's in Singapore are so cheap and reliable that it didn't really matter and it wasn't so hot that week so we were able to walk to a lot of places. In making a reservation on their website I'd included in the comments that we were tavelling with an 8yo and would like an extra bed but they must have missed that and so when we arrived a little late at night and there was no extra bed we ended up sharing with our 8yo for the night but the next day we mentioned it at reception and a bed was provided immediately and at no extra charge. The service was brilliant throughout the hotel - in the gym, in the pool area and at the front desk. .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, breakfast disappointing”
Reviews.Author: grumblebums
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing major renovations which we were aware when booking. To compensate we were charged a very competitive room rate through Latestays which we feel more than made up for the inconvenience. Once through the noise and chaos of the lobby and lift area and in your room, you are not troubled at all by what is going on below. The room itself, although a little dated was clean, spacious, airy and bed comfortable. Bathroom had a bath and separate 'spa' type shower. The room was serviced twice daily - that is, bed made/turned down, towels changed, bathroom cleaned tea/coffee and water replenished etc. We found the room a little dark, as the net curtain at the window could not be pulled back and the lighting was not really very bright. Breakfast in the Chatterbox restaurant on the top floor was a bit crazy, staff appeared disorganized and somewhat untrained. Sometimes the teapot arrived with one tea bag, other times with three! The buffet is scattered in a complete circle which no-one really explains and because you can only see a small part of it you may be unaware that it continues right around. Quite frankly we found the breakfast buffet a little boring, especially if you do not eat the asian cuisine. It would have been nice to have some grilled tomatoes or mushrooms, instead of the stock standard baked beans, bacon (which was always cooked to a crisp) and egg. One morning the Chatterbox was so full for breakfast we were sent on a journey to the other tower. We ended up in the ballroom, where another buffet breakfast is served. This time the teapot arrived with no tea bag in it at all! Yes, it had tea of a decent strength but unfortunately stone cold! We pointed this out to the staff only to get another one of the same temperature. So no tea that morning and to top it off no marmalade for the toast - we asked but were told there was none. The staff didn't really go out of their way to please which is unfortunate. Then as we were leaving my husband observed the staff pouring back the unused tea from the teapots removed from the tables back into a big ern. He carefully checked and noticed it was not plugged in or heated in anyway! And yes, you guessed it he then witnessed them pouring 'fresh' teapots straight from this big ern. This explained the cold cups of tea - actually recycled from other teapots! I would have expected much better from a hotel of this calibre in central Orchard Rd. Check out did not go that smoothly either, after getting the bill, it came to $20 sgd more that our Latestays voucher said (and we had no other charges apart from the room) we queried it but the reception staff were unable to explain the discrepancy. Since we needed to leave for the airport we simply paid it and left. Not a good ending to our stay, but despite some negatives, overall we enjoyed the very central location of the hotel and the comfort and facilities of the room.

Reviews.Title: “sincere service”
Reviews.Author: figaro11
Reviews.Content: I was in singaproe last week for a meeting and was booked at traders hotel. It was quite dismal as everything seemed dirty and no one cared. It also cost around 300 US a night so after one night, I went trawling on the net for last minute deals and came upon a currently being renovated mandarin meritus. It was half the price and on orchard road so I took it. The next three nights were wonderful. It was quiet even with construction and the staff were really sincere. It was also my birthday and the chambermaid sweetly greeted me with flowers when i chanced upon her in the corridor. After a brief shopping spree on orchard, I returned to my room to find a birthday cake with a note from the staff. It was simple, undramatic, unobtrusive and felt absolutely sincere. Even the staff at the lobby are eager to assist and will give you tips on whatever you need. from the chambermaid to the front desk and even the doormen, meritus made you feel that they cared. I think they do this so well even if it is not my birthday. The room was fine, old and will be renovated I think but the only complaint i have is that it is so dark. Maybe the walls are painted a color that subdues light or maybe there just is not enough light. all in all, i was very happy. It was a short, sweet stay and I look forward to its fully renovated splendor at the end of the year. I sincerely hope the service does not change.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Service. But be awared of Noise!”
Reviews.Author: Teenoy
Reviews.Content: Hello, I booked a room for Meritus Mandarin via Agoda. When I reached the lobby, I tried to request for the upper-floored room to avoid any noise as the hotel is under major reburnishment. As I would like to stay on Non-Smoking floor, so the hotel officer gave me just the 11th Fl. room which very noisy. He said, there should not be any working during the night time (around 06:00PM - 09:00AM). Anyway, the beat came up! I must listen to the heavy noise in my brain eventhough that was midnight already! It's not fair that the hotel still charge customers a full-priced room for this kind of environment. For me, I should consider again and again to avoid them for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: globetrekker18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights from 25 to 29 Jan 09, which happens to fall on the same period as the Chinese New Year. Overall experience was good, we had the Premier room, nice, cozy and spacious. The location is excellent, right in the middle of singapore's shopping belt, and near the trains stations. On the first day of Chinese New Year, there were lion & dragon dance performances organised by the hotel, which is interesting for a tourist like me to understand the culture in Singapore. Although the hotel's pool is currently under renovation, alternative arrangements to swim can be made with the hotel's front desk / concierge. Hotel employees were very friendly and upbeat--willing to assist us with any questions or concerns and available 24 hours a day. Some of them even managed to remember and address by our first names! I will definitely stay at Meritus Mandarin if I have the chance to visit Singapore again. I had absolutely zero problems, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Shame we had to leave”
Reviews.Author: aussiefemale23
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at another hotel in Singapore for a night on our way from London to Australia however that hotel bumped us due to the Grand Prix or something along those lines. We were glad we were bumped to this hotel, it was fantastic. The location was perfect for what we wanted, which was to do a spot of shopping and winding down from a month of travel. We stayed the night before the Grand Prix so it was very busy but despite it being busy we still felt special, not like we were lost in the crowd. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful. We had book a Zoo breakfast with pick up and were worried our pick up hotel may still have ben the other hotel we were meant to stay at. The hotel rang and organised it all for us, had they not we wouldn't have been picked up for our zoo trip. We had a standard room which in Australia would probably be more like a King Deluxe suite. It was big and beautiful. Plenty of room to move, beautiful big bathroom, huge comfy bed. We were able to check in a few hours early and given late checkout too. We stayed just before the renovations started, I did read the hotel website before we left for our holiday and it clearly stated they would be doing renovations from the end of September 08 which included draining the pool. I would not hesitate to stay here again and have told many people to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid while they're renovating at all costs...”
Reviews.Author: waynu
Reviews.Content: We arrived and found that the hotel was undergoing a major renovation...which we hadn't been warned of when we booked. The pool had been emptied, the gym was shoved in a couple of guest rooms and the foyer has been reduced to a small desk behind the taxi rank. At first reception put us in a room directly above the construction work, where a jackhammer was being used. When we complained we were told "oh, they'll stop at 7pm". Eventually we kicked up enough of a fuss that they put us in another room away from the noise...but the last straw was when were were woken up at 2am by plumbing work. We asked the manager to swap us to their other hotel in Singapore but were told no - so we gladly cancelled the rest of the stay there altogether and switched to another hotel chain altogether. The Meritus Mandarin has a great location but they should have shut for the duration and shown some respect for their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Garden3
Reviews.Content: Spent New Year in Singapore at the Meritus Mandarin and was very impressed from the moment we arrived. The atrium is an amazing sight as you step from the lifts. The room was a good size with a balcony, which is unusual in a city hotel. The views from the balcony were stunning - Singapore flyer, Merlion and the Marina. Had the buffet breakfast once. Good food but a bit pricey, you can find cheaper alternatives a 5 minute walk away in the adjoining shopping mall. A great base for exploring this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “what a rip off”
Reviews.Author: salbe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night as a stop over and to do some shopping. We booked through Qantas and it was NOT cheap. The position is good (central) however that is where the good things about this hotel end. The service was appalling - we waited 2 hours for our luggage to be brought to our room after check-in despite numerous phone calls to the bell captain (who didn't answer their phone) and then to guest services. On checkout we took our own luggage downstairs after waiting over 1/2 hour for the porter to attend and having given up. The hotel was obviously busy however I have stayed at other busy hotels many times that have adequate staff to cope with the demand - this was clearly not so in this case. Lets face it if they treat their staff the way they treat their guests I wouldn't work for them!! Breakfast was complimentary to our room rate however when we traipsed over to the other tower for breakfast there were 50+ people waiting to be seated and we were told the wait would be an hour to be seated. The rooms were clean however the decor is tired - circa 1980's and the bathroom was tired also. There were empty plastic bottles (obviously form the previous guests) left in the room on our arrival. We had a late departing flight with private car transfer to the airport so left our luggage at the Meritus in storage. Our driver was to collect us from the Meritus at 8.45pm. He attended at 8.30 pm and was told by the Meritus staff that we had left for the airport (even though they had our bags still!!). Fortunately for us he waited anyway and we left as arranged. Our driver told us that comments such as ours were common in people staying at this hotel. If you are considering staying at this hotel my advise to you is DON'T DO IT!!!!! There has got to be a better one than this in Singapore that is central.

Reviews.Title: “Building Site”
Reviews.Author: Neil86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing major work. We have stayed here before and the rooms are nice but do not stay here until the work is completed. Unless you get put in the wing where the work is not being done ie not the Orchard Wing or unless you get put on the top floors you will hear the noise from the construction work which starts around 9am and finishes around 7pm. We were on the 13th Floor but made sure we were moved as the noise was too great to sleep etc. We were upgraded and couldn't hear it on the 27th floor but you're taking a risk if you stay here at this time. I would book somewhere else for now. Staff as always were great and breakfast excellent etc. it's just the construction and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Experience”
Reviews.Author: tigerair
Reviews.Content: Hotel surrounding having renovation,but causes inconvenience to the guest & patron. Good location hotel, but services need a upgrade!!! Very bad services from bell staff. deliveries of luggage takes a very long time, as the staff travel a long journey from one tower to the other. Luggage black in colour upon reaching the room became white, due to the amount of dust, it collected travelling from one location to another, suspect might be going thru' the renovation site..... Poor staffing planning, not enough service staff at the outlet, also no smiling face from the service crew. End of the day, was a good reputation hotel but turns into a low-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just bad luck, or is the Meritus in decline?”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_NW_Italy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, on business, from Dec 2 to 6. The first time I stayed here, in 2006, I had a most enjoyable experience: my deluxe (=standard) room was in the Grand tower, large, well appointed and with modern Asian decoration; and I saw high standards of service and hospitality all the time. Now, just two year on, it seemed a different hotel. A relatively impersonal welcome, no non smoking king size bedroom available at checkin. On their proposal to accept a smoking room to have a king size bed, I accepted as in my experience, smoking floors in most good hotels have no appreciable smell. Bad decision - I was wrong. The so called deluxe room in the South tower was smelly, medium sized, furnished like a 1980’s Hilton, and with a queen size bed at best, and even modest bedding linen. To my disappointment, I quickly found two long female hairs in the bathroom (the cleaner’s, I guess). My first breakfast at the Mandarin Ballroom was just barely ok, with unattentive service by distracted waiters. Large choice but amazingly no jam/marmalade anywhere unless you asked, and if you do so they bring you one small jar only… For the first time in my life, I reported my early disappointing experiences to the manager on the feedback form three nights before leaving. On day 3 I even had to give up breakfast: a long queue for seating was being handled by just one poor lady, left alone by a number of lazy staff. After a ten minute wait and recognizing I would not have made it in time, I gave up but did contact the manager on duty to complain and at least recoup the breakfast share of my room rate. Later on that day I received an email with apologies from the hotel manager who offered my to exchange my room (too late) and to be a guest at the executive clubroom for drinks and breakfast on the final morning (I accepted the latter). This was one of the few professional gestures I observed during my stay. Well, there may have been other satisfactory moments and aspects, but at the Meritus Mandarin due to my experience and expectations, I expected a flawless Asian experience. There's lots of renovation going on, with consequences such as main lobby not in use, gym temporarily set up in conference rooms, and pool not available, but this is short term and more understandable. This time overall the Meritus looked more like a tourist class hotel, despite its ambition to be much more than that. Not sure if I’ll give them another chance, with so many good hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: lou_lou_in_hk
Reviews.Content: i was a walk-in and stayed for 2 nights at SDG350 a night. it was a friend's wedding and it seems like a good occasion to splurge on hotel to hang out with friends. the room is really nice and spacious. clean with good linen and mattress. the shower was quite impressive, with the many spa nozzle spraying out - fun but slightly too painful for me to appreciate. the location couldnt be better. opposite is Hereen shopping center, and Cineleisure on the right. The other major shopping centers are just about 5 minutes away with Orchard and Somerset MRT stations also 5 minutes away. You can dump your shopping bags and resume your shopping crusade easily.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly and bright”
Reviews.Author: dutchkiwi
Reviews.Content: Why bright in the title? For the most stunning outfits you can imagine. The ladies at the reception wear dresses in the most beautiful red. Stunning. The hotel rooms have gone through a "soft" refurbishment and have been brought up to a good standard. They are spacious and well furnished. This trip, I booked taking advantage of the Singapore Airlines Stop over package of which I must say, as a frequent traveller to Singapore, I wonder why I have not done that before. You can book via the Singapore Airlines website, pre pay and take advantage of some very good rates. It includes a free airport transfer, discounts on food and beverage in the hotel where you are staying and discounts on local attractions. Great value for money and I will do that again in the future. Back to the hotel review, the Meritus is going through a renovation of the public areas on the Orchard Road side but I must say, management is trying to keep the inconvenience to the minimum. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great, right on Orchard Road, with plentiful access to public transport and of course the shopping district. The pool is closed due to renovations but shuttles are provided to the Marina Bay Mandarin where the pool can be used. I had lunch at the Pine Court Chinese restaurant which has some fantastic dishes, I really enjoyed that. Breakfast is served at the restaurant on the top floor which has great views of Singapore. The quality of the buffet was a bit disappointing and needs to be looked at as it is a bit of a let down. I choose, despite the Singapore Stop Over 50% discount to have breakfast in town. Overall a good and enjoyable stay and I will do the Stopover Holiday next time around again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ErlBigGirl
Reviews.Content: Lovely, lovely hotel.. Concierge, Front Desk and Housekeeping staff were all very professional. Rooms are fab.. bathroom's a bit old school.. Location is good, it's walking distance from a shopping mall and it's short distance by cab from the main centre. Enjoyed our stay! Defo recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “loved the food and room but bad service”
Reviews.Author: blackmartini
Reviews.Content: we all loved the breakfast buffet, the rooms were modern and new but their service was bad. we arrived at 12nn and our rooms werent ready yet, they said 2pm but turned over the rooms at passed 5pm. Way too much! they didnt offer anything to compensate. they dont have express lane for check out, we had to line up together with the people checking in. more bad service..... i will never come back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Too much construction!”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I originally had a deluxe room but then moved to a premier room. Although the deluxe is quite nice and modern, the premier has flat screen tv, seperate shower and much more luxurious decor. The hotel is in a fantastic location! But my stay was ruined by the renovations going on in the lobby. Going to and from my room was a unpleasant experience. I wish they had warned me before I made a booking. There is just so much construction going on in Orchard Road that the whole experience was not nice. Very dusty, noisy and ugly. I also was planning on having some day spa treatments however the day spa was not open. They sent someone to my room for a massage. She did not speak english and did not have a massage table! She then did the entire massage over the towell (ie. her hands did not touch my skin). Very strange. She also turned up 15 minutes late. The Cantonese restaurant looks like it is stuck in the 70's - both in decor and food. Not nice. And getting from the lift into this restaurant I had to dodge ladders, tools and workmen. Unnacceptable really. The shopping centre inside this hotel was closed also, and will be for quite some time. Overall, my room was very beautiful and comfortable and the views from the higher floors are great. But don't stay here until their renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Building Site Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: gilbpar
Reviews.Content: Reviewer, Guest. 4 night stay. 20-25/10/08 If you wish to have a hotel in the middle of a building site then this is the one to chose. Reconstruction of the hotel will be completed , according to the notice on boarding up panels which were almost fully around the outside of the hotel , is the last quarter of 2009 !. The advertised facilities such as a swimming pool, bars and restaurants are no longer available. Due to the closers, just to have breakfast our morning trek to the reassigned restaurant required coming down from the 20th floor to the 5th , changing lifts and returning back to the 37 floor in another part of the building. Because of the confusion with the lift system numerous staff were placed at strategic points to redirect lost guests past the boarded up shops and swiming pool.. (and there were many !) . Exiting and entering the hotel was extremely dangerous due to workmen overhead welding and fixing panels to the front of the building. Their equipment also blocked off most of the pavement adding another danger to the chaos and noise around the lobby area. On the plus side, the rooms were comfortable and well serviced. The heavily stained carpets were a bit of an ‘off put’ though. Room service took 1.5 hours to arrive after having to ring twice to find if it was being delivered at all. The excuse was, wait for it, the lift had broken down! The 5 Star Hotel rating, well may have been at one time but now is, just a joke.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MargNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I can not speak highly enough for the time that we spent there... We were located on the 30th floor, club lounge, express check-in...high tea, cocktails etc....our room was totally amazing... Management should be extremely pleased with there staff they were always friendly, helpfull, always a smile on there faces, always asking if there was anything they could do for us.. I would highly recommend anyone to stay, especially in the meritus club/club lounge Marg

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Snappy”
Reviews.Author: carrache
Reviews.Content: This is my first choice for comfort and luxury in Singapore. The location is top notch, the decor can't be beat. The rooms are slick and modern, although the slightly kinky window into the bathroom leaves me scratching my head. I would express concern with the staff, who in my experience are perhaps less than entirely gracious and hospitable, but this is a minor complaint. This may not be the best value for the dollar in the world, but it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Rich1974
Reviews.Content: Singapore was the last stop of our honeymoon and i must say i should have chosen this hotel in the first place. The hotel i had originally booked was a huge mistake but the Meritus Mandarin made up for the one night we lost staying at the other place which shall remain nameless. This hotel has an excellent location. The external of the hotel was under some refurbishment but this did not disturb us at all. There was loads of shopping around to keep us busy all day for the 5 nights we stayed there. We booked on-line and noted we were on our honeymoon. The hotel was kind eniough to give us an upgrade and a nice room over looking Ochard Road. Thanks!! The hotel room itself was very nice with a big screen Tv and the shower had water jets to help massage your aching muscles after all the shopping we did. The morning newspaper hanging on our door handle in the morning was a pleasant bonus and everything was very clean and impressive. Price wise Singapore is on par with Australia but it is a very clean city with lots of green trees and parks around which definately puts it up with some of the best cities in the world. The Singaporean people were a highlight of our trip. Everybody we spoke to went out of thier way to help. The taxis are a cheap and efficient way of getting around and we definately use them to excess. If you are visiting Singapore and want a very nice hotel to stay at i would reccommend this one! My wife and I will be returning to Singapore and this will be our hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Downunder”
Reviews.Author: boomerue
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at this hotel over night, and we found the room was very good, the staff were ecellent, we would stay here again, the people at the hotel were so nice, the room was not big but it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Plae To Stay”
Reviews.Author: savblanc
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was fantastic, we loved the location, ideal for most places that we wanted to visit, walked to Raffles, and got the Singapore hop on to go to the Botanical Gardens. We ate in the Ground Floor restaurant, and found it to be exceptional value. I can definitely recommend the prawn and mango salad. We were here as a stopover on our way to Perth, WA, and we found it to be totally relaxing, the beds were very comfy and we relaxed by the pool, weather permitting, it really set us up for onward trip and we were well rested and relaxed when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: sludge68
Reviews.Content: Had read mixed reviews so unsure what to expect. On arrival, staff very friendly, our luggage was whisked away as soon as we arrived and came up to our room not long after we got there. Room was very pleasant, clean and spacious. The free bottles of water proved to be very handy! Would definately stay there again. Restaurants are expensive - but have found this to be the case in any hotel. Singapore proved generally to be expensive for dining, especially alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “Next Station >>> Meritus Mandarin!!”
Reviews.Author: beau_u
Reviews.Content: I booked deluxe room from my travel agent Luckily, they upgrade me to Meritus Club (don't konw why and i didnt pay anything more) The room is very nice (see my photos) with quality pillow Many things that I impress -pillow -work table -many amenities!!!!!!! -green peace bags -apples however, i think they should change toilet (flush&bath) anyway, everyhing is imprssed Next station >>> meristus mandarin

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loeane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Meritus Mandarin for 3 nights in February 2008. This is an overall average hotel, but the fact that we paid circa SGD 700 per room per night; we felt it is not worth it. Do try elsewhere within Orchard Road. Our main complain for our room and stay in Meritus Mandarin are the "ugly smell" & "bad odours" on our pillows and poorly served breakfast. We doubt we will ever return to this hotel again, unless we get a better deal. Besides this hotel has the busiest hotel lobby ever due to the large number of rooms in Meritus Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Big-Cat
Reviews.Content: First of all I will just say the nights I spent here were the most comfortable sleeps I have ever had. I thought I was sleeping on a cloud. The rest of the room (floor 17) was great as well, nicely decorated - TV needed updating but it only got used twice. The bathroom is fantastic marble which I love. Room seemed small but it did have two double/queen beds in it so I guess it would of seemed bigger had it just been the one bed. In room safe which is great and a reasonably pleasent view of the city. Beer was overpriced in the hotel. Loss of points there. The pool was great. I believe it was on the fifth floor in between the two towers. Looked great and there was also a spa, sauna, gym and steam room which were fantastic on the 30-somthing floor. Service/Staff: Fantastic! So friendly to others I have come across in Singapore. Pool, cleaning, reception and catering staff were so friendly and helpful in every aspect. On a few occasions I was asked to leave the foyer area by door staff but this was probably due to the fact I had slept on the floor of a tokyo apartment the last week after consuming 100 beers a day - so I looked pretty awful and understood them asking me to leave. And they were very apologetic afterwards. Location Location Location: Staying on Orchad Road is a must. It is close to everything you want to be close to. Looks great at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bluwes
Reviews.Content: A lot has already been said about this hotel but we thought it was a great place to stay for getting about, however the hotel which is in the middle of a refurbishment definately needed it It was our first port of call on route to a month in Oz .We had 4 nights and the location is great to explore Singapore. We were in the Grand Tower overlooking Orchard Rd and were there for Chinese new year. Having had a late night in Chinatown to see in the new year we were woken by lion dancers and drummers on the forecourt of the hotel at 8 am,!! well we were'nt there to sleep were we? Agree with the comments about the girls wandering around reception smiling but not understanding much english, couldnt understand what they were there for other than to look pretty. We have stayed at the Pan Pacific on a previous trip, pity you couldnt move that hotel and replace this one

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location and Location”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel few times during my frequent trip to Singapore. There are two towers, the north and the south. The south has cheaper rate because the rooms are mostly old, but well maintained. They are doing renovation to the old rooms. The north tower is considerably new, the interior design is very oriental. The main point of this hotel is the LOCATION. Right in the heart of Orchard rd, next to Takashimaya and Paragon, no other hotel can beat this one. The service are good, nothing to complain during my few trips there.

Reviews.Title: “Rapid descent downhill!!”
Reviews.Author: Astatine
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel over the last 15 years, probably about 18 times in all. Originally, it was an excellent hotel, with many staff who had been their a long time, things worked, check-in and -out was civilised and reservations honoured. Last year, the hotel, its staff and facilities were noticeably shaky, and this year they were appalling. On check in (de luxe king room, Grand Tower) we were told that this tower was closed, and were shown a pokey room in the south tower. The porter advised us to try again, and I spoke to a manager, who immediately changed the booking to that which we had ordered. It is noticeable that despite renovations, the carpets are tired, worn and nasty, and the old staff have been replaced by young recruits from China, and this is the same situation in reception. There are a lot of these girls in distinctive red cheongsams hanging around the lobby, grinning, but unable to answer any query. I speak some Mandarin, and their origin was apparent. We shall not be staying there any more. Regarding breakfast, walk across Orchard Rd to Starbucks, instead of an expensive scrum in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: GrahamG
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a mini tour, (see also Amari Coral Beach, Phuket & Royal Orchid Sheraton, Bangkok). We arrived at 08.30 and although check in time is 14.00 our South Tower room, (2461) was ready by 10.30. Room was ok and spotless, yes carpet looks a bit tired but you don't eat off or sleep on the carpet. Bed was really comfortable and bathroom with double basins very nice. We didn't bother with breakfast apart from final morning when it was complimentary. Location was perfect for us right on Orchard Road and just 5mins from the MRT. As a base for a tourist in Singapore we found it perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the class location but inefficient staffs”
Reviews.Author: tannsx
Reviews.Content: we're 2 girls traveling together so safety is our priority,i used to have chicken rice at renowned Chatterbox on the ground floor last year and found the lobby atmosphere was not very good,always crowded with lots of tourists and staffs were never seem to be enough to handle the jobs.But i booked this hotel anyway from safety purpose because the hotel situated at the very heart of Orchard,right next to Takashimaya so if we're talking about location,Meritus Mandarin comes the first choice! My luggages were delayed so i had to checked in without any luggaged,i already told front desk that luggages were on their way and i would wait until i got my luggages which would arrive around 2-3am.Any i waited and waited to find out from the airport that the hotel rejected my luggages because they didn't look hard enough to find my name in the guest list!!!!So the luggages were 10hr delayed and all the front desk staff said was that she had no idea.when i asked when i checked with the front desk staff regarding to the extra toiletteries i might need because we had nothing at the moment,the lady just nodded to her right and said that 7/12 shop is on our right.I shouldn't have asked her!!! I really wonder what the housekeeping is for? But still,if talking about location and ignore inefficient staffs.I still prefer to stay in Meritus Mandarin.Usually if i travel with more people,Oriental Hotel at Marina Bay offers 5stars service with the same price though Next time i'll just stick to Oriental Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust them!”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller95
Reviews.Content: We called the Meritus Mandarin directly and were quoted a rate for a 'family suite' which was comprised of two adjoining rooms of S$420 per night, a rate slightly less than the rate their sister hotel (the Meritus Marina) charges (we've stayed there before). When we checked in the rate on our check-in sheet clearly stated this rate. Upon check out their story suddenly changed and they claimed that we now needed to pay $420 PER ROOM! Worse, they said there was no such thing as a family suite and that we were lying when we said we had been quoted this. I've never seen management so stubborn and difficult to deal with - they refused to accept ANY responsibility and they made no concession. BEWARE - don't trust them. Not only did they pull the wool over our eyes in the first place - but the way they dealt with our case demonstrated that they had none of the professional manner you would expect out of a reputable hotel. Go with a hotel chain you can trust!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Singapore standards, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Goodyear07
Reviews.Content: The Meritus Manadarin on Orchard Rd. mainly benefits from its prime location on Singapore's main shopping street next to the Takashimaya shopping mall. Upon check-in we experienced the poor customer service of the Meritus Mandarin. Our confirmed bookings (via a reliable hotel reservation website) was allegedly not available in the hotel system and the hotel staff was not able and/or willing to sort the problem in an acceptable timeframe. It took more than 2 months and for the hotel to finally acknowledge its error and reimburse us the difference to the originally booked rooms. The hotel staff in general was lacking a smile and did not show any signs of hospitality (Service improves however if you stay in Executive Club rooms) Our executive club rooms was unspectacular and what you usually expect in a standard business hotel. The cleanliness of the rooms was ok in general, but some surfaces were dusty. Breakfast and High Tea in the Exective Club was quite good, nevertheless the choice of food was very limited. Due to the small Executive Club area it also felt very crowded in the morning. Internet in the Club area is free and fast enough. Overall the Meritus Manadarin definitely is not up to the usually high standards in Singapore and its price/performance ratio could be improved considerably.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed !!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbarajohn
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel late (due to flight arrival) we were given a twin connecting room at the back of the building... we had booked a deluxe room double no smoking.. when we complained at the desk on arrival they said they could only offer us a smoking room which the housekeeper would spray!! they said the hotel was fully booked (1200 rooms!) we booked in august 2007 and the booking was confirmed with breakfast but on arrival they said it was room only... next morning they offered us a room change to a king size room which was actually just a normal double... the breakfast problem was never rectified they kept telling us to sort it out.. with the agent in london... needless to say it was not worth it by the time we rang and the cost of the phone call, it was cheaper to buy our breakfast elsewhere.. we had breakfast on the first morning at the hotel, which was cold. absolutely not worth the cost 36.00 SGD... the room was clean......although I did mention twice that the hairdryer was not in the room and twice the housekeeper was supposed to have looked into it, but we never did get the hairdryer.. location excellent, on orchard road.. would stay there again but absolute clarification needed before booking ...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WLDGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 2 nights in November - it was a stop off on our way to Australia. We really liked the Meritus Mandarin. We had a nice room in the Grand Tower with a good view onto Orchard Road. The room was clean and very spacious. The location of the hotel is very good, among the main shopping area and right next to an MRT station (such an efficient public transportation system). I agree with of the other reviewers, the pool area is not much to look at so don't stay there if your looking to relax by the pool! We loved Singapore so much, it's a fantastic place and would love to go back and would be happy to stay in the Meritus Mandarin again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjdallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in transit. The hotel is very nice. We were with a group and our check in was handled efficiently. The hotel is near Orchard Road which is a prime shoppping area. Designer stores, shopping malls,outdoor cafes and restaurants are minutes away. Can't say much else because we were here only one night but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “By the Numbers”
Reviews.Author: Tr4v3ller
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Singapore at other hotels several times, we were offered a late deal by our travel agent at the Meritus Mandarin. On arrval the reception area is a very grand affair but lacks a personal touch, staff all seem to be working from a script so old they have forgotten it. The rooms, in the Grand Tower at least, are comfortable and a good size, if a little worn. Location wise the hotel is ideally placed, midway along Orchard road, shoppers and spendaholics paradise! If you are not shopping, the pool and deck areas are in serious need of a sprucing up but to be honest this hotel fulfills it's role for shoppers and business people alike - it's not a destination resort, but a reasonable place to stay while you do other things. We'll look to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “really dreadful -think again”
Reviews.Author: shawspice
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were allocated a non smoking room- walked in to find a full ashtray and a dreadful smell of smoke.The room was in a real need of an upgrade (very eighties in decor) Bathroom less than clean. The hotel is in dire need of a refurb-there is not spa, no sauna or steam room -all are closed and being upgraded. Staff are less than pleasant, When we complained we were in a large queue of people complaining about their allocated rooms. It took persistance and patience to achieve a move to another room.

Reviews.Title: “A four at most”
Reviews.Author: PhTravelling_Guy
Reviews.Content: The Meritus Mandarin bills itself as a luxury hotel. I beg to differ. It is, at most, a 4-star hotel rather than the 5-star it claims. While the lobby may be termed "grand" it isn't awe inspiring. (I do have to remark, however, that the hotel staff manning the floor from any number of nationalities - Sing-Chinese, to Indian, to Filipino, to European - does imbibe the hotel with an international feel, even if the hotel seems to be patronized by mainland Chinese tourists more than any other nationality.) The standard rooms are spacious, clean and well decorated. The bathrooms are nice. The double sinks will undoubtedly delight couples and people sharing a room. That having been said, the faux wood grain "wallpaper" used to paper the cabinets are unworthy of a true 5-star hotel. The fact that the hotel is huge and housed in two architecturally non-descript towers, thereby leading to a degree of impersonality, detracts further from any claim to true 5-star status. Chatterbox claims to be the home of Hainese Chicken Rice. Maybe. But here's an open secret - you can get chicken rice that's just as good, if not better, that costs much less at other places in Singapore. (Be warned, however, that if you want ambience along with your chicken rice, you're not likely to get it from these other places.) What's the best thing about the Meritus? Location. It's located right in the middle of Orchard Road, Singapore's main shopping area. Given that, the worst thing about the Meritus, the faux wood grain wallpaper, can be forgiven.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Overall Stay was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jas32
Reviews.Content: We bought an airlines vacation/tour package from Manila and picked this hotel based on a recommendation from a relative. The choice was quite good and our stay was very pleasant. Upon check in, we were offered a 2-twin bed room in spite our earlier request for a queen or king sized bed. We had to wait for a couple of hours but we were told that we will be given an upgraded room (still at the South Tower, not the Grand Tower) with a queen sized bed (at no extra cost). The room assigned to us was well appointed, quite clean and complete with bath robes and slippers. The hotel itself was in an excellent location, right next door to the upscale Ngee Ann City Mall and across the street from 3-4 other malls on Orchard Rd. It is also located about a block away from the Orchard subway stop. The breakfast buffet at the hotel's Chatterbox restaurant was quite good with a great variety of food available from western to Asian fare. Some variation was also seen from day to day so it is not the same thing all the time. At approx S$30 (US$20) it was quite expensive. Good thing daily breakfast was included in our tour package. Otherwise the food courts at Ngee Ang and Paragon would have been excellent alternatives. Overall, this hotel was quite nice, had great service and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Gez_egen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Meritus Mandarin. It's at Orchard road where all the big malls are. Great location for shopping. There is a metro station close by and taxi is very cheap so getting around is easy. The room is spacious and good. We didnt take breakfast , starbucks is just across the orchad road. Nothing special for the hotel, a bit pricey look for the promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britishvisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meritus Mandarin at the start of September. Our room, in the newer of the two towers, was clean and spacious. Reception was very efficient. Depending what time you have breakfast, the 'Chatterbox' restaurant lives up to its name and can be noisy but there is a very good range of food available. Internet access at the hotel is expensive at (roughly) £3 for 15 minutes. However, the overall cost of staying here is realtively inexpensive compared to some of the Singapore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jpdx
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Shangri-La or the Oriental, but during the National Day celebrations, those weren't available, so we picked a "Premier Room" at the Meritus Mandarin. What an unfortunate choice! The hotel is huge, and as early as during the check-in process it becomes evident that the place is run based on a motto Seinfeld fans will remember from Kroger Industrial Smoothing -- "We don't care, and it shows." The staff seem disinterested (or incompetent), and everything at the hotel is geared toward mass-tourism -- no significant service to speak of. Room design is very spartan, and rooms show wear-and-tear. The breakfast buffet was among the most disappointing we ever experienced in Asia; "uninspired" might be the appropriate euphemism to describe the taste and quality of the food, "very limited choice" describes the quantity. Singapore is a city with many great hotels. The Meritus Mandarin is not one of them. If you are looking for shelter in a central location, and can get a room for under $150, or if your airline offers this place as a stopover hotel, you might as well stay here. If, however, you are looking for a 5* experience, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Dull”
Reviews.Author: alfie50
Reviews.Content: the only good thing is the location, perfeclty situated on orchard Road. The Hotel was advertised as being five star it certainly did not feel it i can't say there was anything bad it was just big and boring with no character room was ok as was the service clean and tidy it just lacked that certain something

Reviews.Title: “Meritus Mandarin Singapore is a great hotel for vacation or business”
Reviews.Author: chocolatevanilla
Reviews.Content: The Meritus Mandarin in Singapore is a great hotel. I stayed there for business, but I wish I had taken my wife with me. She would have loved it. At check in, I was upgraded to a suit with 2 baths (a half bath off the foyer and a huge main bath off the bedroom), and a separte living area with dining table and sofa. My suite was larger than many apartments and certainly more luxurious. There were large flat panel HD TVs in both the bedroom and in the living area. The bed and pillows were fluffy and very comfortable and the shiatzu massage chair in my bedroom was a welcome surprize that I used every day; it really helped me to relax . The decor was very luxurious and everything was very clean. There was extensive use of marble in the large foyer and in the very large main bath. A buffet breakfast was included with the room. I am usually not a fan of buffets because of marginal quality, but this one was absolutely wonderful. It was composed of both western style classics, such as eggs (cooked to perfections), pancakes, waffels, hashbrowns, a variety of sausages and breads/pastries/muffins/cereals, along with a nice variety of asian style breakfast selections (steamed and smoked fish, rice and rice pourige, etc). There was an abundance of fresh fruits available and a large variety of fresh squeezed juices (including mango, papaya, kiwi, and others plus apple and orange juice, but even the apple juice was freshly squeezed). The freshly squeezed juices were a special treat; I drank 4 or 5 glasses every morning!. I hope that my company sends me back to Singapore soon so that I can stay at the Meritus Mandarin. I rate this place at least 9.5/10.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal, Bug but Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: The main thing going for this hotel is clearly the central location. Otherwise it is just a huge, impersonal hotel without a lot of charm. Because it's so big, it's a bit confusing. It took a while to find the health club but it was fine when I got there. Same with finding breakfast or my friends who were in a different tower than I was. We were in a gorgeous suite but it was close to some sort of generator which made a lot of noise. Also the design was deeply flawed. The bathroom had those trendy glass blocks in the wall. This meant that when whenever I turned on the bathroom light in the middle of the night, the whole bedroom got light and my husband was awakened. Also, I wish all hoteliers could just agree to bring back old-fashioned bedside lamps and do away with these absurd little lights or (worse) beams from the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: hazpafis
Reviews.Content: It has a great location but no good view. All I can say from outside my window is another building. It is surrounded by malls so it's a shopaholic's hotel. Beds are okay. Bathroom is fine. Electrical outlets are good and useful because I had several things that needed charging. Breakfast is good as choices are plentiful but gets tiring as same choices of food are served everyday. Staff are quite accommodating and always on hand whenever we needed taxis. Overall, it was a good stay but not my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Clar82
Reviews.Content: I visited Singapore last May with my parents and my brother and sister for a few days. We booked the Mandarin Meritus with our travel agent. We have always stayed at the Mandarin when in Singapore because of the wonderful location. The hotel is right in the middle of Orchard Road!
