In between loads of shopping trips and heavily loaded hands, we would just run across the street and drop our bags off at the concierge before running out and proceeding with shopping. Takashimaya Department Store is right across the street. That department store will already take you more than a day to cover! The Singapore Airlines office is also across the street (in Paragon Center), you can get your boarding passes 1-2 days before your flight to avoid the check-in at the airport. Really convenient! During check-in at the Mandarin, we requested for rooms next to each other. The delightful lady at the reception upgraded our room to Premier! With no extra charge! The Premier wing is absolutely beautiful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude, attitude, attitude.....”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveller
Reviews.Content: Downright nasty in fact. I booked through the hotel website and admittedly the rate was 'cheap'... well, still expensive but cheap. On arrival though, I was confronted with the receptionist who looked at the confirmation as if it had landed from Mars and told me that wasn't the correct rate, they didn't have the room agreed and I'd have to have the 'only room left in the house'..... just brilliant - not. After much too-ing and fro-ing and the refusal to allow me to speak to the front desk or duty manager, oddly enough another room was FINALLY found - and that was only because another group of people checked in beside me who strangely - got an immediate upgrade. HOWEVER, I wasn't to expect breakfast - well, the room rate I paid in advance for on the web didn't have breakfast for 3 of the nights I was staying so that didn't matter but the 4th & 5th nights did but the desk clerk refused to give me the vouchers saying 'this is an incorrect rate'.... well sweetie - may I suggest you first learn to speak English properly, second learn to read and third, I'm sure they teach you somewhere in hotel school that the customer isn't always wrong - particularly not when they're holding a piece of paper generated by YOUR HOTEL'S BOOKING SYSTEM. It might have a great location but obviously the Meritus group couldn't care less about anyone not on a tour group booking so rest assured Meritus Management, I'm back in Singapore again on Thursday and I am NOT staying with you.

Reviews.Title: “Meritus Mandarin is great”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Singapore and I would rate this among the best i have stayed for the price. Although it is not new. It is very well maintained. The breakfast was good also. Location cannot be any better. Right in the heart of orchard road and within walking distance to the train station. I like hotels who gives free drinking water. This hotel does. I hate those who make you buy overpriced mineral water. After all the rate is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsim
Reviews.Content: Premier Room on 26th floor non-smoking room. LCD TV, clean room, shower jet, tub and a little window between the room and bathroom. I stayed in a connecting room. Sounds neighboring room can still be heard, otherwise... it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Noisy Generator Next to Your Bedroom?”
Reviews.Author: HardshipPosting
Reviews.Content: If you stay at the Meritus Manadrin Singapore, make sure you don't get a room anywhere near the 19th floor of the Grand Tower! That's where they have a generator that runs 24 hours a day. I was allocated a room on the 20th floor - there the generator noise is louder than conversation in your room, and you can even feel the floor and furniture vibrate. By the time I got back to reception, they told me they had no other rooms available, so I had to spend one night there. It's hard to sleep, even with ear plugs! There were other problems too - service was very slow (I think they don't have enough staff) and mostly rather unfriendly. The TV in my room had an intermittant fault, the basin did not drain properly, and the kettle lead came out of the plug in my hands. All in all, not my first choice next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Maryana
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location of this hotel. Great spacious room, very comfortable bed, super attentive stuff, and good food. The pool is nothing special, but I do not think you are in Singapore for leisure time at the pool anyway. We will definitely recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: AJLCA
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at our hotel at 2.00am we were greeted with a warm friendly smile from Victor at the reception desk. I reqested a non smoking room but the only one available was listed as a honeymoon room, rather the the standard room we had booked. No problem for us, they were happy to give us the upgrade. A beautiful room with a fresh fruit platter and a fantastic view from the 30th Floor. The king size bed was soooo comfortable with super size feather pillows and plenty of luxury products in the bathroom. Breakfast at the Chatterbox bistro was a buffet style with everything that you could possibly want and then some more for good measure. The staff were always friendly and helpful and the food was really good, just what you need for a big day of shopping or sight seeing. I would certainly stay here again. We used the gym facilities and the pool during our stay and were not disappointed. This hotel is certainly worth including on your next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: xaak
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights (2 ad. +2 children) in two connecting rooms using the SIA stopover Holiday. We arrived very early (~8:00am), after 11h travel from Athens, and we get our rooms immediatly!!!! The rooms were very comfortable and the management of the Hotel send us a bithday cake for my wife's BirthDay (I didn't arrange anything; propably their system searches for birthdays). It was a very good surpise.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stopover”
Reviews.Author: haystacks
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Trailfinders as a prelude to a tour of Malaysia. I honestly can't find anything bad to say about the place. It's well positioned on Orchard Road for shopping, the rooms are well-sized, clean and comfortable and the breakfast was OK in the (public) restaurant. For the price we paid, we were pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “No way!”
Reviews.Author: mosquita
Reviews.Content: In a city full of great hotels I am gobsmacked that this hotel can exist. I stayed on the Executive Floor at the ridiculous price of SGD 360 - More than the Oriental for goodness sake! Horrible pool area, poor breakfast. They put a family with screaming children across from me and persisted in keeping the door open throughout the day - I'd asked for a quiet room and paid extra for an Exec floor room for this! My room looked like a Chinese brothel, all shiny, mirrored, small, with a plastic massage chair squeezed in. Overcharged for internet. Dull bathroom. Just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and oldfasioned first impression”
Reviews.Author: DanishTurist
Reviews.Content: Stayd there 7-10 3, in a Singapore stop over packet, but its not worth, not to upgrade! The rooms looked oldfasioned, and with a realy ugly carpet, that made the impression very untidy, cause you culdnt see if the floor were clean or not. Stange furnishing, with a long sofa by one wall under the windows with nothing in front of it. Looked like a motel, and with very dull and un insireing beige colours everywhere. The bathroom only with bathtup, so you have to climb in and out for a shower. The breakfast too cramped and a little messy, and not very much western food,but a lot of choises for the big chinese amount of residents. The pool area extraordinary boring, one did not get any motivation to stay there. Next time we get an upgrade, and stay at the Shangri-la or Ritz instead, so little pricedifference.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city, but still had jaded views.”
Reviews.Author: Fishmonger1976
Reviews.Content: Been really busy/lazy to post this review after my stay in Singapore, but visiting the city was worth it. However, checking in was a bit of a mission. The desk clerk wasn't actually helpful when there wasn't a non-smoking room available. He automatically suggested an upgrade, of which we had to pay for. We had to firmly suggest he look for an alternative instead of paying for the upgrade. We had to accept a smoking room, but upon arriving in the room, there was no hint of smoke. Suggesting that their stuff do actually work hard to keep the rooms clean. Food as other reviewers and guides books mention are as good as they say, esp. Hawker centers. We had our buffet breakfast at the hotels cafe/restuarant, great choice, but some foods werent as fresh as they could be, french toast for starters was chewy! SMOG! be careful, as it was very bad that week we was there. I have never seen smog that thick, even with fog in London. But, the smog was only heavy 1 whole day, and the remaining 3 days, the smog was only bad early morning. Those with breathing problems should be careful. However, the Singaporean government cannot control their counterparts in Indonesia. My girlfriend and I opted for a standard room, but my photo's should show you a room thats a lot larger than what you might expect. About 3 times as larger as that in the Shinjuku Prince in Tokyo, for those of you who may have stayed there before. I have posted a review of that stay yet either, but might just upload the photo's instead.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth coming back”
Reviews.Author: london_pinay
Reviews.Content: I spent my chinese new year holiday in SIngapore at Meritus Mandarin. I must say, they really deliver a 5 star treatment to their guests! All our requests were taken care of in a matter of minutes, even if we phoned them up in the middle of the midnight asking to get our sink fixed! (that's the only problem we had when we stayed there). All the hotel staff were very courteous and always happy to help the guests. Our room was a good size twin, with a separate shower and bath. The facilities were great, although we didn't get to use them much as we were out of the hotel most of the time. We had lunch at the hotel's Triple 3 buffet restaurant and it was worth every penny. Very good selection of food (and lots of it too!). I wish I didn't have breakfast that morning so I had enough space in my tummy to fit in all that food! We would have had dinner at the hotel's Top of the M revolving restaurant that night but i was so full until that evening that we just ended up having coffee at starbucks right accross the hotel. I would also recommend Mezebar, the hotel's Asian Tapas Bar if you want to spend a cozy night at the bar. I tell you, you'll never go hungry in that hotel because they also have the Chatterbox Coffeehouse which is open 24hrs. (i think..) I sampled their famous mandarin chicken and it was really tasty and very tender. The location is perfect for first time travellers in Singapore (like me!). The hotel is right in the heart of Orchard Road where all the major shops are! Esprit for example, is right beside the hotel. Starbucks and HSBC bank right across the road. The hotel is literally surrounded by shopping malls, which some of them are open until 2am! which you never see in London! Imagine, starbucks open for 24hrs! (haven!). The nearest MRT station is Somerset, a few steps away from the hotel so you can travel to anyplace you want anytime, although getting a cab won't cost you much anyway if you want to save your energy and go straight to where you want to go. I found that streets in Singapore are very safe even at night. We were out every night, until 3am without any worries. All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Meritus Mandarin Hotel in Singapore. I highly recommend it to everybody. Until now, i still can't stop telling my friends and family how excellent that hotel was! When I go back to Singapore, I would defintely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: centrum
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during transit periods twice between january and february. it is a very nice clean 5 star. lobby is huge but not too many places to sit. located on orchard road so tons of shopping. we had a premier room, nice view of orchard rd. bed and pillows comfy. the first time we stayed there were dirt marks on bedsheets, but that was taken care of. bathroom was nice a sparkling with separate soaking tub and shower stall. washcloths and plenty of towels available. fresh fruit upon arrival, plasma screen tv, cordless phone. services was great. the first time we ordered breakfast it was 15 min late and cold. after complaints, the next time we ordered it was exactly on time. everything is clean about this hotel. expensive internet tho.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: finella_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meritus Mandarin's South Tower in mid-January, on the return leg of a journey from Australia to the UK. The stay unfortunately compared unfavourably with my experience of Traders -- the bathrooms were a bit dated, the bathroom toiletries were of very average quality, there were hairs in the bathroom bidet, the room was larger than at Traders but slightly less well-appointed, the minibar was stocked with next to nothing, and the quality of the room service food was definitely disappointing. There were a couple of upsides: fresh fruit was waiting in the room when I arrived, the room had a good view of the night-time lights of downtown Singapore, and I found the hotel staff to be polite and helpful. However, on balance, I'd prefer to stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: misssusita
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay in this hotel. I was greeted at the door and taken to the check-in desk. Upon arriving in my room, in the South Tower, I was met by the housekeeper who welcomed me to my room and showed me how everything worked. The room was very well decorated and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was also well decorated and clean. The first morning I accidentally locked myself in the room, I telephoned houskeeping and within minutes someone arrived to fix the lock. The location of this hotel is great with a number of large shopping malls within walking distance. Breakfast in Chatterbox was superb lots of choices, only a little expensive, but set me up for a days sightseeing. The staff in the bars and restaurants were very attentive and helpful. All in all a very enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Meritus”
Reviews.Author: BTang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for 4 nights in Nov. Very clean, modern and spacious room. Beds were especially comfortable. Great central location on Orchard Road and we couldn't hear any noise from outside. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. However, the bar prices are very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but expensive and noisy......”
Reviews.Author: petejigsaw
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is marvellously convenient, we didn't feel we got value for money, or treated with the respect expected for customers paying almost £100 per night. Having just been refurbished, the hotel offered good quality rooms with excellent fittings, lifts etc. However, being situated on the busy Orchard Road, it is noisy outside, so why they didn't fit double glazing during the refurb is a puzzle. We stayed on the 26th floor, and even there the noise from the road below was noticeable, as was the din of roof mounted air-con on adjacent buildings. The staff were reasonable, but often overbearing and lacked the friendliness that Singapore is famed for. All in all, a reasonable hotel, but there is better available for less....

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HectorHughMunro
Reviews.Content: It's a good location. Didn't feel like a 5 star with the room decoration seeming a little tired when we were there. We booked an extra night when we were there and cheekily, the hotel added service charge to the rate that they quoted us. If you need extra nights, book it on the internet. The restaurant on the ground floor was good. We'd go again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “great location but average”
Reviews.Author: kathygirl2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meritus Mandarin for three days. We were allowed to check-in even though it was not yet 2PM (we got there around 1PM). Our group occupied 7 rooms but 2 of the rooms were not ready and we were informed that the rooms would be ready in an hour. We crossed the street to have lunch at the Paragon Mall but when we came back our companion's rooms were still not ready (this was around 5PM already). Anyway, we stayed in the South Tower and the rooms were big enough, clean but sparsely decorated. I think that this hotel claims to be 5 star but in reality it is only a 3.5 or at best a 4. The location however is definitely 5 star as it is right smack in the middle of Orchard Road and next to Ngee Ann City Mall and near two MTR stations (Orchard and Somerset). Breakfast was average, not much to choose from. Since there were a lot of people staying at the hotel, you had to take breakfast early otherwise it will be difficult to find a table. On our last day, we requested for a late check-out (2PM) and was granted. Overall, our stay was pleasant enough and I would consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful frontdesk”
Reviews.Author: bestofasia
Reviews.Content: a hotel with good rooms (though a bit costly for what it offers) and excellent location. however, frontdesk staff are very insincere when it comes to actually assisting their guests. sure....they are good in surface services like greetings and manners etc, but in terms of value service, they are hardly interested or perhaps, do not possess the skill to handle matters. i had requested for a 1 night extension of stay, and was willing to upgrade to a more expensive room as they wre fully booked for the deluxe room. however, they were more interested in reminding me at least 15 times that they are overbooked (and they were arrogant and proud of that too) and did not hear out my request. as a result, they actually gave my room away and i had to shift to another hotel (which they were not interested to assist me in finding...i had to do it myself at 1.30am). what would have been a good stay was tarnished by the undertrained frontdesk staff. disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Packedmybags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand tower which i've heard is a 5 star hotel and it does live up to its name even if there are a few problems. Plenty of staff, a lot of trainees which was slightly unhelpful. a few were rude eg one doorman closed door in my face which was unexpected. there was very loud (and bad!) karaoke coming through the next room at 3 am in the morning but management seemed really hesitant to do anything about it and told us to put up with it which was very annoying. nice comfortable rooms but bizarre peeping tom window in bathroom. tour desk in lobby was handy. excellent location next to Takashimaya department store which has an absolutely brilliant food department. Everyone should eat all their meals there. We tried to but still only made it a third of the way through the stores. Overall, I feel the MM Singapore is a little overpriced for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. 5star”
Reviews.Author: MacPiper
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Staff were falling over themselves just to help you. Food was a bit expensive, but it is 5 star. Great views from the room, and it is right in the main shopping area. Cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quezon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 4 October to 8 October for business and pleasure. I brought along my wife because it was our 20th wedding anniversary and I thought that this would be a nice present for her since the shopping malls are very accessible from this hotel. She can go shopping while I had to do my thing for my client. I'm so glad I chose this hotel. Upon check-in (we pre-paid for a deluxe room at the Grand Tower mainly because of the reviews from this site) we were told that our room was not yet ready. We arrived there at around 1:00 pm. I inquired from the receptionist around what time the room would be available. She replied that the room MAYBE available at around 4:00 pm. I asked her why she wasn't sure about the time. She did not respond and was just looking at the computer monitor. I was slightly irritated by her non-response since I knew that I had a 5:00 pm meeting with my client that afternoon and I had to ensure that I would be able to change to my business attire. After a few minutes of looking at her computer monitor she offered us an upgrade to their Premier room for an additional $100.00 for our entire stay. I declined the offer. After again looking at her computer monitor for another minute or so, I politely told the receptionist that it was our 20th wedding anniversary and to please give us a nice room so that it would be a memorable experience for my wife. At this point, we were very surprised and happy when she informed us that she would upgrade us to their Premier room for free since it was our 20th wedding anniversary.!!!! Gosh!!! The room was very big and exquisite. It was on a high floor (rm 2808) and facing Orchard road. My wife and I really loved the asian theme. My wife and I don't normally take pictures of our hotel rooms but this was something special that we thought we could share in this website. I will not give a lengthy description of the room but instead attach some of the pictures we took of the room to give justice to the room( i.e., in case I fail to adequately describe the room here, hehehe). As you can see from the pictures, the room was absolutely perfect. No complaints about the room. Of course, I have to admit that the previous posts about Chaterbox were accurate. The breakfast buffet here was nothing to rave about. Other than that, I think that this is a great hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but not 4 or 5 star”
Reviews.Author: CKober
Reviews.Content: We staid with two children (6 and 10) in the Mandarin. Though not 'over the top' bad it was also not as good as we had been led to expect by the travela gent and its website. The location is excellent and the staff generally friendly. The service (we did not require much) was prompt and efficient. The room had a slightly worn feeling to it and there was a connecting door to another room - we noticed that our neighbours like to watch TV late at night. The charge for breakfast and for an additional bed in the room was simply outrageous. Especially given the very mediocre quality of the food in the Chatterbox. The Chatterbox boast and industrial strength air conditioner combined with an interior design of '1970s meets McDonalds': red transparent plastic panels of the cheaper kind - definitely not what you would expect in a good hotel. Staff in the Chatterbox seemed to be untrained and unrefined. Even the initial coffee often requied a special request and refills were definitely not automatic. The buffet was very poor in size and quality. The swimming pool was definitely quite different from the pictures shown in some of the more positive reviews on this page, where it is usually shown from the most advantageous angle (which makes me quite suspicious of some of these reviews). It was mostly deserted, with neither guard nor any other attendant available, definitely not a place for poolside cocktails (at least none were on offer when we were there). Overall, reasonable for a 3 star hotel but in S'pore you can get better value for similar prices elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great City”
Reviews.Author: Pingguo146
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights of our honeymoon. My husband and I loved Singapore and would definietly come back to this hotel again. When we arrived we were quite jetlagged and disoriented. There was a strange vibrating noise in our room and my husband felt uncomfotable being so high up. When we contacted reception to ask for a room change, it was no problem at all. The hotel was very busy so it did take some time to check in etc. However the staff were always friendly and helpful. I loved the room. It was decorated in contemporary asian style and very comfortable. The shower was fantastic. The other plus point of the hotel was the excellent location - right on Orchard Road. Perfect if you are a shopaholic like me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Appreciate the hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Nuttakorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in the Club Floor room when I last visit Singapore on February 2006. I am very appreciate the service that we can ask them for helping in Club Floor reception table and also they have the very kind of reception, bell boy and also the waitess. I have booked with Hotelsguru.com , I got a special prices from them. The location is very good for us, I can walk to MRT and shopping centre around there. The room is very clean and good service with internet access (add more extra money)
